loans.name: Elisa

texts.es: Elisa, natural de la ciudad de Kimbiri de 36 años de edad es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, está casada con Germán de 40 años y fruto de esa convivencia tuvieron 03 hijos a quienes desea brindarles una buena prosperidad. Elisa es el apoyo incondicional de su pareja, juntos se dedican a labrar la tierra, en su propiedad  poseen variedad de cultivos como café, cacao, plátano y palillo donde viene trabajando como 18 años como agricultora. En sus días libres cuando no existe cosecha se dedica a otros negocios en su propia vivienda, donde vende variedad de frutas de la zona como: plátano, mango, piña,  zapote  y diversidad de frutas cítricas, también aprovecha la temperatura veraniega  para  preparar sus refresco de fruta, considera que su puesto de ventas le es muy rentable porque gracias a ello puede pagar la escolaridad de sus hijos, considera que los meses de enero, febrero y marzo son estaciones desfavorables por la presencia de lluvias intermitentes razón por la cual sus cosechas disminuyen y la venta de sus frutas escasea  por los excesos derrumbes que existe en la vía de transporte. Elisa espera obtener el préstamo para mejorar su kiosco, por ello comprará andamios y mostradores  para exhibir mejor sus frutas. Con el tiempo piensa mejorar las fachadas de su vivienda para así dar estética  a su kiosco. Este será su tercer crédito y por ende necesita el apoyo de ustedes para seguir creciendo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy activa. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles del crédito comprará andamios y mostradores para colocar sus productos.
texts.en:
Elisa is from the city of Kimbiri.  She is 36 years old.  She is a cheerful, hard working woman who is married to Germán, 40.  They’ve had three children that she wants to provide a good future for.  Elisa is her spouse’s unconditional supporter.  Together they till the soil.  They have various crops on their property like coffee, cocoa beans, bananas and palillo (Peruvian plant similar to the guava tree).  She’s worked as a farmer for 18 years.

On her free days when there is no harvesting to do she undertakes other businesses at home.  She sells a variety of local fruit like: bananas, mangoes, pineapples, zapote (Sapota-tree, sapodilla, and its luscious apple-shaped fruit) and a variety of citrus fruits.  She also takes advantage of the summer season to prepare her fruit beverages.  She feels that her sales stand is very profitable because thanks to it she’s been able to pay for her children’s schooling.  She considers January, February and March to be unfavorable seasons due to the presence of intermittent rains which lead to diminished crops and less fruit sales caused by road collapses that take place along the transportation routes.

Elisa hopes to obtain the loan to improve her kiosk.  To do so, she will buy shelving and display cases to better display her fruit.  In time, she plans to improve the facades of her home to provide better appearance for her kiosk.

This will be her third loan so she needs support from all of you to continue growing.  She is a very active member of her communal bank.  She will use the 1000 new soles from the loan to buy shelving and counters to place her products.

loans.use: to buy shelving and display cases.

loans.name: Dandé Légnol Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité dandé légnol a été créé le 29/06/2009.Il est composé de 19 femmes qui sont issues de la même localité.

Madame Sémou en position debout et à l'extreme droite est responsable du groupement,elle est âgée de 41 ans,elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants,en plus elle assure la garde de 04 autres enfants dont elle a la charge.

Sa principale activité est la restauration,activité qu'elle fait depuis longtemps.

Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter les condiments nécessaires pour la bonne marche de son restaurant.

Son  objectif est d'assurer la scolarité de ses enfants,augmenter la taille de son restaurant et renforcer sa capacité d'épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Dandé Légnol was created on June 29, 2009. It is composed of 19 women who are all from the same town. Ms. Sémou (standing at the far right in the photo) is the group’s official. She is 41 years old, married, and the mother of four children. Plus, she is the guardian of four other children to support. 

Ms. Sémou’s main business is a restaurant, which is something she has done for long time. Her loan will enable her to buy the condiments necessary for operating her restaurant in the right way. 

Her goal is to ensure her children are educated, to increase the size of her restaurant, and to boost her ability to save money.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, and potatoes for her restaurant

loans.name: Vicentina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ILLARY III”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco,  y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Vicentina; ella tiene 60 años D. edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. restaurant, ella prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, la socia trabaja desD. las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio D. este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio y mejorar el negocio D. restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, carne, pollo y verduras.
 
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Vicentina is a member of the “Illary III” communal bank that’s located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Cusco Department.

Vicentina is 60 years old. She has a spouse and two children.  She alternates her daily activities with running a restaurant.  She prepares breakfasts, lunches and dinners.  She works from 8am until 7pm.  She is able to support her children with this business.  She wants to expand and improve the restaurant and is asking for a loan to buy ingredients to cook like rice, meat, chicken and vegetables.

She is happy about the loan and commits to making her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to cook like rice, meat, chicken and vegetables.

loans.name: Clive Road Women's Group B

texts.en: Harriet is 32 years old and runs a fast-growing business selling food in the town of Jinja, which is located in Central Uganda. She is the mother of two children and known for her diligence, grit, steadfastness, perseverance and determination. Harriet wants to continue expanding her business, and is applying for this loan to buy more of the supplies she uses to make the food items she sells, including sugar, salt, cooking oil, maize flour and rice.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a food-vending business.

loans.name: Marlon Antonio

texts.es:
Marlon, es originario de Posoltega municipio de Chinandega pero actualmente vive en a ciudad de León, de 30 años de edad, esta casado, tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad, su nivel de estudio  es  básico solo curso hasta sexto grado de primaria, el se dedica a hacer muebles. Inicio sus actividades hace 2 años y medio cuando puso su negocio propio, cuando el tenia 27 años de edad, pero su experiencia en la carpintería es de 10 años pero por causa de los pocos ingresos y sus necesidades económicas, y la aspiración al desarrollo lo motivaron a poner su propio negocio y esforzarse cada día para dar lo mejor y hacer muebles finos y con calidad.
El requiere el préstamo para comprar un compresor para moldear y afinar madera. Este le seria de gran ayuda pues así no tendrá que pagar servicio aparte si no que el mismo tendrá su propia maquinaria, disminuirá costos, mejoraría la calidad de su trabajo. 
Su meta próxima es comprar maquinaria moderna que le ayuden a mejorar la calidad de su trabajo y dar a conocer más su negocio.
texts.en:
Marlon is originally from the Posoltega municipality of Chinandega, but currently lives in the city of Leon. He is 30 years old, married, and has a 2 year old child. He received a basic primary school education, and studied up until the sixth grade. 

Marlon builds furniture. He set up his own business two and a half years ago, when he was 27 years old. However, he has ten years carpentry experience. His low income, economic needs and his desire to develop himself is what motivated him to establish his own business. Every day he strives to give his best and produce fine, good quality furniture.

Marlon requires this loan to purchase a compressor to shape and refine wood. This would be a great help. Owning his own machine means that he does not have to pay for the service separately, and it will decrease his costs and improve the quality of his work. 

Marlon's next goal is to purchase modern equipment to help him improve the quality of his work and help his business gain recognition.

loans.use: to purchase a compressor for shaping and refining wood

loans.name: Banco Comunal Arca De Noe Group

texts.es: El banco comunal llamado Arca De Noé está conformado por Josefa, Marcela Zenayda, Jasmina Del Carmen, Adriana Esperanza, Martha Del Socorro, Blanca Nubia, Gladis Del Rosario y Deyanira. Ellas son mujeres muy responsables que disfrutan de obtener un medio de vida para salir adelante. En el caso de Martha se dedica a la venta de tortillas, desde hace más de 6 años, que la mayoría de sus vecinos, amigos y familiares saben la buena calidad de tortillas que ofrece. El financiamiento es para la compra de maíz, comal, cal, bolsas entre otros.
texts.en:
The Arca De Noé (Noah's Ark) communal bank is made up of Josefa, Marcela Zenayda, Jasmina Del Carmen, Adriana Esperanza, Martha Del Socorro, Blanca Nubia, Gladis Del Rosario and Deyanira. They are very responsible women who enjoy having a way to make a living and move forward.

Martha has sold tortillas for more than six years. Most of her neighbors, friends and relatives know that she offers high-quality tortillas for sale. The loan is for purchasing corn, a comal (tortilla griddle), lime and bags, as well as other items.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime, a comal (tortilla griddle), bags and other items.

loans.name: Esperanza De Vida Con El Futuro Group

texts.es: El Sr. Guillermo  es conviviente, tiene 4 hijos, Guillermo  tiene 54 años de edad  actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Esperanza de vida con el Futuro” grupo  conformado por 10  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio.  Guillermo  trabaja desde hace 20  años en la venta de Locería es decir platos tazas adornos vasos, Guillermo compra por mayor y los vende a domicilio este negocio surge a raíz de que su esposa falleció y el se quedo con sus 4 hijos y tenía que mantenerlos y cuidarlos a la vez es así que trabajo muy duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos, Guillermo nos cuenta que hoy en dia tiene mayor clientela y la confianza de sus cliente por los buenos productos que vende, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos, sus hijos pudieron estudiar, poco apoco fue comprando cosas para su hogar y sobre todo su familia cuenta con una mejor calidad de vida,  con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar Locería (Platos, vasos adornos) .Sabemos que Guillermo  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Guillermo is 54 years old, has 4 children, and lives together with a partner. He is a member of the community bank “Esperanza de vida con el Futuro” [Hope of Life with a Future]. Ten members who work in diverse commercial activities formed this group. Guillermo has been working for 10 years in Lucería sales, that is to say, plates, cups, knickknacks, and glasses.

Guillermo buys wholesale and sells from his home. This business came about as the result of his wife dying and he had to stay with the 4 children supporting and caring for them while at the same time working very hard in order to raise them.

Guillermo tells us that today he has more customers and the trust of his clients because of the good products that he sells.

Thanks to his fortitude and hard work he attained a higher income, allowing the children to study. Little by little he bought things for the house and above all gave his family a better quality of life.

In order to continue growing he is asking for a new loan with which he will buy Lucería plates, glasses, and knickknacks. We know that Guillermo will meet his goals with hard work and strength and that a loan from Edaprospo will help him.

loans.use: to buy merchandise from Lucería such as plates, glasses and other items

loans.name: Emira

texts.en: Elmira is from the village of Arpeni in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is married and has a high school education.  She considers herself a hard worker and has been engaged as a farmer for the past eleven years.  Elmira dreams of renovating her family home.  She would like a loan to purchase wheat seeds for the autumn planting season.  Elmira expects her income to increase by twenty-five percent with the investment.  She is pleased with the services of microfinance.  Elmira likes living near nature in Arpeni.  Also, most of her relatives live near her.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos tiene su negocio que es la compra y venta de pan. Desde hace más de 6 años que tiene este negocio, lo inicio por la necesidad de sobrevivir con su familia. A pesar de lo difícil que le resulta todos los días es un hombre trabajador que gana lo necesario para poder proporcionárselo a su familia. Él solicita el crédito con el fin de comprar productos como semitas, picos, bollos, empanadas, rin, galletas entre otros.
texts.en: Juan Carlos has a business buying and selling bread.  He’s had the business for over six years having started it because he needed to survive with his family.  Despite how difficult it is for him every day, he’s a hardworking man who earns what’s necessary to provide for his family.  He requests the loan to buy various types of bread, turnovers, cookies, etc.

loans.use: to buy stock items for his bakery.

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en: Ganbold is 36 years old and lives with his wife and two kids in a ger (mongolian yurt) in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. His wife makes traditional boots and his kids go to private school. He started his private taxi service in 2008 using his own car. Also, he with helps operate his wife's shoe-making business. They make shoes that are very stylish and in high quality. He is a hardworking, diligent man who says "I love to make shoes and we're trying to make different designs of shoes as well." He is requesting 500,000 Mongolia tughriks (MNT) to buy materials to make shoes.

loans.use: To buy materials.

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Vanna, 24, is a silk weaver. Her husband, Poeurn, 37, is a soldier. They live in a village across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2007 and have one young son. 
  
Vanna is asking for a loan of $400 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.    

Photo: Vanna is not pictured with her loom because the house where she lives is flooded, so she needs to move her looms to the place that is not affected by flooding.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Deogratias

texts.en:
Deogratias is 31 years old, married, and has four children aged 2 to 9.  He has owned a business selling cows for two years. The hours of his business are from 7 am to 5 pm every day. He currently employs one person to help him.

Deogratias has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more cows for resale. Deogratias will use profits from the loan to help satisfy his family's basic needs, and to start saving for his future. He will also hopes to be able to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more cows for resale.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo is a 30-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He farms mainly vegetables and tomatoes. 
He faces the challenge of pests and diseases, which affects his output. His personal goals are educating his children and building a permanent home; his business dream is a big tomato farm. Deo needs the loan to buy chemicals to spray his tomatoes.

loans.use: to buy chemicals to spray his tomatoes.

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en:
Eugenie is 23 years old and lives in Talibon, Bohol. For the past year, she has run a sari-sari (retail) business where she sells items like canned goods, soap, and shampoo to the people in her community. She earns 3,000 PHP per month. 

Eugenie is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell such as school supplies and canned goods. She hopes that her business will grow.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Christelle Nadine

texts.fr:
Commerçante de 37 ans, célibataire avec 2 enfants qui sont tous sur le banc de l'école.Elle se lance dans la vente des sous vêtements,des vêtements pour enfants et adultes en 2005, quand elle divorce avec son mari.
Elle a deja beneficiee de plusieurs prêts qui lui ont permis d'élargir son commerce ,elle achète des sous vêtements tel que slips hommes, dames et vêtements  en gros et pour enfants et adultes qu'elle vend a des bon prix en détail au marche.

Elle a fait énormes épargnes et avec ses benefices, elle continue a renforcer son activité, avec le temps, elle tient a ouvrir une grande boutique pour habits, elle fait les frais d'écolage de ses enfants et assure l'avenir et l'équilibre de sa famille.
texts.en:
Christelle Nadine is a 37-year-old shopkeeper, unmarried with two children who all go to school. She began selling undergarments and clothing for children and adults in 2005, when she divorced her husband.

She has already benefitted from several loans that allowed her to expand her business. She buys undergarments such as men's and women's underpants, and clothing for children and adults wholesale, which she sells at a good retail price in the market.

She has accumulated enormous savings and with her profits, she continues to strengthen her business, pays for her children's schooling and ensures the future and balance of her family. With time, she wants to open a large clothing store.

loans.use: to buy undergarments and clothing for children and adults.

loans.name: Granush

texts.ru:
Грануш замужем. У нее с мужем трое детей. Она занимается выращиванием ранних овощей (помидоров и редиса) в теплицах. Ферма большая, но на огороде у нее порядок. Грануш имеет 8 больших построенных теплиц. Она садит 12 тыс помидор и высокие и низкие. Участок расположен на берегу водохранилища, что откуда она берет воду для полива. Грануш занимается этим бизнесом уже 17 лет и планирует развиваться дальше.

В этом году Грануш со своим мужем приобрели участок земли. Они затратили много средств и нуждаются в кредите. Грануш просит предоставить 20,000 гривен, чтобы закупить семена для посадки, уголь для отопления и удобрения.

(Примечание: на фотографии Грануш вместе со своим мужем, Александром)
texts.en: Granush is married, and she and her husband have three children.  She is involved in growing early vegetables (tomatoes and radishes) in greenhouses.  Her farm is large, but in good order.  Granush has eight large, built greenhouses.  She plants 12 thousand tall and short tomato plants.  Her land is located on a shore of a water reservoir, from where she gets water for irrigation.  Granush has been involved in this business for 17 years and plans to grow further.  This year, Granush and her husband purchased a plot of land.  She spent a lot of money and need a loan.  Granush is requesting 20,000 hryvnia in order to purchase seeds for sowing, coal for heating and fertilizers.  (Note: the photograph shows Granush together with her husband, Alexander)

loans.use: to purchase seeds for sowing, coal for heating and fertilizers

loans.name: Mirzotochiddin

texts.ru: Мирзоточиддин умный, честный, перспективный молодой человек. Ему 21 лет. Он хорошо учился в школе и с таким успехом продолжает учебу в ВУЗ-е. Он всегда старается быть в курсе всех новостей в учебе и постоянно расширяет свой кругозор и занимается самообразованием. Он целеустремленный он хочет с отличием закончить университет, и продолжает учебу в аспирантуре, а также мечтает работать в престижном банке с этой целью он хотел бы получить займ, чтобы оплатить сумму годового обучения в Университете.
texts.en: Mirzotochiddin is a smart, honest and promising young man.  He is 21 years old.  He studied well in school and continues his education at a higher education facility with this same success.  He always tries to be up-to-date with all the educational news and constantly expands his outlook, and teaches himself too.  He is goal-oriented and wants to graduate from the university with distinction, and continue studying in a masters program, and also dreams of working at a prestigious bank.  Mirzotochiddin wants to obtain this loan to achieve his goals and pay for the annual cost of education at the University.

loans.use: to pay for education

loans.name: Phenny

texts.en:
Phenny is 46 years old and a retail shop proprietor in Voi.  She is a widowed mother of four.  She has been running her shop for the past seven years and the business is doing great. 

This is her fifth business loan from KADET LTD.  She plans to buy more sugar, cooking oil, washing powders and tooth paste to add to her stock. 

She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and buy a piece of land to construct a permanent house.  She hopes to have a bigger, more profitable business.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, cooking oil, washing powders and tooth paste.

loans.name: Nefilia

texts.en:
Nefilia is 61 years old and lives in Poblacion, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay. She is married and has five children.

To earn a living, Nefilia has a business selling a variety of products. She earns about 3,000 PHP each month doing this work. 

Nefilia has requested a loan of 9,000 for additional capital.

Nefilia has been a member of PMPC for this year. In the future, Nefilia would like to expand her business.

loans.use: for additional capital/ to purchase liquor, cigarettes and other products to retail

loans.name: Dela

texts.en: Dela is a student of Vocational High School Muhammadiyah Tawangharjo.  She is the oldest child, with one sister and one brother.  Her mother operates a small food shop and her father is a ticket agent.  They live at Wirosari at the center of Java, Indonesia. Her mother requested a loan to pay Dela's costs of education. The loan will allow her to take an exam. Her parents will work hard to repay the loan successfully. Dela says she is thankful for micro credit. Thus she can continue her studying and achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to pay for Exam Fees

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of seven children, Susana works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. Susana is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of clothes to sell for her clothing retail business.

Susana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Ann would like to buy chickens for rearing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stocks for his farm products retail business

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena is a 43-year-old married mother of three. Her husband is an elementary school teacher. Maria works out of her home selling goods to her neighbors. With the loan, she hopes to install a convenience store in her home and purchase products like salt, oil, coffee, sugar, pasta, drinks, tortillas, cookies, candy, etc. to increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

MARIA ELENA TIENE 43 AÑOS , CASADA , 3 HIJOS SU ESPOSO ES MAESTRO EN UNA ESCUELA PRIMARIA ELLA TRABAJA EN SU CASA VENDIENDO ALIMENTOS ENTRE LOS VECINOS DE SU SECTOR . ESPERA CON EL PRESTAMO INSTALAR UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES Y COMPRAR PRODUCTOS COMO SAL , ACEITE , CAFÉ, AZUCAR, PASTAS, REFRESCOS,TORTILLAS, GALLETAS , DULCES Y DE ESTA FORMA AUMENTAR SUS INGRESOS. MARIA ELENA PERTENECE AL GRUPO BUENA VISTA 3 JUNTO CON VIOLETA PATRICIA MORALES REYES QUIEN TAMBIEN DESEA INSTALAR UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN SU CASA .ES POR ESO QUE CON EL PRESTAMO COMPRARAN MERCADERIAS PARA ABASTECER SUS TIENDAS.

loans.use: Start a convenience store

loans.name: Paul

texts.fr:
Born in 1961 in the village of Vogan, Mr A. Paul lives with his six (6) children and his wife. A market gardener by profession, he works a piece of land willed to him. In principal it should be very profitable. However, without the means to purchase the seeds and fertilizer, he is not able to get much from his garden. Gifted in the management of his revenue, he is very confident and feels capable of properly using a loan of $1000. He is asking for the loan to allow him to stockpile fertilizer and buy seeds. This will allow him to improve his sales for the season.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1961 dans un village de Vogan, Monsieur A. Paul réside dans le milieu avec ses six (6) enfants et sa femme. Maraîcher de profession, il exploite un terrain laissé en héritage qui devrait a priori lui être très rentable. Cependant, n’ayant pas les moyens pour acheter au comptant les intrants et les semences, il ne tire pas profit de façon significative de son jardin. Doué dans la gestion de ses revenus, il est très confiant et se sent capable de pouvoir utiliser à bon escient un crédit de $1000 qu’il sollicite pour faire un stockage d’engrais et l’achat de semences. Ceci lui permettra d’accroître son chiffre d’affaire pour la saison.

loans.use: fertilizer storage and seed purchase

loans.name: Taj

texts.en:
I am a widow and to earn a living, I spin strands of nylon that are used in making a char pai (a bedstead that is four-legged and mostly used in our villages). My eldest son has a stitching machine with which he does peco and overlock stitching for neighborhood clients. My other two sons are a laborer and an apprentice at a woodworking shop respectively.

Together we earn $200 a month with which it is very hard to feed and clothe the seven children in our family.

My son has acquired a suitable level of expertise as an apprentice and now he wish to operate his own shop. He will use his savings but also requires a loan of US$ 250 to buy a lathe (a machine for use in working wood, metal, etc.; it holds the material firmly and rotates it about a horizontal axis against a tool that shapes it.)

loans.use: Buy a lathe for her son to use to open a business

loans.name: Casilda

texts.es:
Senora Casilda is 66 years old and lives in the district of La Peca, in the province of Bagua in Amazonas. She is part of the group called Mientras Tanto Las Rositas. She sells vegetables, groceries and every day items in her small general store. She began her business to increase her income, and because there was no other store close by in her neighborhood.

Her business is growing every day, enabling her to cover her needs and those of her family, as well as continue to invest in her business. Her goal is to grow her business, expand the stock she carries to incluD. gifts and other items, and in this way become a serious business woman. She agrees to repay the loan in 4 months, and will use it to buy rice, sugar, oil, noodles, sodas, sweets, etc. Her customers are the people who live in Bagua and the surrounding areas, especially her neighbors.

La señora Casilda tiene 66 años, conviviente, vive en el distrito D. La Peca, Provincia D. Bagua, en el Departamento D. Amazonas, pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Las Rositas. Se dedica a la venta D. Abarrotes, verduras, artículos D. primera necesidad en general, inició su negocio para mejorar sus ingresos y porque por su barrio no había una tienda cerca. Su negocio está creciendo cada vez más, lo cual le permite cubrir sus necesidades y las D. su familia, además seguir invirtiendo en su negocio. Su meta es hacer crecer su negocio, ampliar en lo que es mercería, regalos y otros, D. esa manera convertirse en una mujer D. negocios. El reciente crédito otorgado por Manuela Ramos D. S/. 1,000.00 ($ 333.00 aprox.), que lo cancelará en 4 meses, servirá para comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, gaseosas, golosinas, entre otros. AtienD. al público en general que residen en Bagua y alrededores, especialmente a los vecinos D. su barrio.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE EVERY DAY ITEMS TO STOCK HER GENERAL STORE

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Refurbish furniture for his bar and guest house

loans.name: Baloghlan

texts.en: Baloghlan is 47 years old and a resident of Sumgayit Town of Azerbaijan. He works as a taxi driver with his own car in Sumgayit. He works inside the town and sometimes goes long distances, such as to Baku and other regions. His car is an old model and brakes down if he goes longer distances. He wants to repair his car. As he has little of his own funds for that, he applies to Normicro Sumgayit branch to borrow $400 for repairing his car.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Alhaji Ibrahim

texts.en:
Alhaji is 35 years old and married with three children. He buys and sells cows to traders who come from Freetown.

Alhaji used to take a cow on credit and would pay the balance after selling it. With a previous loan loan, which was insufficient to purchase a mature cow, Alhaji used the small amount of capital to diversify his business and sell goods on the side.

Although he is earning a small income for his family, it does not enable him to build his own capital. On many occasions, the cattle suppliers have not given him the cows on credit.

For this reason, he is requesting for a loan of $350 (Le.1,000,000) to expand his business and build capital.

loans.use: Alhaji needs additional business capital to continue the expansion and growth of his business.

loans.name: Shamsiya

texts.ru:
Shamsiya R. lives in the city of Vahdat. She is 47 years old, married and has 5 children. She has a high school degree. Shamsiya is a housewife but her main occupation as well as the main source of income for her family is agriculture. She rents a plot of land where she grows wheat and potatoes. After harvest she keeps part of the crops for her family and sells the rest. Currently it is planting season in Tajikistan and Shamsiya requires additional funding to purchase seeds of wheat, potatoes and fertilizer. That is why she has planned to take out this loan. This loan will help her buy quality seeds and harvest a quality harvest which will help her attract new clients and be able to sell all the crops she grows. Shamsiya is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Рабиева Шамсия жительница города Вахдат. Возраст клиента 47 лет. Замужем , имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. Домохозяйка ,но основным видом деятельности и основным источником дохода ее семьи является земледелие. Она берет землю в аренду , засеивает пшеницей и картофелем.После того как она получает урожай , часть его она оставляет своей семье, а остальную часть продает. Сейчас самое время посевных , поэтому клиентка нуждается в деньгах для покупки семян картофеля , пшеницы и удобрений.Поэтому она запланировала получить кредит. Это поможет ей закупить качественные семена и получить качественный урожай, что поможет привлечь новых клиентов и без остатка реализовать свою продукцию. Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of potato and wheat seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Señora Gregoria is a member of the Banco Comunal Villa Turística de Catac II. She owns a grocery store in the district of Catac, Recuay province, in Ancash department.

She plans to pay back the S/. 1,500.00 loan in eight months. It will be used to buy 2 bags of rice, 2 bags of sugar, 2 cases of oil, a case of tuna, 2 crates of milk, 3 boxes of noodles, a case of chocolate, a case of butter, a case of soap, and a case of detergent.

She is 69 years old and is separated from her husband. The money her six children contribute help her to pay the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Gregoria, pertenece al Banco Comunal Villa Turística de Catac II, tiene su tienda de abarrotes en el distrito de Catac, Provincia de Recuay, departamento de Ancash.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 el cual será cancelado en 8 meses comprará, 2 sacos de arroz, 2 sacos de azúcar, 2 cajas de aceite, una caja atún, 2 cajas de leche, 3 paquetes de fideos, una caja de chocolate, 1 caja de mantequilla, una caja de jabón, una bolsa de detergente.

Ella tiene 69 años de edad, es separada de su esposo y tiene 6 hijos sus ingresos le permite solventar los gastos de su hogar.

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Jose Maria

texts.es:
Jose is single and he began his business because three years ago he lost his job. For him, working with his hands has always come easily. As a result, he began making decorative items, which he then paints and sells directly to customers, without a middleman. In this manner, his business began to prosper.

Now, Jose needs a loan of US $350, which he will repay in 6 months, so that he can remodel his shop. With your help, this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Jose es soltero y empezo este negocio porque hace tres años quedo desempleado, a el siempre se le facilitaron las manualidades, por lo que inicio fabricacando los articulos para decoracion, despues tambien pintandolos y vendiendolos, el directamente sin intermediarios, fue asi como su negocio empezo a prosperar.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $350 que pagara en 6 meses para remodelar su local, con tu ayuda esto sera posible.

loans.use: Remodel his shop.

loans.name: Salma's Group

texts.en:
Salma baji, wife of M. Ayub, lives in a small city named Vehari, Pakistan. She has been married for the last 25 years. She is a mother of ten children: five sons and five daughters. Her elder son and her daughter are married. The next son works as a salesman of bakery material. Salma baji’s other son is learning the skill of glass-making. Her last children are going to school. Salma baji successfully completed her first loan from Asasah. Now she is applying for a loan for her husband so that he can expand his bakery business.

She has been joined in her loan group a few more members: Azra baji wants a loan for repairing her rickshaw; Ainee baji wants a loan for her grocery shop; Razia baji wants a loan for her barber salon; Asmat baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: Augustina is 35 years old. She is a wife and the mother of three children who are in school. She is very enterprising and she has been trading to support her children’s education. She sells and supplies refrigerators and cookers to the staff of institutions. She makes it flexible for her loyal customers to take stock on credit and make regular payments, especially monthly workers. Augustina says this strategy is good because it enables her to make increased sales over a short period. She hopes the loan will inject more capital into her business to enable her to take cash delivery from her suppliers to reduce the cost of operations. She also hopes to increase her savings to support her children’s education. She is a member of the group called ‘Kae Awurade’ (meaning, remember the Lord) Trust Group.

loans.use: To purchase increased stock of refrigerators, electric and gas cookers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase one cow and cow feed

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng V., 27, is a rubber dealer who lives with two of her children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 2005, she has been purchasing rubber from the villagers and reselling it to the big dealers, earning about $9 per day in revenue. Her husband, 29, is a construction worker who builds houses, normally making $5 per day. Two of their children are students.

Because soil conditions in Kampong Cham make it a good place to plant rubber trees, a large number of people living there work as farmers growing them. In order to increase family income, Seng is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase more rubber. The loan will also help purchase a motorbike for her to use as transportation.

loans.use: To purchase additional rubber for her business and a motorbike to use as transportation.

loans.name: Sodohoin

texts.fr:
Madame A. Sodohoin est née en 1958 dans le village de Tékponou où elle vit actuellement avec sa famille. Elle est mère de huit enfants dont elle arrive difficilement à subvenir aux besoins malgré ses activités.

En effet, elle fait l'elevage de porcs et le commerce de l’huile rouge de palme. Son principal problème reste le manque de fonds de roulement. Elle sollicite un crédit.
Ceci lui permettra d’améliorer son revenu et les conditions de vie de sa famille toute entière
texts.en:
Ms. Sodohoin A. was born in 1958 in the village of Tékponou, where she currently lives with her family. She is the mother of eight children, so she has trouble supporting the family despite the work she does. In fact, she raises pigs and does commerce in red palm oil. The main problem is still the lack of working capital. She is requesting a loan, and this will enable her to improve her income and the living conditions of the whole family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising pigs and commerce in red palm oil

loans.name: Zokhrab

texts.en: Zokhrab lives in Khachmaz town. He was born in 1977. He is married and has 2 children. 3 years ago he started a taxi business. Now he needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy spare parts for this car for providing his clients with good service.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es: Eulogia tiene 60 años, es viuda, vive con su último hijo de 23 años. Se dedica al cultivo de café y de plátano, actividad que realiza desde joven y le ha ayudado a educar y mantener su hogar, sobre todo desde que enviudo. La siembra de café es lo que más le agrada realizar, debido al cuidado que realiza con sus plantaciones. Además, es rentable, porque es un producto que tiene un mayor valor mayor que los demás, sobre todo por temporadas, siendo lo difícil, tener que abrir y adecuar los pozos donde se siembran las plantas, y abonarlos. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Eulogia invertirá el dinero en la compra de abonos y pago de mano de obra para ampliar sus terrenos de cultivo.
texts.en:
Eulogia is a 60-year-old widow who lives with her youngest son who is 23 years old. She works in coffee and plantain cultivation, a practice she has been involved with since her youth. It has helped her raise her family and maintain her home, even more so after she became a widow. Harvesting coffee is what she likes to do most because of the care she gives to her plantations. In addition, it is profitable, because it is a product that has a greater value than others, above all by seasons, as it is difficult to have to drill and prepare the wells where the plants are sowed and fertilize them. This is her first loan with MFP. Eulogia will use the money to buy fertilizer and to pay workers in order to expand the land she cultivates.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and workers who will prepare the land

loans.name: Hos

texts.en: Mrs. Hos N. is 51 years old and a widow with two children who are employed in garment factory. She is a farmer in Angk village in Kandal province. She owns a 1-hectare field where she cultivates rice. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because her field has infertile soil which has a bad effect on her crop. In order to solve this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer; she plans to use the rest of the money to hire laborers to work on the field.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and hire laborers to work on the field

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey S. is a Tanzanian micro-entrepreneur. He runs a kiosk at Vituka Ward in Dar es Salaam. He sells various soft drinks including fresh milk and juice. The business has many customers because Dar es Salaam is hot, thus cold drinks are mostly preferred by many people. He has been running the business for four years. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 800,000 to boost the business

loans.use: To boost the business

loans.name: Padma

texts.en:
Padma R. is a resident of Thikedewal, located in the Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this area are engaged in small businesses. She has two daughters. Her older daughter is a student in grade 5, and her younger daughter is in primary school.

Mrs. R. and her husband, Mr. Pashupati R., opened their grocery shop 6 years ago. They sell different types of grocery items, such as rice, maize, noodles and so on.  Now Mrs. R. is requesting a loan of Rs10,000.00 to buy different types of grocery items for her business. She wants to use her increased income to provide a better education to her daughters.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Nalongo Hadijah Group

texts.en:
N. Hadijah is 34 years of age. She is married with three children aged 5 to 23 years.

She rents a two-room house with her family. She does have access to electricity but she has to fetch her water from the well. She always has two meals a day.

N. Hadijah has a salon and that is how she earns a living. She rents the shop that houses her salon and she receives about 15 customers a day. She has done this business for 19 years now and prior to this she had a retail shop.

This is the ninth loan she has received from Kiva's partner MCDT and she has been with MCDT for four years now. She has also worked with her group for four years.

She will use this loan buy oils for hair and braids for plaiting. She hopes to build a house from her savings.

loans.use: Buy oils for hair and braids

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is 45 years old. She is married with six children; two males and four daughters. Some of her children are in junior high and basic schools. Others are in senior high school.

Her husband is a farmer, while she is a trader. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Mampong, in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Mary trades in food stuffs such as plantain, rice and yams. She also sells tomatoes, vegetable cooking oil, onions, etc. She buys some of her goods from wholesalers in her community and others from farmers in nearby villages, and sells at the local market to food vendors. She also distributes to retailers.

Mary has been in this business for fifteen good years and wants a loan to procure food stuffs in bulk to be able to supply to more customers. She hopes to sponsor her children in school to higher levels.

loans.use: Procure food stuffs in bulk.

loans.name: Friday

texts.en: Friday is twenty-six years old and single with no children. He sells bags of flour for baking loaves of bread. He has been in this business for a long time. He hopes for a loan of $700 to purchase more flour to sell. He says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more flour to sell

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony B. is twenty-six years old. He is married and has one child, a son. He says his son is yet to start school. He lives with his child and wife in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Anthony is a hard working young man. His wife is currently under apprenticeship. She is learning sewing. Anthony is a tailor by profession. He sews smocks and other African wears. He buys the materials from Kumasi. Tony says he supplies the smocks to stores. Tony says he has been in business for barely a year now. He wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 22-year-old man who lives in Saida in southern Lebanon with his wife. Mahmoud has been working as a furniture repairman since 2002.

Mahmoud has requested a loan of $1,500 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a car for his work. This is the first time that Mahmoud has requested a loan.

Mahmoud enjoys his work and does it well. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of cash, and he has increased his income over time. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase a car for his work

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia A. is from the village of Napilan. She is 44 years old, married, and has one adult child. Letecia owns and operates a business raising crops for sale, primarily fruits & vegetables. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Letecia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Letecia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en:
N. Esther is the leader of Nabuti group in Mukono. She is a hard-working business-lady and has been a market vendor for 10 years dealing in Irish potatoes, sweet potatoes, yams, cassava, etc. in Kame Valley market in Mukono. She is a married lady with 3 children aged 10, 7 and 1 and she cares for 7 dependents.

Esther says that it’s because of her quality produce that customers keep coming to her for goods and this enables her to make 300,000/= per week. She needs a loan to help purchase more stock of goods for sale. In the photo is also the Credit Officer for the group, Winnie.

loans.use: Purchasing more stock for her business

loans.name: Azamchon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
      Азамчону – 33 года. Он женат и имеет 3-х детей. Он водит маршрутное такси № 43, который ездит в направлении Панчшанбе – Сомгор. Он работает через день. В свои выходные дни он ремонтирует свою машину, делает заправку, и ездит по своим личным делам. Жена работает учительницей в средней школе, зарабатывает мало. Азамчон хочет взять займ для покупки некоторых запасных частей и ремонта ходовой части машины.
texts.en:
Azamchon is 33 years old. He is married and has 3 children. He drives a shuttle bus #43 that operates on the Panchshanbe-Somgor route. He works every other day. He repairs his vehicle on his days off, fuels it up and drives to do his own errands. His wife works as a teacher at a secondary school and earns very little. Azamchon wants to obtain a loan to buy several auto parts and repair vehicle drive train.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Shuttle bus repairs

loans.name: Chhum

texts.en:
Mrs. O. Chhum and her husband, Mr. Rean Kroeun, were married in 1971 and have 5 children, of whom one son is a construction worker, and four daughters: two weave silk at home and two attend school. The family lives on an Island of Mekong River, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

O. used to be a silk weaver; but she has transferred her loom to her daughters. She now spins silk to help her daughters in the weaving business. Mr. Rean Kroeun is a farmer. O. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase silk materials for her daughters’ weaving business and to repair her house.
.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her daughter’s weaving business and repair her house

loans.name: Habib

texts.en: P. Habib lives with his family in Istaravshan town. Through much effort he dedicates himself to the production of grapes. He tends to his crop himself, with the help of his son. One of Habib’s biggest problems is the harvesting of his product and, due to distance, he sells his crop piecemeal which reduces his income which he uses to support his family. Habib has asked for a loan of 2,500 USD that will be used for the purchase of seeds and fertilizer. This will allow him greater earnings which, in turn, would improve his family’s standard of living. His biggest desire is to participate in this future venture so he can improve his profits and provide a better life for his family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Storage of corn

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.fr: S. Clarisse est née le 01/01/1980 à Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. Clarisse est mariée à DANSI Ignace, un couturier. Ce couple a à sa charge sept enfants tous scolarisés dont trois sont les leurs. La famille réside depuis quinze ans à Fridjrossè Kpota, un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Clarisse vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. C’est des tissus et des vêtements que Clarisse vend de façon ambulante. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin et à Lomé, pays voisin du Bénin que Clarisse achète ses produits. Clarisse a déjà quinze d’expérience dans cette activité. Clarisse a eu deux crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour  continuer à développer son activité, Clarisse demande un troisième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.

loans.use: Achat de tissus et de vêtements.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 41 years old and single. Martha's parents live with her and she is an only child. Because her parents are elderly, she takes care of them and all of their needs.

She has been working as a dairy cow farmer for over 20 years in Esquilan Chico, which is at the southern end of Cochabamba. Martha sells the milk her cows produce to a large local dairy company called Pil.  This company makes all sorts of dairy products, including milk, yogurt, and cheese.  

With this loan from CIDRE, Martha plans to purchase another dairy cow. This will allow her to increase her milk production and also her earnings. Martha hopes that in the future, she can take out another loan to remodel their home so her parents can be more comfortable.

loans.use: The purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Maiya Devi

texts.en:
Maiya Devi A. is a 39-year-old woman who lives in Bhakepati, Kathmandu. She lives in a single family with her husband and three children. Her husband, Mr. Ram Krishna A., works in a grocery store. All her children are now studying in higher secondary school.

Mrs. A. opened her mo:mo (Chinese food) shop a few years ago to uplift the living standard of her family. In Nepal, mo:mo is very famous. So the demand for mo:mo is rising constantly.

Now Mrs. A. is requesting a loan of 30,000 NPR to buy cooking materials to use for making mo:mo.

loans.use: To buy cooking materials for her work

loans.name: Anthonia

texts.en: To earn a livelihood, Anthonia sells local gin. She has been in this business for a long time.  She hopes to increase her earnings in the future and be able to better provide for her children’s education. She is 39 years-old and married with five children. She hopes for a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more local gin to sell. This is the high season for sales and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She says thanks to all her Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase gin to sell.

loans.name: Joao  Baptista

texts.pt:
João Batista M. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, capital de Moçambique, tem 55 anos de vida, casado e pai 4 filhos de 32, 28, 20 e 19 anos de idade, destes 3 já tem suas próprias casas. Fez 4ª classe do antigo sistema de educação, não continuou porque seus pais não tinham condições financeiras para levarem alem os seus estudos. Vive na casa própria, sustenta a sua mãe e netos que vivem com ele.

Saiu do Bairro Central na cidade de Maputo para Boane com a sua família em 1974 para iniciar uma nova vida. É comerciante e dono de seu negocio há mais de 20 anos. Trabalha com a sua esposa das 8h as 18horas todos os dias. Vende mais cerveja e refrescos onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt a 6.000.00mt por mês e poupa algum na sua conta bancária.

Nunca solicitou empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seus amigos. Este é o seu 4º crédito no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (refrescos, vinhos, cerveja e outros) para o seu estabelecimento. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 8.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt e 13.000.00mt, todos para a mesma actividade.

Deseja com este empréstimo responder a necessidades de seus clientes, futuramente deseja solicitar a mais créditos para ampliar o seu estabelecimento comercial.
texts.en:
João Batista M. was born in the city of Maputo, the capital of Mozambique. He is 55; married; and the father of 4 children who are 32, 28, 20, and 19. Three of them have their own homes. He studied through the 4th grade of the old education system and didn't continue because his parents didn't have the financial resources to keep paying for his school. He lives in his own home and supports his mother and his grandchildren that live with him. He left the central neighborhood in the city of Maputo for Boane with his family in 1974 to start a new life. He is a merchant and has owned his own business for more than 20 years. He works with his wife from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day. He sells beer and soft drinks and earns a monthly income of around 5,000 to 6,000 meticais. He saves some of it in his bank account. He has never requested a loan from another bank. He became familiar with Hluvuku through some friends. This is his 4th loan, and it is for 20,000 meticais. He will use it to purchase products (soft drinks, wine, beer, etc.) for his business. His previous loans were for 8,000, 10,000, and 13,000 meticais, and they were all used for the same purpose. He would like to use this loan to meet the needs of his customers. In the future he hopes to request more credits to expand his business location.

Translated from Portuguese by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell soft drinks and alcoholic beverages

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora  MARIA G. D. F. tiene  72 años, 12 hijos todos mayores D. edad y vive en el distrito D. la Moche, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad – Perú. 
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SIEMPRE ADELANTE  II. Ella presenta estudios hasta 3ero. D. primaria, refiere que no pudo continuar estudiando por falta D. recursos económicos.
La socia se dedica a la preparación y venta D. tofees y chocotejas. 
Con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles comprò chocolates en barra al por mayor, pasas, pecanas y papel para envolver.
Con su próximo crédito D. 1,000 nuevos soles comprará moldes, cajas D. chocolates al por mayor , 2 ollas , pecanas, pasas, papel D. envoltura, etc. para la preparación y empaquetado D. sus productos.
Ella sueña con aumentar sus ventas y empezar a distribuir sus tofees y chocolates en las tiendas D. otros distritos.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria G. D. Fernández is 72 years old and has 12 adult children. She lives in the District of Moche, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. Maria is a member of the Communal Bank “Siempre Adelante II” (Always Ahead II). She has a third graD. education and was not able to continue studying because she lacked the financial resources.

Maria prepares and sells toffees and chocolates. With her first loan of 300 soles, she bought bars of chocolate wholesale, raisins, pecans, and wrapping paper. Her next loan of 1000 soles will be used to buy molds, boxes of chocolates at wholesale, two pots, pecans, raisins, wrapping paper, and other items for preparing and packing her products. She dreams of increasing her sales and distributing her products to stores in other districts.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & supplies for making chocolates and toffees

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Mrs. Elma S., 49 years of age, is married and is a resident of Upper Pisaan, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She has nine children of whom three are at school age, one is an infant and five are now adults. Her husband, Alfredo, is a carpenter and at the same time a farmer of coco land (a coconut plantation).

Elma has a sari-sari (variety) store from which she is earning an average net income of not less than 2,500 PHP a month which is so helpful to their family income.

Elma joined Paglaum MPC just this year because she is very much interested in our products and services and for our being one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao and the awarded coop for being “Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines” during the search for the COOP-LGU Partnership Award, 2006.

As a newly recognized member, Elma is given the privilege of obtaining 5,000 PHP to add to the capital of her three-year-old sari-sari store. The future income from this loan will be used to meet her family’s needs and for loan repayments.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

location.town: Tangub-Upper Pisaan, Bonifacio, Mis. Occ. Mindanao

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa P. is from the city of Kinuman Norte Ozamiz City. She is 43 years old. Elsa is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Elsa plants and harvests bananas for sale. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $200 a month from this activity.

In 2010, Elsa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Elsa is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a 39-year-old single woman with three children, who all attend school. She sells charcoal and is also employed. Previously, she was employed in farming. With the 15,000 Kenyan shilling loan she wants to increase her stock of charcoal. She employs one person and operates within a Masai village near Nairobi. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya, a Kiva partner, for helping her improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal.

loans.name: Teresa Maribel

texts.es: Teresa Maribel A. D. G., D. 43 años D. edad, junto a ella viven su esposo, el señor Victor Manuel y sus dos hijos Joel y Noé D. 23 y 22 años D. edad respectivamente y quienes trabajan como albañiles construyendo viviendas nuevas o realizando algunas mejoras o modificaciones a otras usadas, mientras su padre es comerciante. Residen en una colonia Semi Urbana del municipio D. Ereguayquin, departamento D. Usulutan. Ya cuentan varios años desD. que Teresa al ver que las ganancias resultado D. los negocios D. su esposo no eran suficientes para sufragar los gastos D. su hogar decidió apoyarlo instalando un molino D. nixtamal en su misma casa D. residencia, en el muele maíz, frijoles, chicharrones, yuca, harinas, entre otras cosas. Hace algunos meses Teresa al ver que la frecuencia D. sus clientes ha disminuido producto D. competencias del mismo tipo D. negocio en el lugar, decidió establecer horarios en los que ha distribuido la atención del molino con su esposo y cuando ella no se encuentra en el, anda vendiendo ropa D. forma ambulante, por las colonias aledañas o el mercado regional del municipio. Teresa ha encontrado otra fuente D. ingreso para su familia en la venta D. estas prendas D. vestir y por ello ahora desea comprar mayor variedad D. ropa y así poder vender más cantidad y obtener mejores ganancias.-
texts.en:
Teresa Maribel A. D. G., 43 years old, lives together with her husband, Victor Manuel, and her two children, Joel and Noé, 23 and 22 years old respectively, who work as builders building new homes or doing improvements or modifications of existing houses. Their father is a shopkeeper. They live in a semi urban area of the Ereguayquin municipality, in the Usulutan department. Several years ago, Teresa, realizing that the income from her husband's business was not enough to cover the costs of her home, decided to help him and installed a grain grinder in her home. She uses it to grind corn, beans, cracklings, yucca, flour among other things. Several months ago, seeing that the frequency of her customers has diminished due to competition, Teresa decided to set times where she and her husband are at the grinder and otherwise she goes to sell clothing door to door in the adjoining communities or at the regional market of the municipality. Teresa has found another good source of income for her family in the sale of this clothing and is now wanting to purchase a bigger variety of products thus increasing her sales and her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a variety of women's and men's clothing.

location.town: Municipio de Ereguayquin, departamento de Usulutan

loans.name: Sipi Kazungu

texts.en:
Sipi, 32, is married to Mwangombe, who is 61 years old, and together they have eight children. Sipi operates a retail shop, a grocery store and also does some farming on the side in Gahaleni-Malindi area. She earns a monthly profit of Kshs 3,000 from her businesses.

Sipi, who was introduced to Kadet by an existing member, has applied for her first loan, and she has serviced a previous loan with another microfinance. She plans to use the loan amount to add vegetables to her grocery business and other goods like sugar and soap in her retail shop. With the extra income from her loan, she plans to increase her farm acreage and dreams of boosting her children's education.

Sipi describes herself as a hardworking woman.

loans.use: To add vegetables to her grocery business and other goods like sugar and soap in her retail shop

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.pt:
Hortência Sautane M. nasceu na provincia de Inhambane, Sul de Moçambique tem 46 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 7 filhos de cujas idades já não se lembra, destes 5 vão a escola. Fez somente 6ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Sai de Inhambane para Maputo ao lar em 1977, onde fixou sua residência. Mais tarde devidas as dificuldades enfrentadas na sua vida, decidiu iniciar uma actividade comercial em Boane. Tem um negocio próprio há mais de 6 anos, não possui nenhum empregado, as vezes tem ajuda dos filhos. Consegue um rendimento de cerca de 3.500.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum com as amigas através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).
Já teve empréstimo para o seu negócio, na Associação de crédito TCHUMA mais tarde decidiu no continuar, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigas que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar produtos (açúcar, refrescos, bolos, bolachas e outros) para aumentar a mercadoria no seu estabelecimento.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este crédito para poder a ceder a outros. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para melhorar a sua residência e aplicar ainda mais no seu negócio.
texts.en:
Hortência Sautane M. was born in the province of Inhambane in southern Mozambique. She is 46 years old, married, and is the mother of seven children whose ages she does not remember. Five of the children go to school. Hortência only completed sixth grade; she did not continue because of a lack of money. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else. In 1977 she left Inhambane for Maputo, where she took up residence. Later, owing to difficulties she faced in her life, she decided to start a business in Boane. She has had her own business for more than six years. She has no employees, but sometimes her children help her. She earns around 3,500 meticais per month, which she uses for household expenses and for saving with friends through Xitique (a traditional system of rotating savings). She had a loan for her business through Tchuma Credit Association, but she later decided not to continue with them. She learned about Hluvuku through friends who are also customers of this institution. This is her first loan here. She is asking for 15,000 meticais, with which she will buy products (sugar, soft drinks, cakes, crackers and other items) to increase the amount of merchandise in her shop. She promises to pay off this loan on time so she may take out other loans. In the future, she would like to ask for more loans to improve her house and invest more in her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of products (sugar, soft drinks, cakes, crackers and other items)

loans.name: Marie Gorette

texts.en:
Gorette is 26 years old and married with four children who are between 1 and 8 years old.  Gorette sells clothes, mainly women's clothing.  She has been in this business for a long time and the hours of her business are from 7 am to 9 pm every day. 

Gorette is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand her business by adding a variety of styles such as men and children's clothing. With this loan, Gorette has a vision of purchasing large bales of clothing for wholesaling and retailing at the same time so that her revenue will increase.  If successful, she hopes to continue building a secure future for her family. In addition, she will help the people from her community by creating jobs for them.

loans.use: To buy men and children's clothing to resell

loans.name: Guembe Group

texts.es:
El banco D. Emprendimiento GUEMBE  es un grupo integrado por nueve integrantes, ocho mujeres y un varon, son oriundos D. distintos lugares D. Bolivia  como ser Montero, Santiestevan, Santa Cruz, Warnes, Chuquisaca, Oropeza.

La Presidenta del Banco D. Emprendimiento Guembe  es la Srta. Gleidy soltera es estudiante y se dedica  a la venta D. cosmeticos por catalogo, estudia una carrera tecnica y tiene muchos deseos D. superacion vive sola y se mantiene sola es muy trabajadora y responsable y solidaria con sus hermanos a los que les da una cantidad D. dinero cada mes para sus gastos, con el dinero del credito comprara mercaderia D. promosion y despues poder vender al precio orignal.  
 
Todos los socios viven en la misma Zona km 9 barrio cambao hace bastantes años todos cuentan con negocios en la zona ramada cerca al mercado mas populoso D. Santa Cruz, 3 integrantes cuentan con  puestos propios  y algunos son ambulantes, todas las socias son Madres D. familia en la gran mayoria son concubinas y otros solteros y otras esperan nueva familia, ellas sueñan seguir creciendo con los prestamos que le otorga emprender tienen metas y sueños que ellas confian que lo van a conseguir como tener casa propia local propio vehiculo empresarios y viajar ,ver a sus familias que se encuentran lejos, todas las socias estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Guembe Communal Bank is comprised of nine members. There are eight women and one man. They are originally from different places in Bolivia like Montero, Santiestevan, Santa Cruz, Warnes, Chuquisaca, and Oropeza. Gleidy is the president of the Guembe Communal Bank. She is single, and she is a student. She sells cosmetics by catalog. She is studying for a technical career. She has a lot of desire to improve herself. She lives alone and supports herself. She is very hard-working, responsible, and supportive of her siblings. She gives them some money every month for their expenses. She will use the loan to buy merchandise on promotion. Later, she will be able to sell it for the original price. All of the members live in Zona km 9 in the Cambao neighborhood. For several years they all have had businesses in the sheltered area near the most populous market in Santa Cruz. Three of the members have their own stalls, and some members are street vendors. All of the women are mothers. Most of them are in common law marriages, some are single, and some hope for a new family. They dream of continuing to grow with the loans from Emprender. They have goals and dreams that they are confident they will fulfill. Some of these are having their own house, their own stall, having a business vehicle, and traveling to see their families who are far away. All of the members are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: The Women´s Bank Of United Growth (Banco Mujer Creciendo Juntas) Group

texts.en:
The name of this group, “Banco Mujer Creciendo Juntas” translates as “The Women´s Bank of United Growth”. The eight women members live in Aguas Frías, Limón, located in the hot and humid Caribbean region of Costa Rica.

The members of this group are involved in various income-generating activities including sewing, animal rearing (chickens, cows and pigs) as well as the harvesting of plantains, rice and watermelons. This loan will be used generally by the members to invest in the growth of their individual productive activities. The women involved in animal rearing plan to use this loan to purchase livestock and animal feed.

The women of this group are able to contribute significantly to their family incomes as a result of the earnings generated from their productive activities. This income is supplemented by salaries earned by the men in their families who work as laborers in the pineapple and banana fields of Aguas Frías.

The women have expressed great concern for the environmental devastation to the community river and health problems that their husbands and sons have developed as a result of working for the employer who owns the land. Respiratory problems, infertility and skin ailments are listed by the women of this group as common side effects of men laboring in the fields. The women attribute these negative effects to the fact that the employer provides faulty equipment, and the men are required to work with heavy, toxic chemicals in places with little or no shade. For the residents of this community, there are few employment opportunities. This daily reality describes the struggle that these women must cope with.

Edel S. F. has a sewing business and an agricultural business. She will use this loan primarily to invest in her agriculture business by purchasing watermelon, rice and squash seeds as well as agricultural nutrients. The loan will also be used to invest in the purchase of materials for making clothes which will enable her to produce more sewing products. Edel says she operates on a per order basis, her clients request a certain type of product whether it be men’s, women’s, or children’s clothing and she produces it within a given period.

Edel’s goals are to produce more, both agriculturally and in her sewing activity. She hopes to expand both businesses and increase her income. She says her main obstacle is access to working capital and this loan will help to address this challenge. Another obstacle for Edel is the fact that her sewing machine is very old and doesn’t work very well. It breaks down often, at which times she must hire a mechanic to come and repair it.

The members of this group have known each other for over ten years. They say that they prefer the group lending model to the individual lending model because, as a group, they can support each other and learn from one another.

loans.use: To purchase watermelon, rice and squash seeds as well as more materials for making clothes

loans.name: Claudia Milena

texts.es:
Claudia  Milena O. P. ,  es una mujer casada que tiene un hijo de 6 años  de edad y vive en el barrio Palermo Norte, en la ciudad de Bogotá, la capital de Colombia. La máxima expresión de Claudia Milena  es  diseñar y confeccionar ropa femenina con una calidad inigualable; esta es la razón por la que está solicitando un crédito por valor de $2.300.000  para comprar una maquina  collarín y adecuar una puerta para el local de su boutique, porque Claudia   Milena además de tener su propio  taller, también tiene una unidad de comercialización de la ropa que fabrica y asi mismo vende accesorios femeninos. Su negocio está funcionando desde el año  2003 en un sitio bien  ubicado   comercialmente  y a través de él está generando un empleo directo.

Este es su sexto crédito con la Fundación Mario  Santo Domingo  y con ello ha logrado fortalecer su negocio gradualmente,  especialmente ha podido comprar de contado a sus proveedores y con ello adquierir importantes descuentos, por eso su precio de venta es muy aceptado por sus clientes.  Claudia Milena sueña con viajar y  extender su negocio quiere que crezca para ayudar a su familia y lograr posicionamiento a nivel local y también nacional; esto es justamente su gran desafío.
texts.en:
Claudia Milena O. P. is married and has a six year old son. She lives in the neighborhood of Palermo Norte in the city of Bogotá, the capital of Columbia. Claudia Milena designs and makes women's clothing of unebeatable quality. This is the reason she is asking for a loan of $2,300,000. She would like to buy a sewing machine and add a door to the premises of her boutique. Claudia Milena, in addition to having her own workshop, also has a store to sell the clothes she makes. The store also sells women's acessories. Her business has been operating since 2003 in a well located commercial site and through it, she generates direct employment. This is her sixth loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, and with these loans she has gradually succeeded in strengthening her business. She is able to pay her suppliers in cash and therefore get important discounts, so her sale prices are very acceptable to her clients. Claudia Milena dreams of traveling and expanding her business. She would like the business to grow in order to help her family and achieve recognition on a local and national level. This is her big challenge.

Translated from Spanish by Eileen Gessner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine and add a door to her store

loans.name: Miraflor

texts.en: Miraflor C. is from Barangay Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 39 years old, is married, and has three infant children. Miraflor owns and operates a business making and selling food, preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Miraflor joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas.
