Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
N. Juliet is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kalisizo in the Masaka area of Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children.  Two of her children are in school, and she also takes care of an additional dependent who is an orphan. Juliet has a business selling mats and other crafts, which she has had for several years.

To help expand her business, Juliet is requesting a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used for buying more craft materials and other supplies for her to make her mats and other crafts.  Juliet hopes to have a more successful business and generate profit in order to support her children and the orphan she takes care of in their schooling.


Note to lenders: 

BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills.  Afterwards, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses.  

These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance.  Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: Purchase arts and crafts materials

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary T. is 53 years old and married to Raphael T. and they have three children: Fatuma (28 years old); David (25 years old) and Irene (20 years old). They live in Bungoma town.

Mary sells second-hand clothes at Bungoma market and her clients are people who go to the market to shop. She is applying for her 2nd loan from Kadet Ltd after repaying her first loan well.  She wants to use the money to buy 3 bales of used clothes to add to her stock.

Her hope and dream is to start selling ready-made clothes and to open a boutique.

loans.use: Buy 3 bales of used clothes to add to her stock

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia S. is from the village of Bonbon, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 39 years old. Eufemia is married and has 4 school-age children. To make a living, Eufemia owns & operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from making & selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Eufemia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Eufemia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eufemia is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Eufemia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make additional furniture

loans.name: Sholpongul's Group

texts.en:
Sholpongul K. is the leader of the group. She is 47 and a widow. She has raised two daughters: the first daughter lives and works in Karakol and the second daughter is at school. A year ago, with the initial investment of 8000 soms, Sholpongul started to breed livestock. Selling sheep after fattening, she makes 3000 soms per month. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase three sheep for breeding. 

Jyrgalbek O., 48, is married. He has two daughters: the older daughter is married and lives separately with her family and the second daughter is at school. In order to make money, Jyrgalbek works on construction and his wife is a librarian. In 1998, with the initial investment of 5000 soms, Jyrgalbek started to breed cattle. With money received from the loan he wants to purchase a bull in order to increase the number of cattle. 

Shapagat T. is the treasurer of the group. She is 48 and married. She has five daughters and a son: the first daughter is married and lives separately with her family and the other children are at school. Twenty years ago, due to the child’s birth, Shapagat was given a cow as a present for such an event.  And since that moment Shapagat has been breeding cattle. She applied for the loan because she wants to purchase a bull to increase the number of cattle. 

Joldosh M., 54, is married. He has two daughters, the older daughter is married and lives separately with her family and the second daughter lives with the parents and helps them with housework. In order to make money, Joldosh purchases currants in the villages and then resells at the higher price in Bishkek. He has also been breeding cattle for ten years. With money received from the loan he wants to purchase a calf for breeding.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase three sheep.

loans.name: C9454 Dufatanye 1 Group

texts.en:
Gratien is 37 years old and is married with two children, 8 and 12 years old. He is the leader of this group called Dufatanye which operates a business selling a variety of goods including the sale of foodstuffs. The business hours are from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

As the number of their customers has increased to the extent that Gratien and his team are not able to satisfy the demand, they need to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, they will be able to satisfy the demand and, in addition to that, they will be able to keep reinvesting for better financial stability in the future.

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods, mainly foodstuffs, to sell

loans.name: El Triunfo Group

texts.es:
La Sra. María Luisa, tiene 60 años, es viuda y tiene 8 hijos, todos mayores D. edad. Ella forma parte del grupo "El Trinfo", formado por 7 integrantes residentes del distrito D. Carabayllo. Sus compañeros la eligieron como Fiscal D. la Junta Directiva del grupo por sus características D. responsabilidad y honestidad.
La Sra. maría Luisa se dedica a la preparación D. queques los cuales ofrece y venD. en una fábrica cercana a su casa a los trabajadores.
hace quince años inició ésta actividad,. por las necesidades económicas que tenía en ese entonces, comenzó vendiendo golosinas y compraba los queques ya preparados, hasta que uno D. sus hijos la animó a que ellos mismas hicieran la preparación para tener un poco mas D. ganancia.
Con su trabajo ha podido afrontar gastos para mejorar su salud, estudios D. sus hijos que ahora son profesionales y apoyar a uno D. sus hijos con el cuidado y mantención D. su nieto.
Una D. sus próximas metas es viajar a Argentina, para apoyar a su hija que tiene un negocio D. comidas.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra D. insumos para la preparación D. queques.
texts.en:
María Luisa, 60, is a widow; she has 8 adult children. She is a member of the “El Triunfo” (Triumph) communal bank which has 7 members residents of Carabayllo district. Her fellow members elected her Overseer on the group’s Board of Directors because of her responsibility and honesty. María Luisa prepares Bundt cakes that she sells to employees at a factory near her home. She began this activity 15 years ago due to the economic need she faced then. She started selling sweets and pre-maD. cakes until one of her children encouraged her to start making them herself in order to increase her profits a bit. Her work has maD. it possible for her to face expenses related to improving her health, for her children’s education (they are all now professionals), and to help one of her sons care for and support her grandson. One of her next goals is to go to Argentina to help her daughter who has a food business. The received loan will be used to buy ingredients to make her cakes.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her pastry business.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 35-year-old married man living in Chtoura with his wife and three children.

Fadi has worked in transportation since 2003; he owns a small van that he uses to transport people all over the country, in addition to providing trips for tourists. His clients like working with him because of his good reputation among others in the same field.

Fadi is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to pay for his van's registration. His van is his only source of living and he works hard on keeping it legal and up-to-date as much as he can.

Fadi hopes he can open a travel agency in the future where he will own a number of vans with the aim of providing organized trips for tourists all over Lebanon.

loans.use: To pay for his van's registration

loans.name: Marie Goreth

texts.en: Marie Goreth is 37 years old and has four children between the ages of six and 15, all of whom go to school. She is married to a farmer. Marie sells beer and milk and has spent 12 years in this business. With the loan she will buy more beer and new products as well as equipment. With the profits she will set up a bar as her own business. Right now she has a small number of customers due to the small quantity of sales. She dreams of having three times what she has today when the loan is obtained.

loans.use: To buy alcoholic drinks e.g. beer to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa es socia del Banco Comunal “Santiago Patrón” ubicado en el distrito Santiago de Pupuja, provincia de Azángaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 49 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 03 hijos, la señora tiene estudios de educación secundaria completa.

Elsa viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela R. desde hace 4 años,  nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar el capital de  su negocio de venta de animales menores.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, dinero con la que podrá comprar más animales para su negocio venta de animales menores.
	
Su sueño es tener más capital para mejorar su negocio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la facilidad del préstamo y las ganancias del ahorro.
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the Santiago Patrón Communal Bank.  It is in the Santiago de Pupuja district, Azángaro province, Puno department.  She is 49 years old, married, and has three children.  She has a high school education.

Elsa has been working with the Manuela R. Movimiento for four years.  She tells us that with her first loan for 300 soles she was able to increase the capital in her business of selling small animals.

She is requesting a new loan for 3,000 to buy more animals for her business of selling small animals.  Her dream is to have more capital in order to improve her business.

What she likes the most about her communal bank is the easy terms of the loan and the earnings from saving.

loans.use: To buy more animals for her business of selling small animals

loans.name: Jakeline

texts.es: Jakeline tiene 21 años, vive con su pareja en casa de sus padres, en compañía de ellos y de  sus hermanos. Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza desde hace 3 años, de una reconocida marca a nivel mundial, lo hace con la modalidad de catálogos, donde sus clientes ven y eligen el producto que desean comprar, asimismo tiene productos en stock, por lo que obtiene muy buenas ganancias. Le gusta mucho este  trabajo porque es tranquilo y confía mucho en su capacidad de persuasión para recomendar a sus  compradoras los colores de maquillaje que mas les asientan. Paralelamente a esta actividad se dedica también a preparar Queques, que vende una vez por semana, sobretodo los viernes, elabora media docena y los vende por pedidos, además cuenta con una granja de pollos en su casa, de las cuales esta empezando a vender. Como es una joven muy emprendedora para el futuro quiere mejorar  su granja y tener mayor capital de trabajo. Es su segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que son responsables y muy solidarias, asimismo agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá una parte para adquirir más mercadería, además desea pagar un terreno que va a comprar para ampliar su granja de animales menores.
texts.en:
Jakeline is 21 years old.  She lives with her partner in her parents' home along with her parents and her siblings.  She has been selling beauty products from a world-known brand for 3 years.  She sells her products through catalogs.  Her customers select the products which they want to buy.  She also has products in stock and she makes good profits.  She likes this work very much because it is calm and she has a lot of faith in her powers of persuasion, recommending to her customers the make-up colors which suit them best.  In parallel with this activity, she also makes sponge cakes which she sells once a week, mainly on Fridays.  She makes half a dozen and sells them to order.  She also has a chicken farm at her house and she is beginning to sell the chickens.  As she is a very entrepreneurial young woman, in the future she would like to improve her farm and have better working capital.

This is the second loan which she has had from MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She likes being part of her community bank because all its members are responsible people who are all very supportive of each other.  She is grateful to all the people who will help fund her loan as it will be very useful for her to make progress in her business.  She will invest part of the loan in acquiring more merchandise and also use part to pay for a plot of land which she is going to buy to extend her farm for small animals.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise as well as paying for a plot of land to extend her farm for small animals

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.es: Jimmy Tiene 22 años, vive con sus padres y sus hermanos. Hace más de 4 años toca en una banda, de música vernacular, trabaja generalmente los fines de semana, acompañado de su propio instrumento, que es un saxofón toca en eventos sociales, que siempre se dan en su localidad y alrededores. Gracias a las ganancias que recibe, puede estudiar en la universidad y cubrir sus gastos, ya que estudia ingeniería. Disfruta de su trabajo ya que desde muy joven siempre ha tocado varios instrumentos musicales, en un principio solo lo hacía como pasatiempo, hoy es su fuente de ingresos, pero su gran anhelo es convertirse en un profesional. Es el crédito número 2 con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que recibirá, lo invertirá en la compra de otro instrumento de mejor calidad de la que tiene.
texts.en:
Jimmy is 22 years old.  He lives with his parents and his siblings.  For more than 4 years he has been playing in a band which plays native music.  He generally works weekends and plays his own instrument which is a saxophone.  He plays at social events which are always taking place in his town and the surrounding areas.  Thanks to the profits that he makes, he can study at university and cover his expenses.  He is studying engineering.  Jimmy likes his work since he has always played a number of musical instruments since he was very young.  At first he only played as a hobby but today it is his source of income.  However, his great wish is to become a professional.

This is Jimmy's 2nd loan with MFP.  He is happy to know that he has this financial support and he enjoys being a member of his community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  He is grateful to those who will help to fund his loan because it will be very useful to him in making progress in his business.  He will use his loan to buy an instrument which is of better quality than the one he has now.

loans.use: To buy a saxophone to replace his existing one

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 37 years old and is a single mother of three school-going children. She is hardworking and determined to succeed. She runs a grocery business where she sells cabbage, sukumawiki (kales), onions, tomatoes, among other products. She wants to start selling cereals on the side and thus has requested a loan of 20,000 Kes to buy cereals, sukumawiki (kales), and tomatoes. She hopes to own a pick-up in five years for her business.

loans.use: To buy cereals, sukumawiki (kales), and tomatoes

loans.name: Pin

texts.en: Pin N. is a 37-year-old woman, married to Orm Brous, age 37, and they both appear in the picture here. This couple has no children. They make their living by planting various crops on their own farmland.  From this business they can generate an income of around US$ 4.75 per day. This rice-harvesting season, Pin N. wishes to buy rice in bulk from another village at low cost, stock it, and then resell it to gain more profit.

loans.use: To buy rice and stock it to sell when the price rises.

loans.name: Sanjidmaa

texts.en: Sanjidmaa L. is 36 years old and lives with her husband and two children in their house and fence in Harhorin, the ancient capital city of the Mongolian empire, in the Uvurhangai province in Mongolia. Her son is a university student and her daughter attends a local secondary school. Her husband works as a fireman for the local museum and Sanjidmaa operates a souvenir products trading business between April and October, which is a seasonal business. In addition, she sells a variety of shoes from her home during winter months to supplement her earnings. She started her souvenir trading business in 1998 and has since built a stable operation. Her earnings have enabled her to buy her own car for her family. She is a modest and hardworking woman and is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to buy more souvenir products for her business.

loans.use: To buy more souvenir products

loans.name: Anatalia

texts.en:
Anatalia B. is from the village of Barangay 18, Gingoog City. She is 51 years old. Anatalia is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Anatalia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste in the local community. Anatalia has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Anatalia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anatalia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Anatalia is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Anatalia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue she generates to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en: Hanh T. T. N. is 39 years old. Before joining with our credit program in 2004, she had been a farmer. But when she obtained a loan from Seda, she changed her business mind. She invested in selling birds as pets. This kind of business allows her family economy to improve. Last year, she borrowed 6,758,000 VND. Due to the higher demand of customers, she hopes to get a loan of 8,502,000 VND to buy a variety of birds to meet the customer's tastes in raising birds.

loans.use: To buy a variety of birds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy necessary construction supplies.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is 26 years old, married, and has 1 child who is four years old. Priscilla has had her restaurant for 2 years and employs 1 person to help her. 

Her business is open from 7 am to 9 pm.  Priscilla will use this loan to purchase more food to sell. If she is successful and able to make a profit from the use of her loan, she would like to grow her business.

loans.use: To expand her restaurant

loans.name: Rasheeda's Group

texts.en:
Rasheeda has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to expand his shoe-making business. With the loan, he will purchase leather, shoe buckles and shoe laces which will allow him to manufacture a larger number of shoes and earn better profits. He started this business five years ago. He takes orders from different shoe shops and factories. 

Rasheeda is a housewife as well as a seamstress. She stays at home and does her household chores. Then she uses her sewing skills to sew beautiful clothes for her neighboring clients and earns well from it.  She has given birth to two sons and a daughter.  All of them are still young and enrolled in a local school. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting. She is hopeful that an investment will bring good changes to her husband’s business and increase his profits. 

She lives in Jaranwala which is a small city in Punjab Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in the area of Sultan park with her family in a single-room brick house for the past 14 years. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rasheeda.

loans.use: To buy leather, shoe buckles, and shoe laces for making shoes.

loans.name: Isabel Del Carmen

texts.es: LA SEÑORA O.  LABORA COMO SECRETARIA EJECUTIVA ,ES  SOLTERA ,TIENE  UNA PERSONAS  A SU CARGO, ES  EL SEPTIMO CREDITO  QUE CEPRODEL LE OTORGA, AGRADECE EL APOYO  QUE  LE HA BRINDADO  CEPRODEL  CON LOS DESEMBOLSO QUE LE HAN APROBADO , ESTE CREDITO LO NECESITA PARA COMPRAR MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO CERAMICA, PORCELANA, BOOM Y PAGAR  MANO DE OBRA  PARA PISO  DE SU VIVIENDA.
texts.en:
Sra. Isabel O. works as an executive secretary. She is single and has one dependent. This is the seventh loan she has received from CEPRODEL. She is grateful for the financial support that CEPRODEL has given to her.

This loan will be used to buy construction materials such as ceramics, porcelain, insulation foam, as well as pay for labor to install a floor in her home.

loans.use: To pay for materials and labor required to install a floor in her home.

loans.name: Griselda Lucia

texts.es:
Griselda de 32 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene un taller de confección y costura. Ella aprendió a temprana edad confeccionar y coser ropa poco a poco con un capital invirtió en telas y convirtió la confección en su actividad económica. 

En la actualidad trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 18h00 de lunes a sábados, cose y confecciona uniformes y ropa de distintas personas que le hacen por pedido. Los uniformes deportivos los vende a $ 5.60, los vestidos a $ 18.00, costuras para mujeres a $ 15.00. Quiere continuar con su negocio pero para ello necesita tener materia prima como tela, hilos, botones para confeccionar mas ropa. En el futuro quiere tener un taller bien surtido.
texts.en:
Griselda is a hardworking 32-year-old woman who has a sewing workshop. She learned to make and sew clothing at an early age and little by little, she invested in fabrics and created her business.

She currently works Monday through Saturday from 8am to 6pm. She sews and makes uniforms and clothing for different people who place orders with her. She sells sports uniforms at $5.60, dresses at $18.00, and woman’s clothing at $15.00. Griselda wants to continue with her business, but she needs raw materials such as fabric, thread and button to make more clothing. In the future, she wants to have a well-stocked workshop.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and buttons.

loans.name: Dolores Isela

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Damas Positivas.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Dolores. Tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres  hijos de 20, 16 y 13 años que  estudian en universidad y  colegio. Su esposo es chofer profesional.

Tiene un negocio de imprenta y copiadora en su casa, aprovecha que su casa está ubicada cerca de un colegio de la localidad, trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 6h30 hasta las 17 h00 y a veces cuando alguien necesita algo hasta más tarde, tiene este negocio hace ya tres años y dice que en este corto tiempo su negocio ha ido creciendo poco a poco.
 
Este crédito es para comprar hojas de papel, útiles escolares, carpetas,  entre otras cosas. Lleva 8 años  en el Banco comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos recibidos de la institución ha podido comprar ciertas cosas para su imprenta, como por ejemplo un crédito le ayudo a comprar la copiadora. 

Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y prestar también servicio de internet.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the Manabi capital known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds, the communal bank "Damas Positivas" meets every two weeks.

Here we meet Mrs. Dolores, age 41, who is married and has three children, ages 20, 16 and 13, who are in college and school.  Her husband is a professional driver.

She has a printing and photocopying business in her home, taking advantage of the fact that it is near the town school.  She works Monday through Friday from 6:30 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. and even later, if someone needs something.  She has been in business for three years and says that in this short amount of time business has been growing little by little.

This loan will be used to buy reams of paper, school supplies and folders, among other things.  She has been a member of the communal bank for eight years and, thanks to the loans received from the institution, has been able to buy things for her printing business.  One of the loans was used to buy a photocopy machine.

Her dream is to expand business and begin offering Internet services.

loans.use: To buy reams of paper, folders and school supplies, etc.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, age 60, works hard to provide for her family. She has owned and operated a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines for the past 21 years and also earns additional income from a coffee shop business. She has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF and is currently requesting a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more merchandise to offer for sale.
 
Teresita is married and has one child. In the future, she aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise to offer for sale

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a business woman who hails from Kyenjojo district. She is a Ugandan female aged 40 years who owns a boutique that sells second-hand clothes. She dreams of educating her six children and setting up other income-generating activities from which she can earn an extra income. She acquired her initial capital from a retail shop she owned. Margret wants a loan to buy jeans and shirts for resale in her boutique.

loans.use: To  buy jeans and shirts for resale.

loans.name: Piscis De Agua Escondida Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Picis D. Agua Escondida, por que esta ubicado en la comunidad D. Agua escondida en el Estado D. México. El grupo esta conformado por 8 integrantes. La señora Ana es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 22 años, estudio hasta la secundaria y se dedica a la cria y engorda D. ganado que inicio hace 2 años. Solicita el prestamo para comprar más puercos ya que en eL poblado se utiliza mucho a los puercos en las fiestas para comer y tambien para comercializar su carne por lo cual le hacen muchos pedidos y tiene que invertir para poder expandirse a comunidades aledañas. La señora los cria y alimenta desD. pequeños para poder venderlos a buen precio por la región. Con las ganancias que obtenga quiere terminar la construccion D. su casa y ahorar para la educación D. sus hijos y así ofrecerles una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
This group is called "Picis D. Agua Escondida" because it is located in the community of Agua Escondida, in the State of Mexico.  The group has eight members and Ana is the group's president.

Ana is 22 years old.  She has a high school level of education and her business is raising and fattening livestock.  She started this business two years ago.  She is requesting this loan to buy more pigs since pigs are commonly eaten in the village during fiestas.  She would also like to sell their meat because she has many orders.  She will invest in her business because she would like to expand it into neighboring communities.  Ana raises and feeds her pigs from the time they are very young so that she can sell them for a good price in her region.  She would like to use the profits she makes to finish building her house.  She would also like to save up for her children's education and be able to offer them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise and sell

loans.name: Aidee

texts.es:
La señora Aidée, es de coapilla estado de Chiapas México,  ella es casada con el señor Jesús, con quien procreo dos hijos y que a un están a su respobsabilidad: cesar David de veinti un años, Cristian de Jesús de diecisiete años.

     Ella  se dedica a la  panadería y solicito el préstamo para apoyarse con la compra de ingredientes, como son: huevo, aceite, azúcar, queso, entre otros, así  poder elaborar más seguido su actividad ya que es con la que obtiene ingresos en su hogar.

      Ella se inspiro en esta actividad para  tener sus propios in regresos así apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa y darle lo más necesario a sus hijos que están estudiando.

       Su más grande deseo es que con esta pequeña actividad y el préstamo pueda trabajar para que con el tiempo pueda y tener sus propios ahorros para su pequeño hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. Aidée is from Coapilla in the State of Chiapas, Mexico. She is married to Sr. Jesús and they have two children who are their responsibility, Cesar David (age 21) and Cristian de Jesús (age 17).

Aidée operates a bakery and is requesting a loan to help with buying ingredients such as eggs, oil, sugar, cheese, and other items. By being able to produce more, she can continue with her business and generate household income.

Aidée was inspired to start her business so that she could have her own income and help her husband with the household expenses, as well as provide what her children need most since they are in school. Her greatest wish is to utilize this loan so that she can continue working in her small business and accumulate some household savings over time.

loans.use: to purchase eggs, oil, sugar, cheese, and other items for making bread.

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline is a single woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food. 

For the past two years, Magdaline has operated a beauty salon and her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is seasonality. During the holiday season, Magdaline experiences a high number of customers. She dreams of expanding and starting a boutique business in the future.

Magdaline plans to use this KES 40,000 loan to purchase a blow dryer, hair weaves and hair chemicals. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a blow dryer, hair weaves and hair chemicals.

loans.name: Sol De Cayumanqui Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal se llama “Sol de Cayumanqui” está conformado por 17 emprendedores que se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran venta de ropa para niños, venta de provisiones, atención en un kiosco, repostería y servicios. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillán.
Sandra quien en la foto se encuentra en el lugar de al medio, vistiendo una chaqueta color gris, pantalones y cartera color negro y que además usa su cabello tomado. Se dedica a atender un kiosco que tiene ubicado en el patio de su casa, ahí vende preferentemente provisiones y confites. Se dedica a éste rubro desde hace dos años. Su mercadería la compra en distribuidoras y supermercados mayoristas. Comenta que vende muchos confites y esto ha mantenido bien su negocio, sin embargo la venta de provisiones se ha dificultado debido a la competencia de los negocios. Su horario de trabajo es durante todo el día, y todos los días de la semana, de ésta manera no pierde clientela, ni ventas. 
Con el crédito comprará dulces, galletas, saborizantes para la leche, duraznos y pescado en conserva.
Sus metas en su negocio son prosperar y generar mayores ingresos para aportar económicamente en su casa y optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Sandra vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijos de 19 y 9 años de edad. Su hija mayor se está preparando para rendir la prueba de selección universitaria en un preuniversitario, sus sueños es que pueda estudiar una carrera universitaria, de esta manera acceder a un titulo profesional. Otro de sus sueños seria salir a vacacionar con toda su familia a diferentes lugares del país. 
Sandra está muy contenta y agradecida de los servicios obtenidos por Fondo Esperanza y destaca con mucho orgullo los valores que se inculcan en la institución, como son la honestidad y solidaridad, para concretarlos en el grupo del Banco comunal. Comenta que ha aprendido de las capacitaciones, ya que ahora está generando estrategias para innovar en su negocio y de ésta manera captar un mayor número de clientes. De ésta manera incorporará la venta de mermeladas caseras y productos de repostería, que ella misma prepara. 
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Sol de Cayumanqui” and is composed of 17 entrepreneurs who are in a variety of occupations.  Among them are: children’s clothing sales, grocery sales, running a kiosk, pastry making and services.  All of them are from the city of Chillán.

Sandra, who in the photo is in the middle wearing a gray jacket, black pants and purse and has her hair gathered up, runs a kiosk in her front yard where she sells groceries and snacks.  She’s been in this line of work for two years.  She buys her merchandise from suppliers and wholesale supermarkets.  She comments that she sells lots of snacks and that’s kept her business well.  However, selling groceries has been somewhat difficult because of competition.  Her work schedule is all day, every day of the week.  This way she does not lose any customers or any sales.  She will use the loan to buy candy, cookies, flavorings for milk, peaches and canned fish.  Her business goals are to prosper and to generate higher income to provide for her home economically and attain a better quality of life.

Sandra lives with her husband and two children who are 19 and 9 years of age.  Her oldest daughter is taking classes at a university prep school to get ready to take her university admission test.  Her dream is that she’ll be able to study a university career and attain a professional degree.  Another of her dreams is to go on vacation with the entire family to various places in the country.

Sandra is very happy with and grateful for the services obtained from Fondo Esperanza and stresses proudly the values that are instilled in the institution, like honesty and solidarity, to incorporate into the communal bank group.  She comments that she’s learned from the training sessions and is now generating strategies to innovate her business to acquire a larger number of customers.  In this way she plans to incorporate home-made jams and pastry items that she herself makes.

Chillán is a commune in south-central Chile.  Its name means “chair of the sun” in Mapudungun, the indigenous Mapuche language.  Chillán is known as the “Nation’s Cradle” or “Land of Artists” because many outstanding figures in Chile’s history were born here, like the well-known pianist, Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Khodor

texts.en: Khodor is a 25-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and three siblings. He is the main owner of a plot of land. His job consists of cultivating different types of vegetables such as peas, beans etc… Today, he is asking to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase pesticides and seeds in order to increase his business productivity. He has one part-time employee helping him with the work and hopes to be able to further expand his business so that he can provide this employee with a full-time job.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides and seeds

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es: Maria Angelica: se dedica a la venta de ropa tipica tales como servilletas,blusas.etc ella nos cuenta que esta muy contenta porque fape le a podido ayudar le da gracias a Dios por haber tenido la oportunidad de tener los credito anteriores y cancelarlos y ahora esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa tipica ya que esta convencida de que le falta capital para surtir su venta y satisfacer la nececidad de sus clientes,
texts.en: Maria Angelica: se dedica a la venta de ropa tipica tales como servilletas,blusas.etc ella nos cuenta que esta muy contenta porque fape le a podido ayudar le da gracias a Dios por haber tenido la oportunidad de tener los credito anteriores y cancelarlos y ahora esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa tipica ya que esta convencida de que le falta capital para surtir su venta y satisfacer la nececidad de sus clientes,

loans.use: Compra de ropa tipica para la venta.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Ana Jasmin

texts.es:
Ana, se dedica a la venta de bisutería al por mayor, vive con su esposo y sus hijos de 12 y 2 años de edad, tiene 5 años de estar trabajando con el negocio de la bisutería, con este negocio ha logrado generar ingresos para su hogar.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de dos vitrinas y piedras para la elaboración de collares y pulseras, esta compra le ayudara a mejorar el negocio, teniendo exhibido sus productos, para que los clientes puedan apreciar los estilos de los accesorios.
El sueño de Ana es tener un negocio amplio, apoyando a sus hijos a través de él, y estabilizando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Ana has a business selling costume jewelry at wholesale.  She lives with her husband and their children aged 12 and 2.  She has had this jewelry business for 5 years, and with it she has managed to generate income for her household.

Now she requests a loan to buy two glass display cases and stones to make necklaces and bracelets. These purchases will help to improve her business by giving her a place to display her products so that her customers can appreciate the style of her accessories.

Ana's dream is to have a bigger business through which she can better support her children and stabilize her income.

loans.use: to buy 2 glass display cases and stones to use in making necklaces and bracelets

loans.name: Blanca Josefina

texts.es:
señora Blanca Josefina tiene ya más de cinco años dedicándose a la venta abarrotes. 
  Solicita un préstamo para invertir en comprar mercancía que es productos en lata, verdura, frutas y carnes frías. 
Desea tener mas variedad para vender ya que sus clientes le están solicitando este tipo de productos y para ella será mucho mejor así tendrá más ingreso a la familia y podrá darle el estudio necesario a su hija quien esta estudiando la universidad. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene.
texts.en:
Blanca Josefina has been selling groceries for over five years.
She requests a loan in order to purchase merchandise such as canned goods, vegetables, fruits and cold cuts.
She wishes to sell a wider variety of goods, because her customers have been asking for this kind of merchandise and it will be much better for her. This way she will get more income for her family and she will be able to provide education for her daughter, who is a college student.
She plans to repay the loan with part of the profits she makes from her business, since it's her source of income.

loans.use: to purchase goods for the grocery store.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 25 years old young man, he is a Palestinian National Authority employee with decent salary. Mohammad will soon get married and he wants to make some repairs to the house he will live in with his wife such as: painting, windows, doors, etc; he will prepare his house well for this event, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay, so he needs to take a loan of amount $2,000 from FATEN. When Mohammad gets the loan, he will pay with the amount he has to repair his house well preparing to his wedding, he will improve his house and live in better life conditions. Mohammad is photographed in the picture in FATEN branch.

loans.use: To pay for his wedding expenses.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua has been selling charcoal for 10 years. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a driver. As part of her responsibilities, she assists him in providing for the family's general needs. Efua will use this loan to purchase more bags of charcoal for resale. With the new profits from her extended business, Efua plans to buy more charcoal for sale.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel  is 29 years old. She is married with 4 children.
Rachel is engaged in buying and selling scrap materials, empty bottles and plastics. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy more scrap materials. Rachel has been a member of HSPFI since 20101. In the future, Rachel  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To have capital to buy and sell scrap materials, empty bottles and plastics.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en: Raphael is married and blessed with four children. He has been selling wire mesh for the last twenty years to bring up his family. He also does farming for more income. He has employed two people to assist him in the business. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access loans to boost his business. Raphael has requested a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to add stock of wire mesh.

loans.use: To add stock of wire mesh.

loans.name: Peter Matheka

texts.en:
Peter has been selling clothes for the last 12 years in Emali town. He used his first loan to buy a bale of clothes. His business is doing well, and he paid back the loan well without any difficulties.
Peter has now applied for a second loan, which he intends to use to add stock of trousers, blouses, skirts, and sweaters.

In the future, Peter hopes to expand his business and stock all varieties of clothes.

loans.use: to add stock of trousers, blouses, skirts, and sweaters.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 30-year-old married man with three children, living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His family goal is to educate his children. He operates a retail shop which he started three years ago and faces a challenge of lack of capital. Richard needs the loan to buy sugar and salt for resale.

loans.use: to buy sugar and salt for resale.

loans.name: Ma. Aida

texts.en:
52-year-old Ma. Aida has been running a sari-sari store business for 10 years. She lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol with her family. Ma. Aida sells various items like soap, shampoo, bread and canned goods. She also makes ice scramble (smoothies) to sell in her community.

Ma. Aida is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell such as rice, bread and canned goods. She hopes to earn more and be able to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as rice, bread and canned goods

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en:
Seraphine is 24 years old and has two children, aged two and three. She owns a general store, and she is married to a mechanic. 

The loan will be used to buy more rice and sugar to sell in her store. Any profits will be used to reinvest in her business and pay school fees for her children. She would one day like to own a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Elisabete

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Provincia de Gaza tem 46 anos de idade,  é casada vive na casa própria com sua familia não responsabiliza se por ninguem. 
É  negociante a mais de 14 anos e conta com ajuda do marido que trabalha na Africa do Sul, vende roupas usadas no Mercado Informal nas Quertas e Sabados no periodo das 5h as 12h. Tem um rendimento mensal de 3.500.00mt que aplica nas dispesas da casa e da sua obra. 
Este é seu terceiro empréstimo na  Hluvuku no valor de 8.000.00mt com o qual pretende aumentar o volume da sua mercadoria ( compra e venda de roupa usada), os anteriores de 3.500.00 e 5.000.00mt foram para o comércio.
futuramente pretende adquirir mais empréstimos para a reabilitação da sua resindêcia.
texts.en:
Elisabete was born in the province of Gaza. She is 46 years old and married. She lives in her own home with her family, and doesn't take care of anyone else.
She has had a business for more than 14 years. Her husband, who works in South Africa, also contributes to the household. She sells used clothing at the Informal Market on Fridays and Saturdays from 5 a.m. to noon. She earns about 3,500 meticals a month, which she uses to cover household expenses and for building her home.
This is her third loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 8,000 meticals, which she will use to increase the quantity of merchandise (used clothing) she carries. She used the previous loans, in the amounts of 3,500 and 5,000 meticals, for her business.
In the future she'd like to request more loans to renovate her home.

loans.use: to buy used clothing for her business.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua  extracts oil from palm kernel to sell. She also sells gari at Benkyadze near Elmina. Ekua is a single parent with 6  dependents. She uses her income to feed and clothe her family and to pay her bills. She has been into this business  for some time now. She will use her loan to purchase more fish for sale and palm kernels for the extraction of the oil to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for sale and palm kernel for the extraction of the oil to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 39 years old and married with three children, aged 10,12 and 15. She does dairy farming to earn a living. She has been in the business for 5 years and has employed two people. She earns extra income from her farming activities. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Empezó siendo comerciante de ropa y de productos de belleza tiempo atrás, y hasta la fecha, se ha mantenido con esta activdad que le ha resultado muy buena.  Trabaja sola todo el día, cuando realiza sus recorridos.  Es casada y su esposo es chef.  Tiene hijos y estudian en la escuela fiscal.  Desea que su negocio se incremente mucho más a futuro para seguir creciendo económicamente.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de ropa, cremas y perfumes para su venta.
texts.en:
The client is from the city of Libertad.  She started selling clothes and beauty products some time ago.  She has maintained this business activity to date, and it has turned out very well for her.  

She works alone all day, which is when she makes her sales related travels.  She is married, and her husband is a chef.  She has children, and they go to the public school.

She wishes for her business to increase a lot more in the future in order to continue growing financially.  She now needs the loan to buy clothes, creams, and perfumes to sell.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Mahougnon Pk14 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOUGNON PK14 est composé de quatre personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Pascaline (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 52 ans a arrêté au niveau secondaire. Pascaline est mariée a un infirmier du nom de Antonin. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et un a leur charge. Pascaline vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Pascaline vend de tissus par la technique de distribution depuis douze ans. Pascaline s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité Pascaline ensemble avec les membres du groupe MAHOUGNON PK14   sollicite pour la troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des tissus.

loans.name: Good Will Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GOOD WILL est composé de trois  personnes qui  sont dans le même groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe, nommée Roseline (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 31 ans n’a pas fréquentée l’école.  Roseline  est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Daniel Symphorien. Le couple à deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et tous à leur charge.  Roseline  vit ensemble avec son conjoint et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage  sont supportées par le couple. C’est pour cette raison, que  Roseline vend de la bouillie et des vivriers à son domicile depuis une huit ans. Roseline s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Roseline ensemble avec les membres du groupe GOOD WILL sollicite pour une quatrième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs et de sacs de sucre.

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Jean de Dieu is 43 years old. He is married with 5 children aged between 7 and 17 years, they all go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 5 years. While his wife is a business woman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to pay medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a married man and a father of four children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 and has benefited from enterprise development and financial management training. 
Simon does banana and coffee farming. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer so as to improve on production. This will enable him earn more income that will help him provide food for his family and pay school fees for his children.
He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer so as to improve on production hence more income to provide food for his family and pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Laura Esther

texts.en:
To conquer the difficulties that have crossed their path, this is why she started her own business 4 years ago, selling tacos, hamburgers and other food, with the sole ofjective of providing her children with a professional education, one that would give them the opportunity for a better future and wellbeing. Thanks to the active support of her brother, her nieces and her aunt, she has been able to expand and maintain her business during this span of time. But above all thanks to the hard work and her sense of responsibility.

In this moment she requires a loan in the amount of $650 that she will use to purchase merchandise, such as ingredients to make her products. Thsi way sshe can satisfy the demand that she now faces.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

logrado vencer las dificultades que se le han presentado, es por ello que hace 4 años ella comenzó con un negocio propio, la venta de tacos, hamburguesas y comida, con el único objetivo de poder brindarles a sus hijos una educación profesional, misma que le permitiera la posibilidad de un mejor futuro y bienestar. Gracias al el apoyo activo de su hermano, su sobrina y su tía ella ha podido hacer crecer y mantener esta actividad durante todo este tiempo, pero sobre todo gracias a su trabajo y sentido de responsabilidad.

En este momento ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 650 DLLS, mismos que utilizará para la compra de mercancía que requiere como insumos para la elaboración de sus productos, y de esta forma satisfacer la creciente demanda que ahora mismo enfrenta.

loans.use: púrchase merchandise

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a travelling merchant and takes her products (shirts, briefcases, cosmetics, etc) in the center of the country (other cities and smaller villages). She is 53 years old and has tree sons. She has more than 10 years of experience in her line of business and her work allows her to support her family. They live in the San Pedro district in the city of La Paz

Her sales are monthly and she takes her merchandise to the middle of the contry and delivery quantities.

She has been a client of Impro since September 2003. Her history with our organization has qualified her as a number 1 client, that is to say, with a Very Good recommenation. The total amount of requestest money will be put towrads the purchase of merchandise.

Her work experience and previous loans with Impro have allowed her access to ask for this loan. She already has the business experience necessary to wisely use this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Julia es comerciante viajera y lleva sus productos (poleras, carteras, cosméticos, etc.) al interior de país (otras ciudades y poblaciones pequeñas). Tiene 53 años y tres hijos, su experiencia en el rubro es de más de 10 años y su trabajo le permite sostener a su familia. Vive en la zona de San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz. Sus ventas son quincenales ya que lleva mercadería al interior del país y entrega por cantidad Es cliente de Impro, desde septiembre del año 2003. Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento Muy Bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de mercadería. Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio. El cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Gabina Rafaela

texts.es:
Gabina is a 37-year-old married mother of three children. Her husband works in public transportation, while she buys clothes (for men, women and children) in the city of San Cristobal and later sells them to people in her community. Gabina works with Amparo Ortega, a general dressmaker who works off of order from the neighborhood. Together they are requesting the loan. Gabina plans to use it to purchase more clothes at a lower price, and thus make more profits. Amparo plans to use it to purchase sowing supplies so she can sell more clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

GABINA TIENE 37 AÑOS , CASADA TRES HIJOS SU ESPOSO ES CHOFER DE LA LOCOMOCION COLECTIVA. ELLA COMPRA EN LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL , ROPA DE HOMBRES MUJERES Y NIÑOS LAS CUALES DESPUES VENDE ENTRE LAS PERSONAS QUE INTEGRAN SU COMUNIDAD.ELLA PERTENECE AL GRUPO ENRIQUE MOLINA 2 JUNTO CON DOÑA AMPARO DIAZ ORTEGAQUIEN SE DEDICA A REALIZAR COSTURAS EN GENERAL SEGÚN LOS PEDIDOS QUE RECIBE ENTRE LAS MUJERES DE SU VECINDAD. GABINA ESPERA INVERTIR SU PRESTAMO COMPRANDO MAS CANTIDAD DE ROPA AL POR MAYOR PARA REBAJAR LOS COSTOS Y ASI OBTENER MEJORES GANANCIAS .EN EL CASO DE AMPARO ELLA QUIERE INVERTIR EN HILOS , GENEROS Y ASI PODER CONFECCIONAR ROPA PARA VENDER .

loans.use: Purchase clothes to resell

loans.name: Zeenat

texts.en:
“I am Zeenat B.. I have three children. I have to stay at home to take care of my children because they are very young. My husband runs a furniture showroom to meet our household expenses. He earns well from his current business but wishes to expand the business to increase his income. I also want to educate my children. Therefore, for the expansion of my husband’s business and for the education of my children, I need a loan of loan which can increase my husband income and with this increased income, enable my children to get an education”

Zeenat B., Pakistan

loans.use: For the expansion of my husband's furniture business

loans.name: Ke

texts.en: Mrs. Ke P., age 32, is a widow who runs a grocery business out of her home, earning about $3 per day. Her two children are too young to go to school or work. She would like to borrow $400 to expand her inventory of grocery products to grow her business and provide for her children’s education in the future.

loans.use: To purchase grocery products to expand her inventory

loans.name: Liz Halley

texts.es:
Liz works enthusiastically every day in her business of selling appliances in the Pichanaki market. She gained a lot of experience in this line of work when she lived in Lima, and abandoned this profitable work to establish her home with her husband in Pichanaki. The location of her business is rented, and thanks to her work, she has been able to improve the quality of life of her two-year-old daughter, who she loves very much and who is the reason she strives every day to offer her the best. Her main goal is to obtain her own location and to be able to buy new and innovative products for her business to be able to satisfy the demand of her clients. She hopes that we will help her continue working like she has until now and that we will contribute to improving her business through a loan. She is awaiting your contribution and promises not to disappoint you.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Liz, trabaja animosamente en su puesto de ventas de artefactos diariamente en el mercado de Pichanaki, ella logró reunir gran experiencia en esta actividad estando en la ciudad de Lima, abandonando este rentable trabajo por establecer su hogar junto a su esposo en la ciudad de Pichanaki.El local de su negocio es alquilado y gracias a esta actividad ha podido contribuir a mejorar la calidad de vida de su pequeña hija de dos añitos, a quién ama mucho y por la que se esfuerza diariamente con la meta de poder de brindarle lo mejor. Su meta principal adquirir un local propio y así mismo poder comprar nuevos y novedosos productos para su puesto de ventas a fin de satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.Ella desea que la ayudemos con el fin de seguir trabajando como hasta ahora y contribuyamos también con el mejoramiento de su negocio a través de un préstamo.Ella espera su colaboración y promete no decepcionarlo.

loans.use: Increase in capital to acquire a larger quantity of appliances for domestic use for her long list of clients.

loans.name: Imeleta

texts.en: Imeleta is a 39-year-old mother of two. Her business is running a flea market, selling handicrafts in front of her house and at a stall at the Savalalo market. She makes $100.00-150.00 WST ($40-60 USD) a day from selling handicrafts and she uses her earnings to help support her family.

loans.use: To restock her flea market stall

loans.name: Nabaziza C (I) Group

texts.en:
The group has been together for one year. Zaina is 35 years old and married with eight children. She has a tailoring business and also sells new clothes. Teddy and Noeline are poultry farmers and want to use the loan to expand their businesses. Margret wants to build a piggery shelter with the loan. Alice owns a retail shop. Zaina intends to buy a serging machine for designing clothes with the extra business profits.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more bitenge cloth

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
Two weeks ago Jacinta's business was robbed. Some criminals broke in and stole equipment from the calling center that she had opened with her son. The store had been open just five months.

Jacinta tells us that it was her son who gave her the idea of having a calling center. At first he rented cell phone equipment at his university, but because of the competition he faced, he decided to buy a stand and to do that same business from his home. When she saw how well things were going, his mother thought of opening her own calling center. Thanks to a loan from EDAPROSPO, they were able to buy the necessary equipment.

Jacinta is a hard-working woman and in addition to managing this business, she has an internet cafe business and for the past 28 years has run a convenience store. Because of these businesses, the losses from the robbery are not affecting her too much and she knows very well how to get up and start over again. Among her plans are to improve the layout of her calling center so that it has more security.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Hace dos semanas la señora Jacinta sufrió un robo en su negocio. Unos maleantes entraron y le robaron los equipos del locutorio que abrió junto a su hijo. El local recién cumple cinco meses de inaugurado.

Jacinta cuenta que fue su hijo quien le dio la idea de tener un locutorio. Al inicio él alquilaba equipos de celulares en su universidad, pero frente a una gran competencia decidió comprar un módulo y hacer lo mismo afuera de su casa. Al ver que le iba bien pensó con su mamá abrir su locutorio. Gracias a un préstamo que EDAPROSPO les brindo pudieron comprar los equipos necesarios.

Jacinta es una mujer muy trabajadora, además de manejar este negocio alquila cabinas de internet y atiende también en una bodega hace 28 años. Por eso, la perdida que sufrió con el robo no le afecta mucho, pues sabe muy bien como levantarse y volver a empezar. En sus planes esta mejorar la infraestructura de su locutorio para que tenga más seguridad.

loans.use: Improve the layout of her business to make it safer.

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en: Sahar is a 39-year-old woman who lives and works in Aley. Sahar has 3 children and is helping her husband support their family. Sahar makes beautiful embroidery and is applying for a loan at A. Majmoua to buy the necessary materiA. to sustain her small business.

loans.use: to buy material

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy A. is 31 years old, she is currently majoring in accounting at one of the local universities in the city of Trujillo.

She lives in Chongoyape, district of Paiján, province of Ascope in the department of La Libertad – Perú.

Her business began with the sale of women’s and men’s clothing and she received orders from neighbors and acquaintances. She frequently traveled to the city of Lima to bring back exclusive wholesale merchandise. Later she began selling beauty products for the cosmetic line “L´ebel,” with time she has become well-known and has many customers.

She is part of the communal bank “Manos Unidas” where she obtained her first loan of S./300.00with this money she purchased clothing at wholesale prices.

With the S./300.00 loan that she will repay in 6 months, she plans on buying beauty products to complete some orders and have products in stock.

Her ultimate dream is to successfully finish her professional schooling and have her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Nancy A. tiene 31 años de edad, actualmente se encuentra estudiando la carrera de contabilidad en una de las universidades de la ciudad de Trujillo.

Vive en Chongoyape, Distrito de Paiján, Provincia de Ascope del Departamento de La Libertad – Perú.

Su negocio empezó con la venta de ropa para dama y caballeros, tenia pedidos de vecinos y conocidos, constantemente viajaba a la ciudad de Lima para traer modelos exclusivos al por mayor. Posteriormente se dedicó a la venta de productos de belleza de la línea de productos “L´ebel”, con el tiempo se ha hecho conocida y tiene mucha clientela.

Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro ropa al por mayor.

Con el préstamo de S/. 300.00 el cual pagara en cuatro meses comprará productos de belleza para cubrir algunos pedidos y para tener en stock.

Su mayor sueño es terminar con éxito su carrera profesional y tener su propio negocio.

loans.use: With the loan she will purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Akmal

texts.en: This is Akmal, son of M. E.. He lives in the first district of Ningarhar province. Akmal is married and has five children. He is an active person and has been working as a shopkeeper since 2002 in Jalalabad city. But he can't solve his financial problems, therefore he wants to stand on his own feet and improve his small business, so he has requested from AFSG to take a 500,00 Afghanis loan for 18 months. With this loan he wants to buy some more food and materials for his shop.

loans.use: TO buy Foods and materials for his shop

loans.name: Sherali

texts.ru:
Sherali S. lives in Vahdat with his wife and three children. He is 36, and for 10 years of his life, Sherali has been in retail. He owns a store where he sells groceries. Since many food products spoil, causing inventory loss, Sherali has applied for a loan to buy a refrigerator for perishable items and cold drinks. This will preserve Sherali's products, while at the same time providing locals with fresh, unspoiled food. He plans to repay the loan within twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Салимов Шерали житель города Вахдат. Женат и имеет 3 детей. Ему 36 лет и 10 лет из них он занимается торговлей. Имеет магазин , где торгует продуктами питания. В связи с тем , что продукты портятся и из-за этого происходит потеря продуктов . Поэтому Шерали хочет получить кредит и купить холодильник для хранения продуктов питания и прохладительных напитков. Это поможет сохранить продукты на некоторое время , а так же население сможет покупать свежие не испорченные продукты . Погасить кредит Шерали планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
Born in 1974 in Adokpoe, Mrs. Yawa A. is married and the mother of four. A seamstress by training, she faced problems finding stable work and so she began a business stocking and selling corn which provides enough profit to take care of her household expenses. In order to satisfy customer demand and to increase sales, she is applying for a loan that will help her to keep her stock of corn consistent.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Née en 1974 à Adokpoé (P/Zio), Madame A. Yawa est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Couturière de formation, elle a constaté la non rentabilité de son métier et s’est lancée dans le stockage et la vente de maïs qui lui procure un revenu nécessaire pour contribuer aux charges du ménage. Afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et augmenter ses revenus, elle sollicite un financement qui va lui servir de faire un stockage consistant de maïs.

loans.use: Stock and sale of corn.

loans.name: Turabek

texts.ru:
Turabek A. lives in the Vakhsh region of Tajikistan. Turabek is married with 7 children. Although he is a hairdresser by training, he has been working in animal husbandry for the past ten years. He raises and sells livestock. Turabek would like to obtain a loan for buying sheep and goats. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva volunteer.

Азимов Турабек проживает в Вахшском районе. Занимается торговлей крупно-рогатого скота, а так же их разведением. Женат и имеет семерых детей. По образованию парикмахер. Но уже 10 лет занимается животноводством. Теперь он хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы купить овец и коз. Это увеличит поголовье скота. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea C., 43, is a rice farmer and lives with four of her children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She and her husband have been working on their field to grow rice to earn a living and are able to make US$2 per day. Farming is hard as the weather condition is unreliable. Most of the provinces there do not have irrigation systems yet so it too hard to farm by simply depending on the sky. She needs to set up another business as currently her profit is not enough for her standard of living. She is planning to sell groceries. (Chea is pictured with her daughter)

loans.use: Chea would like to set up a grocery store.

loans.name: Marga

texts.es: Marga tiene 22 años, vive con su esposo y su bebe.  Se dedica a la venta de licores en su pequeño local, desde hace ya tres años, para ayudar a la economía familiar, dado que su pareja trabaja en una zona alejada y no permanece mucho tiempo en casa.  Marga se dedica a su local desde las 6 de la tarde hasta la madrugada, ya que es en este lapso, donde existen mayor cantidad de clientes.  En el negocio, le ayudan dos jóvenes que se dedican a la atención, ya que ella por las noches debe atender a su pequeño bebe, siendo esta la parte más difícil, ya que debe dividirse entre su labor de madre y su negocio.    Marga quiere forjarse un mejor porvenir para poder ofrecerle a su bebé mejores oportunidades en la vida.  Con el dinero del préstamo comprará licores, para poder aumentarla su stock de venta en su local.  En el futuro, quiere que su negocio sea mucho más grande y  que genere muchos más ingresos.
texts.en:
Marga is 22 years old and lives with her husband and their baby. She has been selling liquors from her small store for the past three years in order to help with the family expenses. Her husband works far away and doesn’t spend much time at home. Marga tends to her store from 6 in the evening until the early hours of the morning, since this is the time when there are the most customers. She has two employees who help her with the business, since at night she needs to take care of her baby. This is the most difficult part because she must divide her efforts between her duties as a mother and her business. Marga wants to create a better future so that she can offer her baby the best opportunities in life. With the money from the loan, she will buy liquors to augment the stock she has for sale in her store. In the future, she wants her business to be much bigger and for it to generate much more income.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Incrementar el stock de licores para su negocio.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila a sus 43 años de edad es viuda, vive con dos sus hijos que son estudiantes. Se dedica a confeccionar ropa para adultos y niños en los distintos géneros, mayormente trabaja para dos instituciones Educativas que se encuentran ubicadas cerca de su casa, y requieren de su servicios constantemente, esta actividad la viene llevando desde hace 6 años atrás. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que sus clientes son fieles, gracias a su buena labor, y sobre todo le encanta darles el mejor de los tratos para que se sientan en familia. Le es muy rentable ya que le produce ingresos que fortalecen su nivel económico y el de su familia. Le  va muy bien.  Ella es una mujer responsable en sus pagos, este es ya su préstamo nº 7. Luzmila desea mandar a construir un taller textil más amplio, donde podrá exhibir  su trabajo elaborado para el público en general.
texts.en:
Luzmila is 43 years old, is a widow, and lives with her two children, who are students. She makes different types of clothes for adults and children. For the most part, she works for two educational institutions that are located near her house. These institutions constantly require her services. She has been pursuing this activity for 6 years. What she likes about her work is that her clients are faithful, thanks to her good work, and, above all, she loves to give them the best deals so that they feel like they are among family. This is very profitable since it yields income that strengthens her economic standing and that of her family; it is going very well. She is a responsible woman with respect to her payments. This is her seventh loan. Luzmila wants to build a bigger textile workshop, where she will be able to display her elaborate work for the public.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a textile workshop

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline E. is 40 years old and married with 7 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions and drinks and her husband is a commercial driver. She is requesting this loan to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Meth

texts.en: Mr. Meth L. lives in Kaung Kang Tie Muoy village in Kampong Cham province. He sells ice-cream. In this business, he faces an obstacle because he does not have a motorbike to transport the ice cream to sell door-to-door. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to add to his savings to buy a motorbike for his business. He hopes to increase his income and improve the living conditions of his family with this loan. His wife, Mrs. Mouk Meth, is a housewife. Mr. Meth L. is 55 years old and the father of ten children, two of whom are farmers while another is employed in a garment factory. One of his children is a laborer while the others are attending the local school. Mr. Meth L. is not in the picture because he was busy with his work so his wife is shown instead in the picture.

loans.use: to add to his savings to buy a motorbike to transport ice cream to sell door-to-door

loans.name: Janet Lola

texts.en:
Janet Lola L. sells cosmetics and provisions such as toothpaste, noodles, toothbrush, and so on. She hopes for the loan amount of 80,000 naira (USD$550) to purchase more cosmetics and provisions.

Janet is 50 years old and married with two children. She lives in Ibadan, Nigeria. She says thanks to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and cosmetics.

loans.name: Ahmatjon

texts.ru: Бокиев Ахматджон житель города Турсун-Заде. Возраст 44 года , женат и имеет троих детей. Образование среднее. Работает водителем такси. Автомобиль на котором он работает в данный момент арендованная. Сейчас он планирует покупку собственного автомобиля для дальнейшей работы таксистом. Но у него не  хватает денег . Поэтому он решил получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев. Если у него будет своя машина , ему не придеться платить аренду и он будет зарабатывать больше.
texts.en:
Ahmatjon B. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 44 years old, married, and has three children. He completed secondary education, and works as a taxi driver. He is currently using a rented vehicle for his work. He is planning to buy his own vehicle to drive as a taxi, but he doesn't have enough money, so he decided to take out a 12 month loan. By using his own vehicle he will be able to avoid paying rent, and thus earn more money.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle purchase

loans.name: Uwimana Aisha Group

texts.en:
