Aisha U. is thirty-seven years old. She is married and has five children. She rents a two-room house where she stays with her family. She also looks after her brother’s three children. They normally have two meals a day and her greatest expenses are house rent, school fees, and transportation to her work place.

She deals in art and crafts. She sells them in a shop that she rents. She works six days a week and she serves about ten customers a day. She has been in this business for nine years. Prior to this, she sold second-hand clothes.

Her main business challenge is that the city council keeps relocating their business premises, making her lose some of her customers. This has made her get a permanent shop to sell her products.

She has worked with MCDT for four years because they were lending to low-income earners. She will use this loan to increase her stock. She looks forward to expanding her business and being able to construct a house for her family.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.es: Doña María T. cuenta con 26 años de edad, es casada de oficios Comerciante, “Compra y venta de ropas típicas para mujeres”, habita junto  con su esposo y su hijo, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio, lleva 4 años  en el comercio en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Chuimenchú del Cantón Poxlajuj, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar más mercadería y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su hijo, y tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
María T. is 26 years old, married, and works as a merchant. “I purchase and sell traditional clothing for women,” she explains. She lives with her husband (who is also a merchant) and their son. For 4 years now María has run her business out of her home in Paraje Chuimenchú, in the Poxlajuj district of Totonicapán Department, Guatemala. These days her clientele's demand is increasing, but she is finding that she cannot increase her capital due to the current economic conditions. It is for this reason that María has requested a loan from the ASDIR Association (a local Kiva partner). She plans to use the loan to purchase more merchandise and thus to increase her sales. María hopes to be able to support her son and improve her family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Dorah

texts.en:
Dorah T. is a trader who sells tea, bread and eggs in Yamoransa near Cape Coast. She is married with two children and has received an education through junior-high school. While Dorah works as a trader, her husband is employed as a driver in the Cape Coast area.

Dorah is an experienced businesswoman and has been involved in her trade since 1989. She is responsible for paying various family expenses such as school fees, utilities and food. Her loan will be used to purchase additional goods for resale and she hopes to use her increased profits to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods for resale

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: Mariama M. is thirty years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, two sons and one daughter. She says two of her children are in primary school while the last is yet to start. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Mariama works to support her husband financially to provide for the family. Mariama’s husband is a farmer, while she is a trader. She trades in all kinds of cereals, such as maize, beans, groundnuts, etc. She procures the goods from nearby communities. She sells at the local market to food vendors and retailers. She has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She hopes to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Soleil Plus Group

texts.fr: Brigitte M. est entrain de développer un restaurant en vendant des shikwangues (l’un d’aliments principaux à Kinshasa) accompagnées des condiments. Le nombre de ses clients ne cesse de croître de jour en jour à cause de sa bonne cuisine. C’est pourquoi elle a planifié avec le crédit du mois de mai courant, de renforcer le stock de son restaurant en vue de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle et d’accroitre le revenu. Elle a aussi dans le même souci, planifié de diversifier son activité en y ajoutant des épices qui se vendent bien dans son quartier qui se situe au nord-est de Kinshasa. Brigitte a débuté à vendre pour la première fois en 1983. Le capital initial qui lui avait permis d’acheter 2 kilos de viande pour griller et vendre des brochettes jusqu’en 1987 était de $4. De 1987 – 2002, Brigitte  a obtenu le diplôme d’Etat de l’école secondaire en 1987, a changé le milieu et a décidé de convertir son activité en fabriquant des beignets. La hausse exorbitante du prix d’huile végétale qui constitue l’une des matières premières de fabrication des beignets, a mis fin à cette activité. De 2002 à ce jour, Brigitte a ouvert un service de restauration qui génère actuellement $10 par semaine. Son ambition est d’ouvrir une alimentation pour satisfaire le besoin de la population de son quartier. Elle a 42 ans, divorcée et mère de 5 enfants dont leurs âges varient entre 4 et 17 ans. Quatre d’entre eux vont à l’école.
texts.en:
Brigitte M. is growing a little restaurant by selling "shikwangues" (one of the main foods in Kinshasa) accompanied by condiments. Her clientele is growing quickly beause she is a good cook. That is why she plans, with this month-of-May loan, to build up the stock of her restaurant so as to better satisfy her clientele and earn more money. With the same goals in mind, she would like to diversify her business by adding the sale of spices, which sells well in her neighborhood in the north-east of Kinshasa.

Brigitte began her career in sales for the first time in 1983. The initial capital that allowed her to buy 2 kilograms of meat to grill and sell as brochettes up until 1987 was US$ 4.

From 1987-2002, Brigitte attended secondary school and received her diploma. In 1987 she moved and decided to change over to selling fritters. The exorbitant hike in the price of vegetable oil, one of the main raw materials for making fritters, ended this business. From 2002 until today, Brigitte has been running a cooked food business which presently generates US$ 10 per week. Her ambition is to open a grocery store to satisfy the needs of the people of her neighborhood. She is 42, divorced, and the mother of 5 children, aged between 4 and 17. Four of them are enrolled in school.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolster the raw materials for her restaurant so as to earn more

loans.name: Milo Luis

texts.pt:
Name (Nome do Cliente): Milo luis B.
Internal Client ID 18573
 Location (Localização / Sucursal): Namaacha
Primary Activity (Atividade Primaria): comercio 
 Loan Requested (Valor do Empréstimo em Meticais:10.000mt
Repayment Term (Numero de Prestações Mensais): 14
Loan Use (Uso do empréstimo, em 1 frase) compra e venda de produtos
Disbursement Hluvuku (Data de Desembolso do Empréstimo): 01/06/09
Dêscription (Historial

Milo nasceu em Namaacha, uma vila na fronteira com a Swazilândia tem 24 anos de idade, é solteiro e trabalhador e ainda sem filho. Estudou ate a 10ª classe e teve que interoper para se formar num curso básico da Policia da Republica de Moçambique (P.R. M).

Apos a morte do seu pai, este que era proprietário de uma barraca no mercado central da Namaacha, dá inicio do seu próprio negócio com o fundo da indiminização que teve no serviço do seu pai no valor de 20.000.00MT. Anos depois ele teve que se formar se num curso básico da (P.R. M) que durou um ano. Logo que terminou o curso é afecto no Ministério do Interior como guarda central e já trabalhada amais de quatro anos com salário mensal de 3.000.00MT. Mas porque ele e único na família empregado, não conseguem satisfazer as suas necessidades e solicita um empréstimo no banco proCredito (Banco de Microfinancas) em Maputo para retomar de volta o seu negocio no valor de 20.000.00MT que foram pagos por 2.816.00MT mensal no período de um ano. Devido à aderência dos seus produtos ele já não conseguia satisfazer a necessidade dos seus clientes na totalidade. Numa conversa com seu amigo soube da existência da hluvuku e aproxima se solicitando um empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00MT para aumentar seus produtos. venda diversos produtos, obtém de lucro no valor de 6.000.00MT mensalmente e conta com ajuda de um empregado que recebe 1.500.00MT por mês e ainda consegue poupar 2.000.00M. 
Este é o primeiro empréstimo de Milo na Hluvuku e primeiro com kiva. Será usado para aumentar o volume dos seus produtos e tem como objectivo satisfazer a necessidade dos seus clientes. Está convencido que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para dar inicia da sua obra.
texts.en:
Milo was born in Namaacha, a village near the frontier with Swazilandia, he is 24 years old, single, hard working and has no kids. He studied until the 10th grade in high school and had to interrupt his basic course to be a Police officer for the Republic of Mozambique (P.R.M.). After his father died, who was the owner of a spot at the central market in Namaacha, Milo started his own business with the money from the indemnity he got from his father's death of 20.000mt. Years later he had to take the basic curse for (P.R.M.) which lasted for a year. After he finished his course he worked at the Interior Ministry as security guard with a monthly salary of 3.000mt. But because he was the only one working in the family they were not able to fulfill their needs and requested a loan to the bank proCredito (Micro-Finance Bank) in Maputo for 20.000mt that he paid at 2.816mt monthly during a year. Because of the high demand for his products he wasn't able to satisfy his client's needs in full. After talking with a friend he learned about Hluvuku and approached to request a loan for 10.000mt to increase his products, and he obtain a monthly income of 6.000mt and has the help of an employee who is paid 1.5000mt a month and is able to profit 2.000mt. This is his first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva. The loan will be used to increase the volume of his products in order to fulfill his client's needs. He is convinced he will pay before the due date and request a new loan to start building a house.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the stock in his business

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es: Ronald tiene 28 años, vive con sus padres en la casa de sus abuelos. Desde hace un año y medio se dedica a brindar el servicio de llamadas telefónicas de forma ambulatoria en las puertas de la universidad de su ciudad. Cada día trabaja desde temprano por la mañana y durante la tarde, ya que por la noche estudia en la universidad. De esta manera se sostiene económicamente y puede paga sus gastos educativos. Además, también se dedica al alquiler de equipos de sonidos para eventos sociales, hasta el momento este negocio le está resultando rentable, por lo que está planeando para el futuro establecerse en un local donde también tenga un centro de llamadas. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, Ronald decidió renovar su compromiso de trabajo con su banco comunal porque ha logrado entablar una bella amistad con cada uno de sus integrantes. El dinero que está solicitando será destinado a la compra de más teléfonos celulares que son sus herramientas básicas para su trabajo.
texts.en:
Ronald is 28 years old, and lives with his parents in his grandparent's house. For a year and a half he has worked providing a mobile phonecall service, at the gates of the university in his city. Each day he works early in the morning and during the afternoon, because at night he studies at university. In this way he sustains himself economically and can pay his education expenses. As well as this, he also rents sound equipment for social events, which has resulted in a profitable business. Because of which, in the future he is planning to establish it in an area where he can also have a telephone call centre. This is the third time he has had a loan with MFP. Ronald decided to renew his work commitment with his communal bank because he has been able to strike up a lovely friendship with each one of the members. The money he is seeking will be destined for the purchase of more cell phones which are the basic tools of his work.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy mobile phones

loans.name: Kroye Ne Odo Group

texts.en:
Esther is thirty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to two children. She is a trader in textile materials, which she hawks and treks to sell. Esther is the leader of a trust bank group called "Kroye ne odo," which literally means "unity and love." She is the woman wearing glasses in the group photograph.

Most of the members of this group are traders, food vendors, or farmers. They work to support their spouses and to provide for their families. They buy their raw materials, wares, or goods from other towns and nearby communities and sell at the local market square. Some of them also go to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience. They are therefore asking for a loan to help them procure more goods to expand their businesses. It is the heartfelt desire of the group members to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta O. is a hardworking vendor who lives simply in the village of Santos Quezon, Isabela. She is married to Renato O. who is a farmer. Their major livelihood in the village is agriculture in which rice, vegetables and banana are the main products they usually produce every year. To help her husband earn a daily income, Violeta ventured into vending their own products. She retails in the market and sometimes in their neighborhood. Some products that are not sold in the market are sold to some of her co-villagers at a cheaper price. She enjoys doing the business and tries her best to improve it into progress.  
With the opportunity brought by Kiva lenders, Violeta was encouraged to apply for a PHP12,000 loan that will be used as additional capital for her vending business. This way, she would then able to support those small vegetable farmers in their village by catering their fruit and vegetable products to sell in the market and to sell to some buyers also. She hopes that Kiva lenders will put an eye to her business concerns and ambitions not only for herself but also for her fellow men.

loans.use: As additional capital

loans.name: Furkatjon

texts.en:
Furkatjon is the responsible father of two children. From the time he was a boy, he learned the honorable work of raising livestock, an activity which was passed down from his parents and which today brings him satisfaction.

He also runs a business of selling cattle fodder. Thanks to his valuable knowledge of the livestock trade, he has been able to obtain good profits from his sales.

This enterprising gentleman’s wish is to invest more capital in young animals. Furkatjon hopes to continue his dedication to his work, believing that by improving his stock and feed, his cattle will bring better prices. For this reason, he is turning to you for the support that would permit him to continue developing his business.

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and being the location of the end of the rule of Alexander the Great. It is also known for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country, filled with epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and boasts a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only seven percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase calves in order to expand the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more of the seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.fr: T. Jacqueline est née vers 1964 à Tori Bossito. Jacqueline est mariée à KINLIN Vincent, un menuisier. Ce couple a à sa charge sept enfants tous scolarisés dont quatre sont les leurs. La famille réside depuis quarante ans à Fridjrossè Kpota, un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Jacqueline vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Jacqueline vend des chaussures et des sacs de sortie à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Jacqueline achète ses produits à Lomé, pays voisin du Bénin. Jacqueline a déjà dix ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Jacqueline a eu deux crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour continuer à développer son activité, Jacqueline demande un troisième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.

loans.use: Achat de sacs de sortie et de chaussures.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is thirty-five years old. She is divorced and has given birth to one child, who is in school. She lives with her husband and child in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa, in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. Juliana trades in utensils – rubber and plastic products. She buys her goods from Kumasi. Juliana sells at the local community market and also treks to nearby communities to sell. She has been in business for five years, and would like to use this loan to procure goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy utensils

loans.name: Barikisu

texts.en:
Barikisu is twenty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Barikisu is a petty trader. She sells all kinds of cereals such as maize, beans, groundnuts, etc. She procures the goods from nearby communities. She sells at the local market to food vendors and retailers.

Barikisu has been in business for over twelve years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She is hopeful to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Mr. M. Emmanuel S. is a carpenter and owns a workshop in Ibanda town along Jubilee Street. He is 54 years old. He is requesting a loan to purchase more timber for his carpentry workshop. He really aspires to obtain a large-scale carpentry workshop to sell a wide range of furniture in the same location and attract an awesome number of customers. He has been running this business for over 25 years. He is married and blessed with four children who are grown-ups now. He is a hardworking businessman who is trying to set up a retail shop for the wife too.

loans.use: To purchase more timber for his carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Jason Onyari

texts.en:
Jason Onyari is 22 years old. Jason is single, and he describes himself as creative and hardworking.

To earn a living, he owns and operates the Chap Chap barber shop. Currently, with the help of one employee, he provides hair cutting services for men only, but he wants to expand his business to offer these services to ladies as well. He has been operating this business for two years. He explains that his clients are local residents and walk-ins, and that his shop is located behind the local authority offices in town. He notes that one of the primary challenges he faces with the business is the fact that there are power outages at the barber shop. In addition to his work at the barber shop, he is a pump attendant at a petrol station.

In the future, he wants to own and operate a wholesale cosmetics shop. As such, he is seeking a loan in the amount of 20,000 KES ($275) to purchase not just hair products (braids, hair treatments, etc.), but also cotton, jewelry, and cosmetics for ladies.

loans.use: To improve his barber shop and to expand into cosmetic sales by purchasing braids, hair treatments, cotton, jewelry, and cosmetics

loans.name: Mercedes Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora MECEDES CECILIA H. V. tiene  37 años, 2 hijos quienes dependen economicamente de ella, cuenta con estudios secundarios completos y vive en el distrito Huanchaco, de la provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad – Perú. 
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal  FUENTE DE VIDA y se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos.
El primer crèdito que recibiò fue de 300.00 nuevos soles los que invertiò en la crianza de pollos bebès.
Con su nuevo crédito de 2,000 nuevos soles comprará 150 pollos bebès para su crianza y posterior comercialización.
Mercedes sueña con tener su granja de pollos.
texts.en:
Mercedes Cecilia H. V. is 37 years old and has two children that are economically dependent upon her. She completed secondary studies and lives in the Huanchaco district, in the Trujillo province, in the department of La Libertad in Perú.

Mercedes is a member of the “Fuente de Vida” communal bank, and her business is raising and selling chickens. The first loan that she received was for 300 PEN, which she invested in the raising of baby chicks. With her new loan of 2,000 PEN, she will purchase 150 baby chicks to raise and later sell.

Mercedes dreams of having her poultry farm.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 150 baby chicks

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia D. is from the village of Villalin, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old. Lucia is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lucia owns & operates a business selling ice cream and ice drop to the local community. Lucia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lucia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Lucia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her products. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Lucia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying sacks of rice, containers of oil, boxes of spaghetti

loans.name: Mira

texts.en:
Mira P. is a resident of Khokhana-Dobato. Khokhana-Dobato is located in Lalitpur and most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Mrs. Mira P. lives in a single family with her husband and two sons. Her older son is studying in grade 8 and her younger son is studying in grade 3.

Both Mrs. and Mr. P. are engaged in the traditional work of tailoring, which they learned from their forefathers. They make different types of clothes, including ladies clothing and dresses. They make pants and shirts for gentlemen and kurta sulwar, blouses and makhshi for ladies.

Now Mrs. P. is requesting a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy raw materials for her tailoring work.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her shop

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan L., age 22, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo province, Cambodia. She has no children.

L. is engaged in a business selling various kinds of groceries at home, earning approximately $7 in revenue per day. Her husband helps her in the business and is able to earn the same amount of income as his wife. They have been with the business since 1999.

Their standard of living has improved since they have this business, so they want to have a loan to expand their business. L. is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to purchase more groceries to stock the store. This is her first loan from CREDIT, Kiva's partner.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock her store

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge Alberto R. G. es un señor de 52 años de edad quien vive con su mamá en una pequeña comunidad llamada La Trinchera de Pital localizada en la provincia de Alajuela; cuyas principales actividades productivas son la ganadería y la agricultura, donde destaca el cultivo de la piña; siendo estas comercializadas principalmente en los mercados internacionales.  Por esta razón, el desarrollo de la comunidad ha venido creciendo en los últimos años generando una mayor demanda de productos y servicios brindando mayores oportunidades de trabajo.

Desde muy joven don Jorge se ha dedicado a la cría de cerdo para engorde. El vende sus productos a los vecinos de la comunidad, quienes se muestran muy satisfechos por la calidad de estos. Comenta que desde que inició el proyecto se ha sentido muy bien ya que ha podido sacar a sus hijos y su familia adelante.

Actualmente don Jorge esta solicitando un préstamo de ¢500,000 (quinientos mil colones)  para la compra de más cerdos para engorde, así como compra de alimento entre otros insumos necesarios para que su negocio salga adelante Con esta inversión espera que su microempresa crezca más, para poder atender a más clientes y ofrecerles mejores productos. 

Jorge Alberto R. G. es socio de la Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico, además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Jorge Alberto R. G. is 52 years old and lives with his mother in the small community of La Trinchera de Pital, which is located in Alajuela Province. The main business activities in the area are livestock breeding and agriculture, with an emphasis on the cultivation of pineapple to be sold primarily to international markets. Community development has been growing in recent years, thereby generating more demand for goods and services, as well as creating job opportunities.

From a young age, Don Jorge has been raising pigs for fattening. He sells the animals to residents of the community, who are very satisfied with their quality. Since his business started, Don Jorge says it has done very well and has enabled his family to get ahead. He is now requesting a loan of 500,000 CRC to acquire more pigs for fattening. Part of the money will be used to purchase feed and other supplies needed for his business to succeed. With this investment, he hopes his micro-enterprise will continue to grow so that he can serve more customers and offer them better products.

Jorge Alberto R. G. is a member of the Communal Enterprise of Successful Women for La Trinchera de Pital, one of 100 partner organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and he hopes to continue growing personally and financially. In addition, he plans to actively participate in his local micro-credit organization.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pigs, animal feed, and supplies

loans.name: Raimundo

texts.es:
El señor Raimundo vive en  anticretico con su esposa e hijo en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que el realiza es la de garzón en diferentes acontecimientos sociales como ser bautizos, matrimonios, etc.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar vajilla ya que le piden que prepare algunos bocaditos especiales extras los cuales los elabora en su domicilio.

Es cliente de impro y paga muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Raimundo lives in an anticretico (under this system, one pays a sum to the landlord when moving into a house or apartment, lives there for whatever period of time, and at the end moves out and gets the entire sum back. The interest on the money is the rent). He lives with his wife and son in the Tembladerani zone of La Paz. He works as a waiter and caterer at different social events like baptisms, weddings etc. The loan he requests is to buy kitchen equipment since he has been asked to bring extra snacks which he prepares in his home. He has previously been a client of Impro and has a good payment history which is why he can request a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy kitchenware for his catering business

loans.name: Redempta

texts.en:
Redempta is 36 years old and is married with four children who are 3, 5, 10 and 13 years old. She is well-known as a wholesaler of sweets (candies). She has been in this business for about two years and she operates her business from early in the morning until late in the evening hours. She struggles much in her daily business so that she can get food for her children.

Redempta needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company so that she can expand her business by adding the wholesale of cookies, biscuits and some other pastries. In addition, with this loan, she will start wholesaling soft drinks like soda, juice etc.

If successful, Redempta will continue taking care of her children as well as building a secure future for them. In addition she will start saving for further reinvestment in her business.

loans.use: To add the wholesale of cookies, biscuits and some other pastries

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana is 34 years old, and married with four children: three sons and one daughter. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for over 8 years.

She is a very hard working lady, and is involved in the decorative embroidery business. She gets orders from her neighbors and earns good profits. Her customers respect and trust her talent. They give her orders because they know that she will return the clothes on the set date. Her income allows her to share the financial burden of their family.
 
Her husband's name is A. A. and he operates a wood sales business in the community. He has twenty-five years of experience in this business.  
They both are uneducated but they want to raise their children with good educations, and as a result, their children are enrolled in a school and are getting a good education.
 
Farzana successfully repaid her first loan to Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy wood in bulk to expand her husband’s wood sales business.

loans.use: To purchase wood to sell.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Don Efraín es un hombre muy dedicado a su trabajo, tiene la edad de 41 años, junto con su esposa han logrado hacer su casa, ella trabaja como secretaria y el desde hace varios años trabaja como policía,  pues han sido varios años de experiencia sirviendo a la comunidad, aun que su salario es bajo, se siente sastifecho por la labor que hace. 
Con el crédito anterior logro hacer en frente un bajarete, con este financiamiento quiere mejorar la parte del baño, y tendedero ya que el zinc esta muy viejo, y se ve he higiénico, comprara materiales para hacer la mejora a su casa y poder estar en mejores condiciones que le permita a su familia estar segura del agua y el sol.
texts.en:
Efraín is man who is very dedicated to his work. He is 41 years old. With his wife, he has been able to build his house. She works as a secretary and for several years he has worked as a police officer. He has several years experience serving his community and although the pay is low, his work is very satisfying. With the previous loan, he was able to build a outbuilding in front. With this loan, he wants to improve the bathroom and the laundry area, since the zinc and is very old. He will buy materials to improve the house and be able to have the living conditions that will keep his family safe from the sun and the rain.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He will buy zinc and wood to make a stall in the bathroom

loans.name: Gabriel Antonio

texts.es: Gabriel Antonio M. A. de 47 años de edad, reside en el pueblo de San Juan Opico ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Él posee un negocio en el cual se dedica a la reparación de calzado, puesto el cual esta ubicado en el mercado de Santa Tecla, en el departamento de calzado. El es un hombre muy responsable el cual cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de todos sus vecinos, ya que lo reconocen como una persona muy trabajadora quien cuenta con el deseo de salir adelante. Gabriel vive únicamente junto a su madre de 79 años de edad, una de las mayores razones por las que Gabriel lucha día con día para brindarle todos los cuidados necesarios que ella necesita. Él solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder contar con la capacidad económica para comprar todo tipo de repuestos para zapatos como: suelas, tapitas, tachuelas, pega, hilos y otros más esto lo hace con el deseo de poder aprovechar la temporada de lluvia en la cual Gabriel ve aumentada su clientela.
texts.en:
Gabriel Antonio M. A. is 47 years old and resides in the town of San Juan Opico, which is located in the Department of La Libertad. He operates a shoe repair business from a stand in the market in Santa Tecla, which is also in the Department of La Libertad. Gabriel is a responsible gentleman who has excellent references from all of his neighbors. In addition, they recognize him as a hardworking person who has the desire to succeed. Gabriel lives with his 79 year old mother, who is one of the reasons why he struggles every day since he tries to provide her with the necessary care that she needs.

He is requesting a loan so that he will be financially able to purchase all types of shoe parts and supplies such as soles, tops, tacks, glue, thread, and other items. What he wants most is to take advantage of the rainy season, since he receives more customers during this time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for repairing shoes

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome K. M. is thirty-one years old. She is married and they have three children. Her husband is a driver and they see themselves opening a big hotel (restaurant) in Mariakani, Mombasa, where her current business is located. Mariakani is a very busy market with many customers.

Salome has been supplying tomatoes at the market for the last six years. She says that the business is good and that the only major challenge is the seasonal changes which make tomatoes very expensive. She is taking a loan of Kes 40,000 to add to her stock of tomatoes to grow her business.

Salome describes herself as God-fearing and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Nancy Chrislene

texts.fr:
Femme commercante de 29 ans,celibataire ayant a sa charge un enfant,exerce le commerce de la vente des meches depuis bientot 4 ans ,et elle  vend en moyenne 12000 a 15000 frs par jour
Avec  ce pret elle compte acheter des differentes qualites de meches, tout models de tissage a la mode ces derniers temps, et les produits de beaute comme les  cremes demelantes,cremes pour entretenir le cuir chevelu

   Comme son etalage est dans le plus grand marche de Brazzaville , elle use de beaucoup de strategies pour attirer sa clientele, et presenter les meilleurs prix a ses potentiels clients qui sont dans les environs
  A l'avenir elle pense s'inscrire dans un institut de beaute pour se perfectionner et a la fin de sa formation ouvrir un salon de coiffure pour dames; Tres joviale; elle attire tout le monde par sa gentillesse
texts.en:
A 29-year old businesswoman, single with one child in her care, in the business of selling hair extensions for almost 4 years. She sells an average of 12,000 to 15,000 francs per day. With this loan she intends to buy different quality hair extensions, all types of weaves in current styles, and beauty products such as conditioners and scalp creams. Since her display is in the biggest market in Brazzaville, she uses many strategies to attract customers and offer the best prices to potential clients in the area. In the future she plans to enroll in a beauty school to perfect her technique, and after her training she would like to open a women’s hair salon. Very cheerful, she draws in everyone with her kindness.

Translated from French by Rachel Braff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hair extensions, weaves and beauty products

loans.name: Fanta

texts.fr: Fanta S. est une femme de 24 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants et tutrice d'un enfant confié par un parent. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KABENDOU depuis le 27 juillet 2007 et a 14 fois de suite reçu de crédit. Elle fait de la transformation et vente de pâte d'arachide. Elle achète des arachides à l'état brute, c'est-à-dire en gousse, elle les décortique, les grille avant de les transformer en pâte et vendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de 5 ans et en a acquière une bonne expérience. Avec son prêt elle va acheter de l'arachide pour continuer à faire cette activité qui lui procure des bénéfices lui permettant de contribuer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fanta S. is a 24-year old woman; she is married and the mother of four children, with one other child entrusted to her care by a relative. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Kabendou since July 27, 2007 and obtained loans 14 times in the past. She prepares and sells peanut sauce. She purchases peanuts raw, that is to say still in their shells; she shells and roasts peanuts in order to prepare peanut paste and then sell it at the weekly market. She has been in this line of business for over five years and has accumulated a lot of experience. With this loan she would like to purchase a supply of peanuts in order to continue with this business which brings her an income allowing her to help improve the life conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthening and promoting her business activity

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is married with eight children, all of whom are at school. She does not take care of additional family members. She owns and lives in a three-roomed house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses are school fees, food and paying utility bills.
Alice owns a stall selling second-hand clothes at her home in Kalerwe. She has been in this business for many years. She sells, both retail and wholesale, to all categories of people from the local area. She buys her stock from Owino market and uses public transport to and from the market, which she visits once a week.
Alice works six days a week and depends on her job for a living. Her business challenges include seasonality and transporting the bales from Owino market in Kampala to her home in Kalerwe. Alice decided to join Kiva partner, MCDT, because it was charging low interest. She plans to use her loan to buy more bales of second-hand clothes.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Oman Ni-Eye

texts.fr: B. exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes. elle a une ancienneté de 2 ans dans ce commerce. elle fait son activité de façon ambulante. sa clientèle ne cesse de grandir. elle veut accroître son stock pour servir un plus grand nombre de clients c'est pour cela qu'elle demande à waqes un crédit pour l'achat d'une dizaine de pagnes de qualité  HI-TARGET et une dizaine de pagnes de qualité GTP.
texts.en:
Mrs. B. has been selling pagnes (a colorful West African cloth) for two years. She sells these pagnes as an itinerant vendor and her client base continues to grow. She wants to increase her stock in order to serve a greater number of customers. She is requesting a loan through WAGES so she can purchase ten Hi-Target pagnes and ten GTP pagnes.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pagnes

loans.name: Abadahemuka Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is 36 years old and married with three children who are 1, 6 and 10 years old.  Beatrice is the leader of a group called Abadahemuka and this group has been in this business of selling charcoals for about two years.  The hours of the business are from 7 am until late in the evening.

Beatrice and her team are requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a. With this loan, they will hopefully increase the sales of charcoal as well as profits.  If successful, Beatrice and her team will keep expanding their business by creating various sources of income.  This, in turn, will make their business financially stable and enable them to continue taking care of their families.

loans.use: To buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Geogina

texts.en: Geogina M. sells kenkey (fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves) and banku (a local dish made from corn dough) in Elmina. She is married and has two children. Geogina has not had any formal education. She is able to support her husband in taking care of the children. Her loan will be used to buy additional bags of corn to make kenkey and banku for sale. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy additional bags of corn to make kenkey and banku for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Vehicle repairs & conversion of his vehicle to run on natural gas

loans.name: Genie

texts.en:
Genie T., aged 57, is a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Roel T. and mother to four hard-working young adults. By the grace of God, Genie has managed to support her children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Genie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go for to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5-worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale price and selling at the piece rate. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Genie dreams of being able to renovate her house soon, with all of her work with the business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Emelia's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Emelia A. is from Cogon, Ozamis City. She is 51 years old, a widow and has three adult-aged children. Emelia is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Emelia A.’s Group. 

Emelia owns and operates a business making and selling food, snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In March 2010, Emelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from PMPC. Emelia is now requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third taken from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

About Group Loans 
In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: To purchased additional products to sell

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Angel tiene 56 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y a su hijo en el distrito de Pueblo Nuevo, una zona aledaña a la ciudad de Ferreñafe y que se caracteriza por tener a la mayor parte de su población concentrada en zonas urbano marginales, la zona se encuentra situada a veinticinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace dos años a brindar servicio de imprenta en un pequeño taller ubicado en su vivienda. Allí el ofrece al publico en general servicio de elaboración de afiches, paneles publicitarios, tarjetas de presentación, invitaciones para actividades sociales entre otras. Con el dinero que obtiene de estas actividades el sustenta los gastos de la economía de su familia, el negocio goza de muy buena acogida debido al tiempo que tiene trabajando y a la buena calidad con la que suele realizar sus labores.

Angel desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo mas material con el cual planea diseñar mas afiches y así cumplir con los pedidos que le realizan sus clientes. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1600 nuevos soles con los cuales planea lograr su objetivo.

Angel es una persona bastante creativa y responsable, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para mejorar gradualmente la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Angel is 56, married and lives with his wife and their son in the Pueblo Nuevo district, an area bordering the city of Ferreñafe.  It has most of its population concentrated in marginal urban areas and is located 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past two years he has worked in a small printing shop in his home.  There he offers a service of making posters, brochures, business cards, invitations to social events, etc.  With the money that he makes from this work he supports his family.  The business has a good reputation because of the time he has worked and the good quality that is usually produced.

Angel wishes to enlarge his business, buying more materials so that he can design more posters and fill all the orders from his customers.  That is why he decided to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1600 new sols to be able to complete his goal.

Angel is a very creative and responsible person.  His principle aim to continue growing as a businessman and to gradually improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: To buy supplies to enlarge his business of designing posters and printing

loans.name: Bendición De Dios Group

texts.es:
El grupo Bendición de Dios  está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Ana Rosa V. de 34 años quien hace tres años inicio vendiendo gaseosas, golosinas y frutas en pequeñas cantidades. Ella por medio de los préstamos ha ido mejorando su negocio el cual desea convertir en una. Miscelánea
Vivas ha participado del proceso de capacitación la cual le ayudo a mejorar su negocio por medio de sus consejos útiles. 
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Maura del Socorro O. Rivera desde hace 5 años vende refresco, gaseosa y pollo y Luz Esther C. desde hace 10 años vende calzado y tiene una pulpería.
texts.en:
The group Bendición de Dios (God's Blessing)  is made up of three hard-working women.  One of them is Ana Rosa Vivas who is 34 years old.  Three years ago she started selling small quantities of soda, candy and fruits and through credit has improved her business.  Miscelánea Vivas has participated in the training process and the useful advice has helped her to improve her business.   

The other members of the group are Maura del Socorro O. Rivera, who has been selling soft drinks and chicken for 5 years; and Luz Esther C., who, for the past 10  years, has been selling footwear and  owns a grocery store.

loans.use: To invest in merchandise to stock their businesses

loans.name: Homero Gabriel

texts.es:
Homero Gabriel G. Q.  tiene 30 años. Es Soltero vive con sus padres,  en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 1  hijo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. YAGUI GRANDE se encuentra ubicada A 30 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel, perteneciente al cantón San Miguel, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y papas, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Homero se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y papas. Compra sus productos en Ambato y San Miguel y los vende en la feria de San Miguel los días jueves.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y papas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un carro y construir una casa.

Le gusta hacer deporte y festejar las fiestas del Patron San Miguel.
texts.en:
Homero Gabriel G. Q.  is 30 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in San Miguel Canton, Bolívar Province.  He has one son.

He is a member of Yagui Grande communal bank, which is located 30 minutes from the San Miguel office in San Miguel Canton.  This bank's members work in agriculture growing short season corn and potatoes.  The work takes a lot of time to do.

Homero grows corn and potatoes.  He buys products in Ambato and San Miguel, and he sells them at the market in San Miguel on Thursdays.

He is asking for the loan to buy farm supplies and fertilizers for growing corn and potatoes.  The loan will help him meet his financial needs.  He faces challenges like pests, crop diseases and weather changes.  Homero's dream is to buy a car and build a house.

He likes playing sports and celebrating the Feast of San Miguel.

loans.use: supplies

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.fr: adjoa est une femme de 46 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d'adidogomé-ablogamé qui est un quartier périphérique animé de la ville de Lomé. elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de Tissus. elle s'approvisionne au grand marché de lomé. elle a déjà obtenu du crédit pour s'approvisionner elle sollicite ce second crédit pour s'approvisionner et bien vendre en fin d'année. ainsi elle projette acheter 5 rouleaux de tissu pour chemises, 5 rouleaux de tissus pour pantalon.
texts.en:
Adjoa is a 46-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of four children. She lives with her family in the neighborhood of Adidogomé-Ablogamé, a busy suburb of the city of Lomé. 

She sells fabrics for a living. She gets her stocks at the big market of Lomé. She previously received a loan to increase her stocks. She is now seeking a second loan to purchase more merchandise and boost her year-end sales. She plans to buy five rolls of fabric for shirts, and five rolls of fabric for trousers.

loans.use: Buying fabrics

loans.name: Donohon's Group

texts.en:
Donohon K. is the leader of this group. She is the resident of Uzgen, a nice ancient village in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 42 and married, and her husband earns money by providing transportation services. Together they have four children.

Ten years ago, Donohon started to sell convenience goods with the initial investment of 8000 soms. She now earns 15000 soms per month. The profit has made it possible for her to improve the family’s living conditions. With the proceeds from this loan, she wants to purchase additional inventory to increase product turnover. In the future she wants to start building a house for her sons.


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase convenience goods

loans.name: Noshad Liaqat Ali's Group

texts.en:
Noshad is married to L. A. and lives in Pakpattan, Pakistan, a city famous for its agricultural industry. She has been living there with her family for over 25 years. Her husband is involved in an animal sales business. He buys animals from the animal market, raises them up and then sells them to customers. His customer base is butchers and he earns a good income by providing them with animals. He has been engaged in this business for ten years and is an expert in his field.
Noshad has a daughter and three sons. Two of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting an education while the others stay at home. Noshad supports her family financially by doing embroidery work. She learned this art at a young age and it is now paying off. She is also a very good housewife and performs her household responsibilities very well.
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy animals (goats) and raise them up to sell at a good profit. He will also use some of the money to buy animal feed. Noshad is confident that after the loan investment her husband’s business will grow further and make even more income than before. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed a meeting. Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Noshad.

loans.use: To buy animals and animal feed

loans.name: Lubna's Group

texts.en:
Lubna makes artificial flowers to share the financial burdens of her family. She lives in a combined family system and is married to M. A. who works in a private organization. Her two brother-in-laws also live with Lubna and her family. One of them is a tailor master and the other works in a factory for a low income.

Lubna is a mother of two daughters. Her elder daughter is studying in class 1 and younger one is only 2 years old. She lives in Lahore, which is Pakistan’s second largest city. Her home is made of bricks and is located in the area of Green town. She came here 8 years ago. She is a very supportive lady and tries to minimize her cost of living so that her children can continue their education.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother-in-law who wants to buy a new sewing machine. He will also hire a worker who will assist him in completing the orders on time. Lubna is hopeful that her brother-in-law will be able to increase his monthly profits and she will easily be able to return the loan with the help of increased profits.

She is a new loan applicant and hopeful that it will be a profitable experience for her family.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business.

loans.name: Eunice Achieng

texts.en:
Eunice has been in tailoring services for 25 years in Machakos town, and earns a profit margin of KES. 30,000. She is 49 years, married to Paul A., and they are blessed with two children who are already adults.


She was introduced to KADET LTD by a Credit Officer and she is applying for her first loan of KES. 50,000, which she intends to use to buy clothing materials and add one modern sewing machine.


In future she desires to grow her business and have financial stability.

loans.use: To buy clothing materials and add one sewing machine

loans.name: Ameyo Akpédzé

texts.fr: Dame Ameyo a 29 ans et est mariée.  Elle a à charge 2 enfants. Pour améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants, elle fait la vente des produits BB. Elle a commencé en 2007 et s’approvisionne à la Brasserie du  Bénin. Elle revend les produits à la devanture de sa maison. Elle a  reçu  du crédit  qu’elle a déjà  bien remboursé. Elle sollicite un prêt pour se réapprovisionner. La dame en question est celle qui a ouvert le frigitaire.
texts.en:
Ameyo is 29 years old. She is married with 2 dependent children. To improve her children's standard of living, she sells products from the "Brasserie du Bénin" (the Benin Brewery). She began this activity in 2007 and she obtains her supplies from the brewery. The products are then re-sold in front of her house. 

Ameyo has properly repaid previous loans. She is requesting this loan in order to re-stock. Ameyo can be seen in the photo opening the refrigerator.

loans.use: To buy products from the "Brasserie de Benin"

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en:
Sreng P., 34, is married and resides with her husband in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known as the most populated city in the country. P. sells vegetables and meat, earning an income of USD 10 per day to help cover the family's expenses. 

Each month, the family has to spend USD 150 on food and USD 45 on the other necessary expenses. P. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more vegetables and meat to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and meat to resell.

location.town: Mean Chey District, Phnom Penh City

loans.name: Hebert Ismael

texts.es: EL SEÑOR R.  LABORA COMO BODEGUERO ,ES SOLTERO , ES  EL PRIMER  CREDITO  QUE CEPRODEL LE OTORGA, AGRADECE  LA OPORTUNIDAD QUE LE HAN BRINDADO  ESTA INSTITUCION  CON LOS DESEMBOLSO QUE LE HAN APROBADO , ESTE CREDITO LO NECESITA PARA  PAGO DE SU TITULO DE SU CARRERA PROFESIONAL.
texts.en: EL SEÑOR R.  works as a shopkeeper.  He is single.  This is the first loan that Ceprodel is granting him.  He is thankful for the opportunity that the institution has offered him with the payout that they have approved.  He needs this loan to pay for his professional degree.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Nonvigbe Tankpè Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement NONVIGBE Tankpè est composé D. 20 membres qui sont solidaires et qui vivent tous dans le même quartier à Tankpè dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aiD. financier D. ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau D. leur activité. 
La représentante du groupe, du nom D. Ida est celle qui a le doigt levé sur la photo. Ida est née le 14 Avril 1973 à Abomey, ville historique du Bénin. Ida est mariée à Alexandre et a six enfants, tous scolarisés, dont trois sont à sa charge. Ida et son mari assurent ensemble les différentes charges D. la famille. Depuis près D. onze ans, Ida s'est installée à Tankpè avec son mari et ses enfants. Afin D. se prendre en charge et d'améliorer son niveau D. vie, Ida exerce depuis six ans environs, comme activité la vente d'épices et D. césame, qu'elle achète à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Dans la quête D. la satisfaction D. sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Ida sollicite, ensemble avec son groupe, un autre crédit.
texts.en:
The group NONVIGBE Tankpè is composed of twenty members in solidarity who all live in the same district in Tankpè, in the commune of Abomey Calavi. This is the second time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé, so as to elevate their level of business.

The group’s representative, by the name of Ida, is the one with her finger raised in the photo. Ida was born on April 14, 1973 in Abomey, a historic city in Benin. She is married to Alexandre and has six children, who are all in school. Together, Ida and her husband ensure that the various family expenses are covered.

Almost eleven years ago, Ida settled in Tankpè with her husband and children. In order to support herself and to improve her living conditions, she has had a business selling spices and sesame for about six years. She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Seeking to satisfy her customers and to grow her revenues, Ida, along with her group, is requesting another loan.

loans.use: to buy spices

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en: Mrs. Otgonbayar is 43 years old. She lives with her husband and two sons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. The two sons are both students in college. Mrs. Otgonbayar runs a metal stove manufacturing business together with her husband. They make wood- or coal-fired metal stoves suitable for gers and sell them at Narantuul, the biggest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar. Currently, they use their backyard as a workshop. The products are in high demand among people who live in gers. The stoves are used for heating and cooking purposes. Mrs. Otgonbayar wants to expand her business by producing more stoves to sell. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more metal sheets to produce stoves.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets and materials to produce more metal stoves

loans.name: Ihtiram

texts.en:
Ihtiram is 35 years old and married to Saad, a 49-year-old nurse. They have six children together. To be able to raise their children and support her husband, Ihtiram decided to use their land to build a barn to raise sheep. A year ago, Ihtiram built a sheep barn where she started with a few sheep. She sold the sheep products such as yogurt and wool and she was able to create a good and healthy environment for them to breed. 

Now, because of the large number of sheep she has, she applied for a loan to expand the barn space, to keep the healthy environment and to increase her productivity.  
 
Since Ihtiram is a conservative person, her husband agreed to appear in the picture.

loans.use: To expand the barn space for her sheep

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is 18 years old and lives in Uganda. She is single and has no children. Getrude has a business keeping cattle, which she has run for one year. She also has a second business making mats.
To help expand her business, Getrude has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more cattle for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Getrude hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to own a retail shop.
Getrude is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by encouraging her to be hardworking.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for resale.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 26 years old, married and blessed with a two-year-old child. He operates a cosmetic shop to earn a living. He has been operating the business for three years and has employed two people. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his money. This has helped him to manage his finances.

Isaac hopes to grow his business and become a well-known supplier of beauty products in his local community.  He needs 20, 000 Kenyan shillings to buy hair oil, nail polish and lotion.

loans.use: to buy hair oil, nail polish and lotion.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina es socia del  Banco Comunal “Virgen de Concepción”, ubicado en el C.P. Ayrumas Carumas del distrito de Acora, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos (1 independiente).  Tiene educación primaria. 
Viene trabajando  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un mes.  Su préstamo incial fue de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó en su negocio de compra y venta de animales  como ovinos, alpacas y llamas.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, comprará  tres alpacas para su respectivo engorde por un mes, luego lo vende al por menor (carne) en la localidad de Ilave.  En el negocio la ayuda su esposo, quien también trabaja de registrador en el Municipio de la zona.
Su sueño es tener más alpacas y así mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones y la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Guillermina is a member of the “Virgen de Concepción” cooperative bank, located in the Ayrumas Carumas district of Acora, in the province of Puno.  She is 48 years old, married, and has 3 children (1 is independent).  She has her primary school education.

She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one month.  Her first loan was for 500 Peruvian soles, funds she used in her business buying and selling animals such as sheep, alpacas and llamas.

With this new loan of 500 Peruvian soles, she will buy three alpacas to fatten for one month.  Later, she’ll sell them (meat) at retail in the locality of Ilave.  Her husband, who also works as a recorder at the town hall of the zone, helps her with the business.

Her dream is to have more alpacas and, that way, improve her income.  What she enjoys most about the cooperative bank are the meetings and the facilitated access to loan funds.

loans.use: buy three alpacas.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has practiced farming in Njabini for the last six years. He is 41 years old, married to Mary and they have two school-going children.  

Joseph was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time.  Joseph plans to use this loan to pay his children's school fees. In the future, Joseph hopes to become a leading farmer in the Njabini area.

loans.use: to pay his children's school fees

loans.name: Henry

texts.es: Henry, tiene la edad de 24 años, está soltero. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de abonos para la asistencia de su cafetal. El cuenta con el terreno apto para la explotación, el tiene el terreno ya sembrado de café y lo que le hará es asistirlo par así obtener mejores cosechas este próximo año. El quiere generar ganancias para su bienestar y seguir creciendo con el proyecto cafetalero y cada día más fortalecerlo para su buena producción.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Henry, 24, is single.  He intends to use the loan to buy manure for his coffee plants.  He has a piece of farmland that’s apt for exploitation and it’s already planted with coffee.  What he will do now is provide assistance so that it will produce better harvests next year.  He wants to generate income for his wellbeing and to continue growing as a coffee producer strengthening it daily so that it will produce better.


This is the first loan he’s gotten from Fudecosur.  He has had no previous loans from state banks but Fudecosur offered the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 35 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda.  She is widowed and has one child who is currently in school.  Joan has a business selling clothes, which she has had for five years.         

To help expand her business, Joan has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Joan hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child.  In the future, Joan hopes to expand her business. Joan is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Janeth Alexandra

texts.es:
Janeth de 33 años es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos, entre ellos una tiene discapacidad, los otros 2 si estudian en la escuela fiscal.
El no tener quien les cuide a sus hijos para buscar empleo en las empresas de la ciudad, la hizo establecer su propio negocio el cual es  la venta de ropa y articulos del hogar en su domicilio.
Ella vive en una zona periurbana de la perimetral en guayaquil por lo que debe construir su casa con las seguridades necesarias, para ello quiere un préstamo el cual lo invertirá también para invertir en el negocio y tener mas ganancias para darle un mejor estilo de vida a su hijos y en especial a la niña que tiene la discapacidad.
texts.en:
Janeth, aged 33, is a single mother with three children.  One of them has a disability, and the other two attend public school.

She didn't have anyone to look after her children if she were to look for employment with businesses in the city, so she started her own business, which is selling clothes and household items out of her home.

She lives in the periurban area on the edge of Guayaquil, so she must build necessary security for her home.  This is why she is requesting a loan, which she will invest in this, and also invest in her business to get better earnings, so as to provide a better quality of life for her children, and especially for her disabled daughter.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Angela Meredies

texts.es:
Angela de 46 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Chepen que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad comercial, agrícola, ganadera y turismo.

Desde hace 3 años aproximadamente Angela se ha dedicado a la venta de abarrotes (leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos), frutas, verduras y bebidas, su negocio lo ha colocado en casa para su comodidad y seguridad, ya que puede atender a la hora que desea, con las ganancias por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos y necesidades de su hogar.

Para poder  ampliar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más mercadería para abastecer su negocio, con el único objetivo de que su negocio crezca y tenga más productos que ofrecerles a sus clientes;  para cubrir su préstamo y sus obligaciones familiares.  Angela es una mujer responsable, dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por tener más cosas que ofrecerle a su familia al igual que mejorar económicamente.
texts.en:
46-year-old Angela lives with her family in her own home which has all basic services.  Her home is located in the urban area of Chepen district, in La Libertad department.  This area is noted for its commercial activity, farming, livestock raising and tourism.

For approximately three years, Angela has been selling groceries (milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna and eggs), fruit, vegetables, and drinks.  Her business is located in her home for her own comfort and security as she is able to serve her customers at whatever hour she pleases.  She uses the profits that she makes from selling her products to try and cover all her household needs and expenses.

In order to expand her business, Angela has requested a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can buy more merchandise to stock her business with.  Her sole aim is for her business to grow and to have more products to sell to her customers.  This will allow her to repay her loan and cover her family expenses.  Angela is a responsible, committed and hard-working woman who works so that she can have more things to offer her family and improve her financial situation.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to stock her business

loans.name: Amandina

texts.es:
Amandina nació en la provincia del Calca. Actualmente, Amandina tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos. 

Amandina vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella es docente y trabaja en un colegio particular en la ciudad de Calca, ella desde hace 16 años que enseña en este colegio en el nivel primario y le va muy bien, ella también tiene un emporio en el mercado modelo de la ciudad de Calca.

En esta oportunidad Amandina requiere el préstamo para comprar carne de ganado y carne de chancho. 

El Banco Comunal “Milenium III” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad de Calca del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Amandina was born in the province of Calca. She is currently 45 years old, married and has three children.

Amandina lives and works in the same city where she was born. She is a teacher and works at a private school in the city of Calca. She has been teaching primary education at this school for 16 years and it is going very well. She also has a shop in the Calca market.

At this time, Amandina needs a loan to buy cow and pig meat.

The "Millennium III" communal bank meets every 30 days in the city of Calca, which is in the department of Cusco (Peru). Cusco is known as a tourist and commercial zone. It is also known for its traditional festival of Inti Raymi and as the home of Machu Picchu, one of the seven wonders of the world.

loans.use: to buy cow and pig meat

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine is 27 years old. She lives in Yerevan with her mother, as her father deceased and her brother lives in Russia. For the past nine years, Armine has been a trader. She rents a stall where she sells sport shoes, slippers, children footwear, and rucksacks. She buys merchandise from nearby countries once a month and resells it in her stall. Armine’s mother helps her as much as possible and thus they maintain their family. 

This is Armine’s second loan and she is requesting 2,500 USD to buy a large lot of slippers and children's autumn shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy slippers and children's shoes to sell

loans.name: Glenda Patricia

texts.es:
Glenda, es empleada, vive con su madre, ella administra una pupuseria donde ofrece pupusas de queso, chicharon, revueltas y bebidas, gaseosas, chocolate y refrescos  por las tardes de martes a domingo.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar materia prima como (maíz, quesillo chicharon) y mesas, aceite y bebidas, con esta compra tendrá lo necesario para mantener el negocio y con la compra de mesas podra alojar a más clientes, con la intencion que esten más comodos.
El sueño de Glenda es,  que el negocio crezca y poder aumentar en sus ingresos y tener lo necesario para vivir mejor y que su madre siempre tenga lo necesario.
texts.en:
Glenda is employed and lives with her mother. She manages a pupuseria (a store selling stuffed tortillas) which sells tortillas stuffed with cheese, pork cracklings, scrambled eggs and drinks, sodas, chocolate and refreshments in the evenings from Tuesdays to Sundays.

The loan will be used to purchase raw materials such as corn, cheese, pork cracklings as well as tables, oil and beverages. These purchases are necessary to maintain the business and buy the tables which will allow her accomodate more customers with the intention of making them feel more comfortable.

Glenda's dream is that the business grow and she is able to increase their income so that they have enough to live a better life and that her mother always has everything she needs.

loans.use: to buy cheese, pork cracklings, oil and tables from the market

loans.name: Ana Maribel

texts.es: Ana Maribel D. D. cincuenta y cinco años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida.
