Ella posee una tienda donD. venD. productos D. primera necesidad, su negocio es muy famoso en la localidad donD. resiD., pues siempre tienen lo que el cliente necesita, con productos D. excelente calidad y a precios accesibles ; Ana Maribel es una mujer muy activa siempre esta trabajando y su tienda la abre desD. muy temprano; para ella el secreto del éxito, es perseverar en el empeño, para alcanzar las metas es por eso que Ana siempre está buscando la forma D. mejorar en su negocio, lo quiere hacer crecer es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar golosinas, pan, granos básicos, producto instantáneo etc. Ana Maribel tiene esperanza que D. esta forma lograra darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en: Ana Maribel is fifty-five years old and lives with her partner, though they are not married. She has a store where she sells every day groceries, and her business is well known locally because she always has what her customers are looking for and she sells top-quality goods at affordable prices. Ana Maribel is a very active woman, always working. Her store opens very early in the morning. For her, the secret of success is persevering with what you start until you reach your goal, For this reason Ana Maribel is always looking for ways to improve her business. In order to grow her business, she is seeking a loan from INTEGRAL, which will allow her to buy candies, bread, flour, rice, instant meals, etc. Ana Maribel hopes this will help her succeed in giving her family a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy candies, bread, instant meals, and staples like rice and flour.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is married and blessed with an 11-year-old child who goes to school. 

For the last six years, she has been running a boutique to make a living. She has employed two people to assist her in the the business. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya because she has been able to improve her business and her living standards.

In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. 

Anna is requesting a loan of 100,000 KES to add stock of clothes.

loans.use: To add stock of clothes.

loans.name: Abdulmumin

texts.ru: Абдулмумин проживает в районе Хамадони. Ему 66 лет. Он женат. У него шестеро детей. Кроме того у него внуки и внучки. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он занимается выращиванием овощей, пшеницы и бахчевых культур. Этим видом деятельности занимается четыре года. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Abdulmumin lives in the Hamadoni region. He is 66 years old, married and has six children. He is also a proud grandfather of two grandchildren. His wife stays at home while Abdulmumin is a farmer and grows vegetables, wheat and melons. He has been farming for the last four years and is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizer for his crops.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Mirian Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Mirian es Soltera, vive en la Ciudad de Curuguaty, comenta que tiene una peluquería bien equipada gracias a la cual ha podido salir adelante y ayudar a su familia.
Cuenta que se dedica a esto hace 18 años, por lo que ella misma dice que experiencia tiene de sobra. Gracias a la peluquería que tiene puede ayudar con los gastos y la manutención de la casa.
En cuanto a su clientela nos cuenta que siempre tiene mucho trabajo por lo que le genera muy buenos infresos. Desea seguir creciendo para que algún día pueda convertirse en una gran peluquera.
Ella solicita el crédito para la refacción de su salón de belleza, para que de esa forma pueda seguir creciendo y seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Mirian is single and lives in the city of Curuguaty.  She says that she has a well-equipped hairdressing salon which has enabled her to get ahead in life and help her family.

Mirian says that she has been in this business for 18 years and so has plenty of experience.  Thanks to the hairdressing salon that she has, she is able to cover her expenses and help support her household.

As regards her customers, Mirian tells us that she always has a lot of work, which makes her very good income.  She would like to continue growing in her business so that some day she can become a great hairdresser.

Mirian is requesting this loan to refurbish her beauty salon so that she can continue growing her business and helping her family.

loans.use: to buy materials with which to refurbish her beauty salon

loans.name: Mean

texts.en:
Mrs. Mean is a humble married woman who lives in the Reussey Keo commune, a suburb of Phnom Penh. She farms and raises poultry and piglets. Mean doesn’t work alone; her husband always assists her. Two of Mean's children are fishery workers in a nearby commune and receive a monthly salary. 

Mean will use this $500 loan to pay for farming and to purchase some poultry and piglets to raise. She hopes that she will be able to earn additional income by using this loan. It’s her third loan and she has already successfully repaid her previous ones.

loans.use: to pay for farming and to purchase some poultry and piglets to raise

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 20-year-old married woman with one child who is not in school. She has had a business selling fish in Yei, South Sudan, for six months.
Mary is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is requesting a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband who is a rickshaw driver by profession. With the loan investment, he will buy a new autorickshaw which he will supply on a rental basis to supplement his income.

He has been in the transport business for the past many years and Shazia is hopeful that by purchasing a new autorickshaw, her husband will be able to increase his income which will allow her family to live a better financial life.

Shazia is a housewife and does her household responsibilities by staying at home. She has given birth to 3 daughters and a son. Two of her children are studying while the remaining two are not of school-going age yet.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shazia.

loans.use: to buy a new autorickshaw for a transport business

loans.name: Abdurahmon

texts.ru: Абдурахмон семейный имеет 4-х  детей. Жена домохозяйка. Для содержания своей семьи он занимается выращиванием винограда и откормом скота. Раньше он работал в колхозе бригадиром. В настоящее время бизнес приносит доходы. Но для получения большей прибыли ему хотелось бы приобрести несколько голов мелкого рогатого скота и концентратного корма для них. Он хочет получить займ в размере 3000 сомони и надеется на вашу поддержку и понимание.
texts.en: Abdurahmon is a family man with four children.  His wife is a homemaker.  To support his family, he is involved in growing grapes and fattening up livestock.  He previously worked as a foreman.  The business currently yields profits, but Abdurahmon wants to purchase several heads of small livestock and concentrated feed for them in order to make a larger profit.  He wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 3000 somoni and relies on your support and understanding.

loans.use: to buy small livestock and fodder for it

loans.name: Djiguéne Bakhna 40 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Djiguène Bakhna 40 composé de 5 femmes  habitent dans un village situé à environ 16 km de la ville principale. Elles font du commerce de fruits  et légumes.
Leur présidente madame Astou  possède une expérience de plus de dix ans. Mariée, madame  Astou participe à la dépense quotidienne de la famille. Elle aimerait ouvrir un magasin pour diminuer ses déplacements.
texts.en:
The "Djiguène Bakhna 40" group comprises five women who live in the same town, located about 16 km from the main city. They sell fruits and vegetables.
The group president, Ms. Astou, has more than ten years' experience in this field. A married woman, Ms. Astou participates in providing for the family. She would like to open a store to reduce her need to travel.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for resale at the local market.

loans.name: Jiyoung

texts.en:
This loan will help Jenny prepare her baby clothing business for the busy fall and winter seasons.

Jenny’s interest in crafting children’s clothing began when she worked for a clothing line during college. After she graduated, she decided to pursue her new passion for clothing design and, in 2006, she launched her own company, Overall Baby. Wanting to create fun, fashionable and practical clothes for kids, Jenny decided to bring the idea of the overall back into style. She began by selling her brand on Etsy.com. However, wholesalers soon were contacting Jenny about her sporty all-cotton clothes and her brand took off.

Now her overalls are sold online and in stores nationwide, as well as in stores in Australia, Canada, Italy and Indonesia. Jenny’s busiest time of the year is fall, leading up to the holiday season. This loan will help Jenny purchase the materials and supplies she needs to meet the pending seasonal demand. 

View Jenny’s products and learn more about her business at: http://overallbaby.com/

loans.use: to purchase supplies and materials in preparation for the busy fall season.

loans.name: Kimya's Group

texts.en:
A 31 years old farmer in Banteay Meanchey province, Kimya is married and blessed with three dependent children, two of whom are in school while the other is under the age of school. She grows rice and vegetables to make a living. Challenges to rice growing business are pests and weeds.
This will be the fourth cycle for her with VisionFund and those past loans, which were paid back successfully, have enabled her to send her children to school and to buy more household supplies. As the leader of two members group, she will use her loan to buy rice seeds, organic pesticide and organic fertilizer to boost rice yields. She hopes to get abundant yields to startup new business and to keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer to boost rice yields to keep sending her children school.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Mariana has a small workshop where she makes clothes for women and children. She also buys clothes to sell in her store. She learned this activity from her mother when she was 10. Every week, she would accompany her mother to sell the clothes they had made, going to different areas around their village; Mariana still keeps the sewing machine her mother left her.

Her workshop is in her house and it is open from Monday to Sunday. She has a granddaughter that keeps her company and helps her when she needs to run some errands. She also has other sources of income because she had a first aid in nursing training, so she offers her services to the community.

Mariana needs a loan to buy fabrics, threads, laces and all the necessary materials needed to make clothes. She also would like to put a down payment for a new sewing machine.

She is 58 years old and has 3 sons, all of which are independent. She does not have a husband because he left her and the kids when they were still very young. She has had to take care of the family; with her income she was able to buy a property and build a house made of cane, which she later improved using cement. At the same time, she has another source of income from a property she is renting out. She wishes to keep on with her work and business since these are her only sources of income.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Mariana tiene un pequeño taller de confección de ropa de mujer y niños. A su vez compra ropa para vender en su local. Ella aprendió esta actividad a la edad de 10 años ya que su madre lo hacía también. Cada semana acompañaba a su madre para vender la ropa que habían confeccionado recorriendo las diferentes zonas y los campos cercanos a su pueblo; ella todavía conserva la máquina de coser que le dejó su madre.

Su taller lo tiene en su casa y lo atiende de lunes a domingo. Tiene una nieta que la acompaña y le ayuda atender cuando ella sale de su casa. También ella tiene otros ingresos porque aprendió primeros auxilios de enfermería y ofrece sus servicios a la comunidad.

Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar: telas, hilos, encajes todo lo que sea necesario para confeccionar la ropa, a su vez desea dar de entrada para comprar una nueva máquina.

Mariana tiene 58 años, tiene 3 hijos y todos ellos son independientes. No tiene esposo porque la abandonó con sus 3 hijos cuando éstos eran pequeños. Ella ha tenido que sacar adelante su hogar; con los ingresos generados pudo comprar su terreno y hacer primero su casa de caña y luego poco a poco llevarla de cemento. A su vez tiene 1 alquiler que le significan otros ingresos. Su aspiración es seguir con su negocio y trabajo ya que son sus únicas fuentes de ingreso.

loans.use: Comprar telas, hilos y encajes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more equipments for his tennis training business

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Born in Kpéléhémé in 1971, Akossiwa A. now lives in Mawussi with her husband and her five (05) children. Farming remains her profession. Every season, Mrs. A. grows large fields of corn and cassava. Nicknamed “the iron women,” she manages to produce larger harvests than even some men. Today, her land is less fertile and will cause a drop from her usual harvest amount; she is thus forced to go in search of fertilizer. For this purpose, Mrs. Akossiwa A. is asking for a loan of $650 to buy fertilizer to enrich her land and thus increase production. As a result, the receipt of this loan will help Akossiwa and her family to flourish.

Translated from French by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Née à Kpéléhémé en 1971, Mme A. Akossiwa vit actuellement à Mawussi avec son mari et ses cinq (05) enfants. Le travail de la terre reste sa profession. Chaque saison, Mme A. cultive de vastes champs de maïs et de manioc. Surnommée « dame de fer », elle réussit à dominer même certains hommes en matière de production des récoltes. Aujourd’hui, les terres agricoles devenues pauvres font chuter son niveau habituel de récolte ; ce qui l’oblige à se tourner vers la recherche de l’engrais. Pour cela, Mme A. Akossiwa sollicite un crédit de $650 pour acheter de l’engrais afin d’enrichir ses terres culturales et augmenter par conséquent sa production. Comme impact, l’octroi de ce crédit permettra à Akossiwa d’arriver à épanouir sa famille.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to enrich her land

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Mr. G. is a young worker who, with great effort, has set up a business that produces bricks and blocks, frequently used for construction in Nicaragua. He is married and the father of two school-age children. He is requesting the loan to invest in the maintenance and repair of the machinery that allows him to produce high quality bricks and blocks. He bought the machines second hand and they now have more than a decade of use. For that reason, they break down often during production and he needs to repair them in order to increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. G. es un joven trabajador que con mucho esfuerzo ha formado una empresa en la cual se fabrican ladrillos y bloques que son muy usados en las construcciones en Nicaragua. Es casado y padre de dos niños en edad escolar. Está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en el mantenimiento y reparación de la maquinaria que le permite elaborar bloques y ladrillos de buena calidad. El compró dichas máquinas de segunda mano y tienen más de una década de uso, por lo cual le están fallando a la hora de la producción y necesita repararlas para incrementar sus ingresos.

loans.use: Maintenance and repair of machinery.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Nguyen Thi H., a 48 year-old woman who lives in Nghi Trung commune, Nghi Loc always has passion on her job. Her small stall with groceries such as duck eggs, garlic, onion, spice, cereal products plays an important part in her whole family income. H. has been a member of TYM for 6 years, with the total loans increasing from 75USD at the beginning to 325USD at the present. She said TYM’s policy helps her learn how to save and spend reasonably. Her income is about 3USD per day. Besides the repayment to TYM, each month she earns 60USD. Her two children have grown up, one becomes a teacher and the other becomes a soldier. H. thinks she will continue this job for another 15 years. Now she is applying for a 325USD loan to buy more groceries for her stall.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Hạnh, một phụ nữ 48 tuổi sống tại xã Nghi Trung, Nghi Lộc, luôn cảm thấy yêu thích công việc mà mình đang làm. Quầy hàng nhỏ với các mặt hàng như trứng vịt, hành, tỏi, gia vị ... đóng góp một phần quan trọng về thu nhập trong gia đình chị. Đây là năm thứ 6 chị tham gia Quỹ Tình thương, số vốn được vay đã tăng từ 75 USD ở vòng đầu lên 325 USD thời điểm hiện tại. Chị nói cơ chế hoàn trả của Quỹ giúp chị biết cách tiết kiệm và tính toán hợp lý mỗi khi chi tiêu. Thu nhập hàng ngày khoảng 3 USD, ngoài các khoản phí hoàn trả cho Quỹ mỗi tháng chị thu về khoảng 60 USD. Hai con chị đã trưởng thành, một làm giáo viên, một đi bộ đội. Chị nghĩ mình sẽ còn tiếp tục làm công việc này trong 15 năm nữa. Hiện chị đang xin vay 325 USD đầu tư cho việc mua hàng.

loans.use: buy groceries, etc duck eggs, garlic, onion, spice, cereal products ...

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
In one of the busiest avenues of Juliaca we met Eva, a 24-year-old mother, selling her nutritious and tasty quinoa and apple juice, a well-known and popular drink in the city. She begins her day preparing the juice at 3:30 in the morning, and then she sells it from 6:00 to 10:00am. At first glance, this job wouldn’t seem to be very profitable, but due to the cleanliness with which she attends to her task and her delicious juices, she slowly began to earn regular customers. Now thanks to this nutritious food, she is earning her economic stability, allowing her to bring greater comfort and quality of life to her two small children. The wish of this young mother is to acquire a tricycle to expand her business and bring greater convenience to her customers. To do this, she is requesting a loan that she promises to repay in six months. Let’s support this young and enterprising woman in continuing on with her nourishing nectars.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

En una de las avenidas más comerciales de la ciudad de Juliaca encontramos a Eva, joven madre de 24 años de edad, vendiendo sus deliciosos y nutritivos jugos de quinua con manzana; néctar muy conocido y consumido por la población de su ciudad.Eva inicia su día preparando sus jugos desde las 3.30 de la madrugada para luego venderlos de 6:00 a 10:00 de la mañana; en un principio este oficio no parecía ser muy rentable pero conforme fueron pasando los días por el buen trato que daba a sus clientes, la limpieza con la que los atendía y preparaba sus agradables jugos, poco a poco fue obteniendo asiduos clientes y ahora gracias a este nutritivo alimento está obteniendo bienestar económico, permitiéndole también brindarles comodidad y una mejor calidad de vida a sus dos pequeños niños.El deseo de esta joven madre es adquirir otro triciclo para ampliar su negocio y brindar mejor comodidad a sus clientes, para esto solicita obtener un préstamo que promete reembolsarlos en un lapso de seis meses. Apoyemos a esta joven y emprendedora madre a seguir creciendo con su nutritivo néctar.

loans.use: Purchase of a tricycle to broaden her region and quantity of products.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: My name is Shazia. My husband's name is A. and we have three children, a son and two daughters. My husband has a small retail shop, and I am involved in selling blankets, bedsheets and cloth, which I purchase from another city and sell in Lahore market. I need a loan of $250 to purchase blankets, bedsheets and the other cloth items for the business. All my children are studying, and our household expenses are very high. I am working so that I can give a better future to my children.

loans.use: Buy items for the business in bulk

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice A. O. is 35 years old, married with two children and hails from Ajamgdadi, Lagos State, Nigeria. Ever since completing her training more than two years ago, she has made a living working as a stylist and cosmetologist. She also sells beauty supplies. Alice has been a LAPO client for the last three years, and has applied for a loan of $450 to buy new supplies for her beauty parlor.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for a beauty parlor

loans.name: Maria Rafaela

texts.es:
María lost her previous employment when the street vendor area was removed by the Town Hall. She decided to purchase a stall in the market near her home.

This was ten years ago, and she is very proud of her accomplishments as a businesswoman. Her clothes stall is one of the largest in the market and she has a loyal client base.

María´s dream is to purchase a fleet of vehicles to create a taxi company. Recently she purchased a new taxi which her son-in-law is driving. Soon she will purchase her second cab. María is 62 years old, but she is full of vitality and wants to see her dream fulfilled with her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: Downpayment for a new taxi

loans.name: Kimsruy

texts.en:
Mr. Kimsruy S. and his wife have been married since 1990. They have three children; one son and two daughters. Their first daughter works in a garment factory and the other two children are in school. The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Kimsruy has been a truck driver for seventeen years. He carries recycling materials from Phnom Penh to Vietnam. He earns $120 per month for his salary. His wife stays at home.

Mr. Kimsruy is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $500 to repair his house.

loans.use: To repair his house

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
Nora is a very happy and enterprising mother dedicated to her family, from a very young age she has been selling cosmetic products. She has become one of the most beloved and popular persons inside her environment. This is why she found in this business the way of generating an extra income to support her husband with the expenses of her home. At present, thanks to her patience, warmth and especially to her persuasive gift for sales, she has managed to obtain big quantity of orders. Now seeing that some beauty cosmetics are on sale or have good credit terms, Nora wants to acquire them to have them in stock, in order to be able to sell them at any time and this way increase her sales, but she doesn’t have the sufficient budget to carry out her plans. With this project in mind Nora is asking for your support!

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Nora, es una madre muy alegre, emprendedora y consagrada a su familia, desde muy joven estuvo dedicada a la venta de productos cosméticos, convirtiéndose en una de las personas más queridas y populares dentro de su entorno, es así que encontró en este negocio la manera de generar ingresos extras para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar. Actualmente, gracias a su paciencia, cordialidad y sobre todo a su don persuasivo para las ventas, está logrando obtener gran cantidad de pedidos, ahora viendo las facilidades y las ofertas con las que llegan algunos cosméticos de belleza Nora desea adquirirlos para tenerlos en stock, a fin de poder venderlos al instante y así aumentar sus ventas, pero no cuenta con suficiente presupuesto para concretar sus planes. Con este proyecto en mente Nora recurre a ti persona para solicitarte un préstamo.

loans.use: Increase her working capital to acquire a bigger quantity of products.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina is a married mother of 3 children ages 20, 18, and 16. She started the business because she needed an additional income aside from her husband's. Her parents are under her care, and she needs money for their diabetes medication, so 2 years ago she started selling comforters, sheets, and bedding by catalogue to her friends and family. Her sales have been good, so she set up a business space.

She now needs a loan of $500.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, so that she can expand her business space. With your help, Carolina will keep moving forward.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Carolina es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 20, 18 y 16 años. Inició el negocio por necesidad de contar con un ingreso adicional al que le proporciona su esposo, porque se hace cargo economicamente de sus papas, ella necesitaba dinero para medicamento de sus padres ya que los dos son diabeticos. Por lo que decidio emprender su negocio comenzó hace 2 años , ofreciendo colchas, sabanas, blancos por catalogo entre sus familiares y amigos. logrando asi buenas ventas, hasta establecerse en un local.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $ 500 que pagara en 6 meses para ampliar su negocio. Con tu ayuda Carolina seguira adelante.

loans.use: Remodel bussines space

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en: Khursheed baji wife of M. lives in a city named Kasur, Pakistan. Khursheed baji is a housewife. She is master of making decorative embroidery. Through this skill she gets recognition in her neighborhood. Now she took this skill as an occupation and starts making embroider dresses on customers order. Khursheed successfully completed her first loan from Asasah a microfinance institute of Pakistan. Now she has lack of material to fulfill the requirements of her customers therefore she applies a loan to fulfill her customers need and earns a good profit.

loans.use: To improve the financial conditions

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
In one of the new developments in the city of Juliaca is located Julia’s home. Julia decided eight years ago to add a room to her house and start her store. Thanks to the benefit that this business has given her, she has been able to give an education to her two children, to whom she wishes to give the opportunity to continue with their higher education, an opportunity that she never had because of the limited economic resources of her humble parents. The wish of this happy and loving mother is to grow and multiply her stock of products, with the goal of meeting all of the requests of her new neighbors, who take a keen interest in this little store.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva volunteer.

En una de las nuevas urbanizaciones de la ciudad de Juliaca está ubicado el domicilio de Julia, quien desde hace 8 años decidió adecuar un ambiente de su casa e implementar su bodega, gracias a los beneficios que obtiene con este negocio puede brindarles estudios a sus dos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles la oportunidad de seguir sus estudios superiores, oportunidad que ella nunca tuvo por los bajos recursos económicos de sus humildes padres.El deseo de esta alegre y amorosa madre es ampliar y aumentar el stock de sus productos con el fin de complacer cada uno de las solicitudes de sus nuevos vecinos quienes encuentran en esta bodeguita una cálida atención.

loans.use: Investment capital to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Naseem M. Manzoor Group

texts.en:
Naseem baji is the wife of Manzoor A. and lives in a city named Chichawatni, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 5 years. Naseem baji's husband sells wooden sticks in various places as well as his community. He has been in this work for the last 3 years. Naseem baji successfully completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more wooden sticks to expand her husband's business.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Zareena baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle). Salma baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart. Kalsoom baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle). Nishan baji wants a loan to buy more wood to re-sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more wooden sticks for re-sale

loans.name: Choa

texts.en: Choa S. is a widow born in 1962 who raises pigs on her farm in Kampong Cham where she lives with her very young grandchild and her elderly father-in-law. She raises pigs making around US$4 each day and would like to diversify her sources of income. She has asked CREDIT for a loan of US$400 to purchase some grocery items to resell in her community. She has seen a need for this type of business and believes that she can find enough customers to make this a good investment. More income will allow her to increase her food consumption and can help her household improve its standard of living.

loans.use: Choa would like to purchase grocery items to resell in her community.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=28975&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasum que significa Trabajemos en quechua. Victoria es separada, tiene 39 años y 4 hijos, Victoria viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región, los días lunes viaja a Chiara que se ubica a 2 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, los martes a Hatunccasa, miércoles a Quishuar, jueves a Ichubamba, viernes a Pampas y se queda 3 días en este pueblo, Victoria vende abarrotes, frutas, ropas y todo cuanto le piden y de las ferias compra cereales, animales menores, queso, productos que vende en el mercado al por mayor y a veces de casa en casa. Además Victoria vende leña en su casa y también reparte de casa en casa, la leña lo adquiere en los pueblos y luego lo transporta a la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Victoria necesita un préstamo de 2100 dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz, aceite y ropa. Los sueños de Victoria son construir el segundo piso de su casa, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos para que sean profesionales y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
First Loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=28975&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Victoria is a partner of the Community Bank "Llamkasum," which means "we work" in Quechua. Victoria is separated from her husband, in 39 years old, and has 4 children. She travels to different fairs in the region: Mondays to Chiara, which is 2 hours from the city of Ayacucho; Tuesdays to Hatunccasa; Wednesdays to Quishar; Thursdays to Ichubamba; Friday to Pampas, where she stays for 3 days. Victoria sells general items, fruits, clothing, and anything clients ask for at the fairs. At the fairs she buys cereals, small animals, cheese, and products that she sells in the market at wholeslae, and sometimes door-to-door. In addition, Victoria sells wool from her home and also door-to-door. She gets the wool from the villages and then transports it to the city of Ayacucho.

Victoria needs a loan of $700 that she will invest in the purchase of sugar, rice, cooking oil, and clothing. Victoria's dreams are to build a second floor to her house, provide a good education to her children so that they can be professionals, and to expand her business.


Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sugars, rice, cooking oil, and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Muslima

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Dar es salaam Tanzania. This is Muslima S., a married woman with one child. She is a Tanzanian entrepreneur who runs a cosmetics business, selling lotions, perfumes, girls handbags, etc. Her husband helps her to run this business.

Muslima is able to make a monthly profit of 200 USD. She is requesting a loan of 625 USD in order to purchase additional stocks of lotions, perfumes, and handbags. In the future she plans to increase the quantity and range of the stock. She thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, so they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of lotions, perfumes, and handbags

loans.name: Senovia Antonia

texts.es: La señora Senovia R. tiene la edad  de 36 años,  habita en el barrio Medardo Andino ubicado en municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo y hija, el esposo trabaja como gestor de cobro, para ayudarle con los gastos de la casa, la señora trabaja como analista en la DGI, desde hace ochos años, la mayor dificultad que ha tendido es la falta de recurso para poder mejorar su casa, ya que ella vive en un cuarto que le dio su mamá. Los sueños de doña Senovia es llegar a terminar su casa. Con el préstamo va invertir en infraestructura en la compra de materiales como piedra, cemento, arena, hierro, para comenzar la construccion.
texts.en:
Mrs. Senovia R. is 36 years old and lives in the Medardo Andino neighborhood in the city of Ticuantepe with her husband and their daughter. Her husband works for a collection agency. In order to help him with the family's expenses, she has worked as an analyst in the DGI for the past 8 years. The biggest difficulty the family has had is earning enough to improve their home since Senovia lives in a small room that her mother offered her. Senovia's dream is to finish the construction of her home. With this loan, she will invest in materials to finish her home such as stone, cement, sand, and iron.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials to finish construction of her home

loans.name: Math's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan group with five members that has selected Mrs. P. as leader.

Mrs. P. is a 43-year-old fish seller who delivers her catch to customers' homes. She has been in this line of work since 2000 and can earn around $3.20 per day. Her husband, Mr. Sorn Sek, 42, is oxen trader. Mrs. P. and her husband work every day as well as care for four children, all of whom are young and live at home. Because her business is her family's main source income, P. would like expand her operations with a loan to buy more fish to sell.

The other four members of her group are: Mrs. Ma D., 35, sells perfume and wants a loan to buy more items to sell. Mrs. Math M., 63, sells roasted chickens and needs a loan to buy more poultry to buy and cook. Mrs. Rim RohiM., 29, sells used clothes and needs to buy more items to sell. Mrs. No S., 51, sells rice cakes and would like to start a new business selling home products.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Sabanalamarino Unido V Group

texts.en: Barbara A. is the bank coordinator for a group of 5 in the Sabanalamarinos Unidos Bank of Hope in Hato Mayor, Dominican Republic. She has three young children ages 3, 5 and 7. She sells clothes in her small business. She has already received four loans from Esperanza and is about to receive her fifth loan.  With these loans she has been able to invest in a freezer and a gas cylinder. She would like to increase her sales volume and the clothing variety available and hopes to one day open her own real store. Her dream is to have a house of her own where she can see her children grow up. Thank you for supporting this loan!

loans.use: Refurbish business with new clothing to sell

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru: Сатторова Шарофат проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Работает в столовой. Занимается этим бизнесом уже 7 лет. Кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы закупить продукты питания долгого хранения. Это поможет сохранить цены на предлагаемую продукцию. Кредит планирует погасить в течение 12 месяцев. Шарофат 49 лет , замужем и имеет троих детей.
texts.en:
Sharofat S. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She works in a cafe, and has been in the business for the past 7 years. She plans to take out a loan to buy foods which keep well in storage. This will help her maintain prices for the the products offered. The loan will be repaid over 12 months. Sharofat is 49 years old, married, and has three children.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of preserved foods

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Miss W. Christine is an owner of a school in Kacence, Mbarara. She has been operating the school for four years now. Christine obtained the loan funds to purchase more items like uniforms, library books and other school requirements. With the growth of the school, she hopes to construct a secondary school.

Christine is married with four children.

loans.use: To purchase more uniforms and library books

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
En la  ciudad de Managua, capital del bello país de Nicaragua, la señora Martha P. dedica su tiempo a la venta de productos de uso domestico siendo este su negocio desde hace 10 años.

Como todo negocio en desarrollo requiere de inversión constante, el negocio de la venta de productos de uso domésticos requiere de inversión por lo que debe adquirir los productos y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de estos y así ofertarlos en su negocio.
texts.en:
En la ciudad de Managua, capital del bello país de Nicaragua, la señora Martha P. dedica su tiempo a la venta de productos de uso domestico siendo este su negocio desde hace 10 años. Como todo negocio en desarrollo requiere de inversión constante, el negocio de la venta de productos de uso domésticos requiere de inversión por lo que debe adquirir los productos y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de estos y así ofertarlos en su negocio.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of home products

loans.name: Titi Aurélie

texts.fr: K. titi est une femme mariée qui a 03 enfants. Elle réside avec sa famille dans le quartier d’agoè adougba. Son mari est retraité et son revenu ne pouvant plus couvrir toutes les charges de la maison, elle s’est lancée en 2007 dans le commerce de bois de chauffage. Ainsi le revenu qu’elle gagne lui permet de contribuer aux dépenses de al famille. Son stock actuel de bois de chauffage étant épuisé, elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 100 tas de bois de chauffage.
texts.en:
K. Titi is a married women who has three children. She resides with her family in the Agoè Adougba district. Her husband is retired. And since her income was no longer able to cover all household expenses, she got started in 2007 in the commerce of firewood. Thus, the income she earns enables her to help with family expenses. With her current stock of firewood depleted, she's requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy 100 piles of firewood.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood

loans.name: René Antonio

texts.es:
El joven René S. es una persona muy trabajadora ya  que se dedica a atender su negocio de pulpería en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino donde se desempeña arduamente buscando la manera de salir adelante en su negocio y mantener a su familia compuesta por su cónyuge e hijos.

Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel habiendo solicitado un crédito para la compra de los productos y así ofrecerlos en su localidad para continuar con su negocio de pulpería que tanto requiere de inversión.
texts.en:
The young Rene S. is a hard-working person, and works in his shop in the city of Sandino. He is always looking for ways to get ahead in his business, and to support his family consisting of his spouse and children. These days he has gone to Ceprodel requesting a loan in order to purchase products and offer them in his town so he can continue with his shop, which requires investment.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products

loans.name: Essenam

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants, madame A. Essenam est née le 31 décembre 1951 à Ahlon, Localité située à 180 Km de Lomé. Elle est une femme dynamique qui exerce le commerce quasiment mené par les hommes. Elle fait le commerce de planche qu’elle achète au Ghana et revend au menuisier de la capitale togolaise.
Compte tenu de l’évolution de son activité, elle veut acheter une scie électrique et des planches afin de procéder à leur commercialisation.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of three children, Ms. A. Essenam was born on December 31, 1951 in Ahlon, a town located 180 km from Lomé. She is an energetic woman who has a business almost always run by men. She does commerce in planks that she buys in Ghana and resell to cabinet makers of the capital of Togo. Given her business improvements, she wants to buy a power saw and some boards in order to market them.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy planks and a power saw

loans.name: Aminatou

texts.fr: K. C. Aminatou est née vers 1938 à Savè, une Commune du Département des Collines au Centre du Bénin. Aminatou est mariée à OBEY Mouftaou, un militaire mais actuellement à la retraite. Aminatou a eu trois enfants qui ont été tous à l'école. Mais Aminatou même n'a jamais été à l'école ni appris un métier. Depuis son adolescence, Aminatou a été initiée au petit commerce par sa mère qui vendait des ustensiles de cuisine en plastique (seaux, bassines, récipients, etc.). Devenue majeure, Aminatou s'est mise à son propre compte et a continué la même activité. C'est cette activité que Aminatou exerce encore aujourd'hui. Mais, entre temps, Aminatou a diversifié la vente des ustensiles de cuisine en plastique avec la vente de divers articles (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, etc.). Aminatou a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits de ALIDé; crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu amener ses activités à un stade supérieur. Pour renforcer son fonds de roulement dans l'optique de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Aminatou sollicite un troisième prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
K. C. Aminatou was born around 1938 in Savè, a community in the Department of Collines in the center of Bénin. Aminatou is married to Obey Mouftaou, a soldier who is presently retired. She has three children who all went to school, but Aminatou herself neither went to school nor learned a trade. Since adolescence, she was taught petty trading by her mother, who sold kitchen utensils made of plastic (buckets, basins, containers, etc.)

Once she was an adult, Aminatou went out on her own, continuing the same business. This is the business that Aminatou is in today, but she diversified from selling plastic kitchen utensils to selling various items (candy, cookies tins of milk, sardines, tomatoes; sugar, pasta, detergent, dish soap and hand soap, etc.) Aminatou has already had two loans from ALIDé, loans she reimbursed correctly and which allowed her to raise her business to a higher level. To bolster her working capital so as to better satisfy her clientele, Aminatou is requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a case of tinned tomatoes, 1/2 case of tinned milk, 1 jerry can of 25 liters of vegetable oil, one case of detergent, 4 sacks of charcoal, and 4 trays of eggs

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet A. is the married mother of five children: two sons and three daughters who are all currently in the senior high, the junior high and the primary schools. She is forty-five years old. Janet lives with her husband and children in a family house in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana.

Janet is a baker. She bakes bread in her community and supplies to retailers and beverage sellers. She also hawks (goes door-to-door) to sell as well. She buys bags of flour and other ingredients from Kumasi. She has been in business for twenty years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk. She desires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Mary

texts.es: Mary tiene 54 años, vive con sus 2 nietos, es casada, pero su esposo viaja continuamente por motivos laborales, él vende madera. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de comidas regionales en un lugar que acondiciona fuera de su casa cada día. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es la venta directa, pues le agrada conversar con sus clientes y darles un trato amable. Considera que este negocio le es rentable porque se encuentra ubicada en un lugar muy transitado, y las personas con tan sólo ver sus variados platillos no dejan de comprar para degustar su sazón. Para más adelante, Mary quiere tener un restaurante muy bien implementado, donde pueda vender sus comidas con mayor comodidad y donde pueda atender a más personas. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que juntamente con todos sus compañeros, trabajan responsablemente y son bien coordinados. El dinero que solicita será usado para la construcción de un kiosco adecuado para atender a sus clientes, pues ahora lo hace a la intemperie.
texts.en:
Mary is 54 and lives with her two grandchildren. She is married, but her husband is always traveling for his job. He sells wood. For three years, she has sold regional food every day in a place she has fixed up outside of her house. What she likes about her job is making sales because she likes conversing with her customers, and she tries to give them friendly service. She thinks her business is profitable because it is located in a busy area. Once people see her variety of dishes, they don't stop buying from her because of her good cooking. In the future, Mary wants to have a restaurant where she can sell her food in greater comfort and where she can serve more people. This is the first loan she has had with Microfinanzas Prisma. What she likes about her communal bank is being with her fellow members, who work responsibly and who are well-coordinated. The money she is requesting will go towards building a kiosk so she can attend to her customers. Now she makes her sales out in the open.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a kiosk

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto P., a 54-year-old farmer and father of nine children, has been farming since 1976 and owns a one-and-one-half hectare rice field that provides his family with an income to support its needs, including school tuition and groceries. Now, he would like to request a loan worth Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to purchase fertilizers and chemicals.

CEVI helps Roberto sustain his livelihood, providing him with loans, training, and insurance coverage..

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals.

loans.name: Silver

texts.en:
Silver S. is a young man and is 23 years old. He is single, and lives with his parents. 

With this new loan for his business of 500,000 RWF he will be able to buy more merchandise for his shop. The profits from this loan will allow him to get married, changing his life forever. He will also save money so that he will be able to buy his own house.

Silver has five years experience in his business and works every day from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. He is excited to see how this new loan will impact his community.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Doña Maria Elena de 44 años de edad, casada, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital Managua, con dos hijos de 13 y 15 años de edad, estudian en el colegio del barrio, su esposo trabaja en servicios de seguridad, sus planes  es poder terminar de construir su casa, ella laborar en un centro de comidas rápida en Tip Top pero su salario es bajo lo cual no ha podido realizar sus proyecto y lo ha logrado a través de préstamo que le ha financiado Afodenic, con esta préstamo comprara materiales de construcción para terminar de construir un cuarto en donde pueda gozar de mejores condiciones su familia. lo que mas desea es poder encontrar otro trabajo donde tenga mejores ingresos ya que la canasta alimenticia esta cara, y no suben el salario lo que impide mejorar el nivel de vida. Da las gracias a la institución por hacer posible las mejoras a su vivienda.

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion para hacer cuartos

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Comprar Pacas de camisetas, pacas de pantalones Jeans.

loans.name: Fati

texts.en: Fati is 44years old she is married and mother of six children. Four of her children attend school. She is resourceful mother who works very hard to provide food and support for her business.  She is a petty trader and sells in the local area market. She enjoys selling, a business through which she makes a living. She sells vegetables items like cooking oil, pepper, spices, carrots etc. on top of a table in the market. She has been in this business for the last six years. Through this business she is manage in taking care of her first born who is in the senior high school. She takes stock of goods from the nearby villages. She is requesting for the loan to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance. She dream to provide for herself and business, this she believes would help her to provide for the children educational needs To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, spices, pepper, cooking oil etc.

loans.name: Ayishetu

texts.en: Ayishetu is fifty years old. She is married and has given birth to eight children. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She is a petty trader. She sells bags of charcoal. Ayishetu procures the goods from nearby communities. She supplies to food vendors and retailers. She has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to procure bags of charcoal in bulk. She is hopeful to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Pama

texts.en: Pama is 35 years-old and happily married with two children. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports the home. She sells tubers of yams at retail prices to her customers. She is a hard working woman and she is determined to excel in her business. She has been in this business for seven years. She hopes to be a distributor of yams in her community in Benin City, Edo state. She hopes for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more yams to sell. She said that the profits will help out her family. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to sell.

loans.name: Peter Kimeu

texts.en: Peter Kimeu is 33 years old and is married with one son. He is a tailor and has been in this business for the last 13 years. He owns the Perfect Designers and sells dresses to the co-operative. His business location is in a conducive environment although he faces some challenges of no security at night and inadequate machines for sewing.  He is using the proceeds of his loan of KES20,000 to buy more sewing machines.  In the future, he wants to be the wholesaler and main distributor in Madaraka market.  Peter describes himself as hardworking, determined and honest.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines

loans.name: Jose Saul

texts.es:
el señor Jose Saul M. tiene 53 años de edad, vive en union libre con la señora Brenda Barahona,  tienen 2 hijos. Su esposa se dedica a la venta de golosinas y Jose al negocio de 
compra y venta de agua, tiene 4 años de realizar esta actividad.
 
sus ventas son diarias, hace cuatro viajes diarios al dia
 
esta solicitando el credito para arreglar su vehiculo, cambio de repuestos y tambien hacer afinamiento, tambien comprara mas botellones de agua.

el se siente muy feliz ya que todo le esta saliendo bien.
su sueño es graduar a sus hijos de la universidad.
texts.en:
Jose Saul M., 53, lives with his life partner, Brenda Barahona; they have two sons. His wife sells sweets and Jose sells drinking water. He has been in this line of work for 4 years. His sales are daily and he makes four sales runs each day. He requests funds to repair his vehicle. It needs some parts replaced and a tune-up. He will also buy more large bottles of water. He is very happy that things are turning out well. His dream is to see his sons become university graduates.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy water in bags and large bottles.

loans.name: Amévi

texts.en: Mrs. K. runs a general store. She is married to a singer and they have one child. Her business is brand new. She began running it this year in the Grand Marché of Lomé. This will be her first loan with WAGES, which she will use to resupply her stock. Specifically, she will buy individual size bags of water, tomatoes, sardines, milk, spaghetti and canned sodas. The profits from this loan will help support her and her family.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her general store

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary M. is a seamstress and sows different kinds of traditional dresses. She also sells fabrics along with a locally made juice and bags of water at Memepeasem, near Elmina. Mary has received a junior high school education.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer. Mary has been working as a seamstress since 2004. She supports the husband in paying the children's school fees and other family financial responsibilities. Her loan will be used to buy more fabrics to sell and sewing materials to aid in her work as a seamstress. She hopes to use the new profits to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more fabrics to sell and sewing materials to aid in her work as a seamstress.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba R. is currently in the business of selling groundnut paste and charcoal and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell.  Aba is 38 years old and is married. Her husband is a clerk. Aba has 7 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a store to sell her charcoal.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Meleseke

texts.en:
Meleseke P. is 55 and married with 11 children (ages 15 - 36).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting bananas for sale.  Meleseke has 3 years of experience in this business.  Meleseke needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 380 tala or US $158 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Meleseke joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Meleseke's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Meleseke P. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.4 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.3 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.4 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.5 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15"

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es:
José Luis O. M., tiene la edad de 29 años, está en unión libre, y vive con su compañera y sus 2 hijos de 6 y 2 años de edad. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de una moto para transportarse al lugar de trabajo. Don José Luis necesita la moto para desplazarse a varios lugares, ya que trabaja en construcción y en ocasiones los lugares a los que debe ir a trabajar son muy lejanos. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento y lograr una mejor efeciencia en su trabajo, el poder llegar puntualmente. No es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que siempre se le han brindado. Don José también trabaja desde hace varios años en la construcción. El espera en un futuro mejorar su calidad de vida y tener una mayor estabilidad económica, y así poder seguir creciendo como persona y como trabajador.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
José Luis O. M., 29, lives with his life partner and their two children, who are 6 and 2 years old. He will use the loan to buy a motorcycle to get to work. José Luis needs the motorcycle to travel to various places because he works in construction and sometimes the places he must go to work are far away. He wants to give it the proper care so that he can be a more efficient worker getting to work on time. This isn't his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the loan terms given. José has worked in construction for many years. He hopes to improve his quality of life and have greater economic stability in the future so that he can continue to grow as a person and as a worker.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De Cerrito Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Ciudad de Benjamín Aceval  Cerrito Chaco. Actualmente se encuentran en el sexto ciclo, en su mayoría las clientes se dedican a la  venta de ropas- Bazar  otras se dependiendo de la facilidad y herramienta de trabajo con que cuentan realizan trabajos variados, como venta de comestibles o venta de frutas o verduras, remedios naturales y otros.
Gracias al crédito concebido por la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva tienen el deseo de superarse cada vez más, y seguir avanzando más trabajando dignamente. 
Así la señora Nilda A. quien se dedica a la venta de alimento que ella misma prepara; como empanadas. Milanesas, sopa paraguaya(harina de maíz con grasa, leche y queso) y otros; también prepara jugos de frutas naturales como de piña, naranja.
Ella utilizó el crédito para la compra de los ingredientes que utiliza para elaborar sus alimentos.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Ciudad de Benjamín Aceval Cerrito Chaco Communal Bank is in their sixth cycle. Most of the members sell clothes in bazaars. Others depend upon what they are good at doing and the work tools they have to do various jobs like selling food, selling fruit, vegetables, natural remedies, and others. Thanks to the loan from the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva they wish to improve themselves more each time. They want to keep advancing by working with dignity. That is how Nilda A. is. She sells food that she prepares herself. She makes things like empanadas, breaded meat cutlets, Paraguayan soup (corn flour with fat, milk, and cheese), and others. She also makes natural fruit juices like pineapple and orange. She used the loan to buy the ingredients she uses to make her food.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food ingredients like meat, pastas, baked goods, vegetables, condiments, and dairy products

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en:
Seraphine is 31 years old and married with two children who are 2 and 4 years old.  Seraphine is in the business of selling a variety of goods in her shop.  Those goods include cosmetic goods, radio batteries, soap, notebooks etc as the photo indicates.  The hours of the business are from 6 am to 7 pm every day.

Seraphine is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for expanding her shop by adding a large quantity of goods in her shop.  Those goods will mainly include foodstuffs like beans, rice, sugar, different types of flours etc.  With those goods, Seraphine will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow her to reinvest in her business so that her revenue can keep growing.  If successful, Seraphine will continue taking care of her children by providing more food for them as well as building a secure future for them.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs like beans, rice, sugar, different types of flours etc to resell.

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es:
El comité Amanecer nace gracias al interés de varias señoras de formar un comité y tener así la posibilidad de acceder a un crédito; muchas de ellas ya tenían experiencia en comités por lo que en base a esa experiencia formaron uno.
Realizan actividades de tal forma a cumplir con todas las responsabilidades que toman  como organización como por  ejemplo para la ayuda solidaria a quienes atraviesan por dificultades dentro del comité.
Cada una de las integrantes maneja una actividad productiva que genere ingreso, así como la señora Celsa quien se dedica a a la venta de bebidas en general en local que posee en su domicilio. La atención del negocio lo realiza su marido y aprovecha la buena ganancia que deja este rubro por ello desea comprar en gran cantidad, y solicita el crédito para este fin. 
Todas las integrantes del comité agradecen a la Fundación Paraguaya y la organización de  Kiva por la ayuda crediticia que ellos brindan.
texts.en:
The Amanecer committtee was born thanks to the interest some women had in forming a committee and thus have the possibility of accessing credit. Many of them already have experience in committees, so based on that experience they formed one. They undertake activities in such a way that they can carry out all the responsibilities that they take on as an organization. For example, the supportive help for those on the committee who go through hard times. Each of the members manages a productive activity that generates income. Mrs. Celsa sells general beverages in a locale she has in her home. Her husband attends to the business and she enjoys the good profit this activity leaves her. That is why she wants to buy in greater quatities, and she is asking for the loan for that purpose. All of the members of the committee thank the Fundación Paraguaya and the Kiva organization for the credit help that they offer.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase general beverages such as: soda, wine, beer, and all types of liquor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy Maruchan soup, eggs, laundry soap, large sardines, sugar, rice, coal, toilet paper, chicken and soft drinks

loans.name: Mrs. Shivan Monh Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of twenty people who live in Popeal Khaer village in Kandal province. All of the group members will use the loan for different purposes in order to improve their businesses in the future. Mrs. Shivan M. is the village bank president, as selected by all the members. She was born in 1957. She and her husband, Mr. Seng Pham, own a general store located in their home. Since their business is going well they want to expand it. Mrs. Shivan M. is asking for a loan to buy more groceries for the store's inventory in order to increase their income this year. The couple supports two children, one of whom earns a low salary as a car driver, while the other is a seamstress in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for inventory.

loans.name: Agalyawamu Busimbi Members Group, Mityana

texts.en:
N. Jane is 52 years old and has been contentedly married for a reasonably long period of time. She has seven children with her husband who she refers to endearingly as her “light in shining amour”. All their children are in the later stages of their education due to Jane’s down-the-line unwavering hardwork ethic she has brought forth in her produce-selling business in Wabigalo, Mityana for the last fifteen years.

At length, Jane’s good customer-care skills have lent her that countenance in establishing a lasting relationship with most of her clientele. She reckons a bright future beckons on the horizon for her business as she will be able to significantly expand her business with the support of this loan. She also wants to give all her children a quality education.

With this loan, Jane wants to purchase more quantities of produce like maize, beans, cassava, yams and cabbages.

loans.use: To purchase more produce to sell

loans.name: Benjamin Richard

texts.fr:
jeune homme de 46 ans,celibataire avec 2 enfants dont l'age varie entre 16 et 15 ans.Il ya de cela dix ans qu'il gere un parking et lavage  des voitures, autos et cars.Sa recette journaliere est de 15.000fs a 20.000frs par jours.
Avec ce pret va acheter un Kracher avec eau a pression  pour laver les vehicules, des tuyaux,aspirateurs,peaux de chameaux et un extincteur pour ameliorer la qualite de son travail et avoir plus de possibilites pour renforcer et maintenir l'entretien de son parking.
Pour arriver a cela , il preuve d'une bonne et rigoureuse gestion et fait aussi montre d'une bonne surveillance.
Dans l'avenir il pense agrandir son activite en modernisant la qualite des ses services et ouvrir une grande station service , construire une bache a eau en cas de coupure  d'eau chose tres frequente dans le quartier ou est il est installe. Tres entreprenant il epargne un peu plus d'argent pour payer les etudes des ses enfants.
texts.en:
Benjamin Richard N. is a young, 46 year-old bachelor with 2 children, 15 and 16 years of age. He has managed a parking lot and car wash for ten years. His revenue ranges from 15,000 frs to 20,000 frs per day. With this loan he is going to purchase a Karcher (pressure washer) to wash vehicles, hoses, vacuum cleaners, chamois, and a fire extinguisher to improve the quality of his work and to have more opportunities for expanding and maintaining his parking lot. In order to achieve that, he has proof of good and rigorous management and also evidence of good supervision. He is thinking of increasing his business in the future by modernizing the quality of his services and opening a large service station, building a water tank in case the water is cut off, a frequent event in the neighborhood where he is located. Very enterprising, he saves a little more money to pay for the education of his children.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a pressure washer, hoses, vacuum cleaner, chamois and detergents

loans.name: Lepapa

texts.en:
Lepapa L. is 39 years old, married, and has 4 children. She owns a business venture, selling pancakes (fried flour pancakes flavored with lemon or coconut jam). Lepapa has 3 years of experience in this business. Lepapa needs a loan of WST$2000 to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 150 talas or US $63 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2007, Lepapa joined SPBD. This is her 4th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Lepapa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD: 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags

loans.name: Saira's Group

texts.en:
Saira lives in the historic city of Lahore in Pakistan. She is a housewife who lives with her family and children. Her husband is a tailor by profession and operates a tailoring shop in the market. He is very good at his art and very famous for his quality work. As a result, he receives a good number of orders, which sometimes creates problems for him to fulfill on time. He wants to buy another sewing machine and hire a worker who will assist him in fulfilling the larger orders on time. 

Therefore, Saira has applied for a loan from Asasah to help her husband buy another sewing machine to expand his business. She is hopeful that it will prove to be a good investment in her husband’s tailoring business.

loans.use: To purchase another sewing machine

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 31-year-old single lady.  She has a 10-year-old child.  She owns and operates Wambu Salon to earn a living.  She has been in the business for five years and has three employees.  

She is a member of Kikambura East group in Faulu Kenya.  She also saves her money with the group.  With support from the group, she previously serviced two loans from Faulu Kenya.  She has requested a new loan of 80,000 KES to buy a massage bed, foot spa and cosmetics. She describes herself as patient, humble and God-fearing.

loans.use: To purchase a massage bed, foot spa and cosmetics

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha N. lives in the Lugala neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, both of whom are in school. Aisha lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, school fees and medication.

Aisha has a business selling secondhand clothes at the market. She has been in this business for 3 years and she works 6 days a week. Aisha has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of secondhand clothes. The main business challenges for Aisha include transportation and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a big business and to start importing secondhand clothes rental rooms.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Mario Raúl

texts.es:
El señor Mario Raúl S. es soltero y vive en el barrio  las mercedes de la ciudad de Atyra.

 El  señor  Mario es comerciante y tiene una fotocopiadora, librería, compra-venta de celulares y venta de recarga de saldos para celulares en su salón comercial.

 Su negocio comenzó con un pequeño capital  que le facilito su madre, en aquel entonces para comenzar su pequeño negocio, y luego viendo la demanda de artículos de librería por la ubicación del negocio en frente de 2 colegios, anexó a su negocio una pequeña librería. 
Gracias a su constancia el negocio fue creciendo y hoy día cuenta con una clientela formada.  

Agradece a la fundación paraguaya por el apoyo obtenido para su actividad y mediante ello, podrá aumentar sus mercaderías brindando un buen servicio a  la comunidad y a la vez aumentando su ingreso.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de impresoras nuevas y celulares.
texts.en:
Mario Raúl S. is single and lives in the Las Mercedes neighborhood of the city of Atyra.

Mario is a businessman and has a photocopier, office supplies, he purchases and sells cell phones, and also sells pre-paid cell phone credit in his business area.

His business began with a small amount of money that his mother gave him to start his small business. Later, after seeing the demand for office supplies due to the business’ location in front of two schools, he added a small office supply shop to his business. Thanks to his perseverance, the business has been growing and today he has an established customer base.

He thanks the Fundación Paraguaya for the support provided for his business. As a result, he will be able to increase his merchandise, providing good service to the community and increasing his income at the same time.

He is requesting the loan for the purchase of new printers and cell phones.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of new printers and cell phones

loans.name: Las Chavalas Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Las Chavalas lo conforman tres mujeres emprendedoras y jóvenes que se dedican a distintas actividades económicas pero que comparten un mismo sueño el cual es sacar adelante sus negocios. Estela G. G., coordinadora del grupo vende ropa usada de manera ambulante en Nindirí y comunidades aledañas, ella hace 6 años tenía una pulpería pero no pudo seguir en la atención de dicho negocio, su esposo trabaja en Costa Rica y se llevó con él a 4 de sus hijos, en cambio ella es la responsable de los 2 menores, su sueño es que su familia esté unida y prosperada.

María se dedica a la compra/venta de frutas, comprando al por mayor y vendiendo al menudeo de manera ambulante es como ella ha conseguido salir adelante; por último Reyna tiene una fábrica de tortilla en su hogar, lugar en el cual ha conseguido vender pinol y pinolillo por encargo desde hace 1 año.
texts.en:
The "Las Chavalas" solidarity group is made up of three young, enterprising women who engage in distinct economic activities but share a common dream of getting ahead through their businesses. Estela G. G., the group coordinator, sells used clothing on foot in Nindirí and surrounding communities. Six years ago, she had a small grocery store, but she could not continue taking care of that business, as her husband works in Costa Rica and brought four of their children with him. Estela is responsible for the two youngest. Her dream is for her family to be together and prosperous. María works buying and selling fruits. She buys wholesale and sells retail, as an itinerant vendor. This is how she has managed to succeed. Finally, Reyna has a tortilla factory in her home. For the last year, she has also managed to sell pinol and pinolillo [a sweet cornmeal and cacao-based traditional drink] on order from her home.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to stock basic grains, meat, etc.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth D. is from the village of Dalirig, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 52 years old. Ruth is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Ruth owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a mini-restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. Ruth has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ruth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruth is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Ruth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace E. is from the village of Mabini, Baliangao. She is 49 years old, married and has two grown children. To make a living, Grace grows rice to sell. Grace has been engaged in her business for more than seven years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Grace joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Grace has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from PMPC. Grace is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used for rice production. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Grace from PMPC. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For rice production

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada T. is from the village of Canibungan Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. Diosdada is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Diosdada owns and operates a business that provides transportation services. Diosdada has been engaged in her business for over two years, and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Diosdada joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Diosdada has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used for her coconut business. Diosdada is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to repair her existing vehicle so that she can provide better service. This loan will be Diosdada's 13th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC:
