GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Santa Elena Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son del barrio santa Elena  de la cuidad de Tobati que dista a 16 km de la oficina regional Caacupé.

Las señoras están muy satisfechas con el apoyo económico que les está brindando la Fundación Paraguaya, con este capital las señoras están aumentando sus pequeños negocios y así también sus ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
Las señoras  están en el ciclo Nº  5º con sus 11 integrantes.

Una de las integrantes, es la señora Ovilia quien dedica a la cría  de cerdos. Actualmente desea mejorar la porqueriza que tiene y donde cría sus animales construyendo uno con tejidos y pisos de cemento ya la cría de cerdos requiere de cuidados especiales y buena higiene para una buena producción.
Solicita el préstamo para los gastos que acarreará la construcción de porqueriza como la compra de tejidos, cementos, ladrillos y mano de obra.
texts.en:
The women of this group come from the Santa Elena neighborhood in the city of Tobati, which is 16km from the Caacupé regional office.

The women are very satisfied with the financial support that Fundación Paraguaya has given them. With this loan, the group members have increased both their small businesses and their income for a better quality of life.

The eleven-member group is in its 5th loan cycle.

One of the group members is Ms. Ovilia, who raises hogs for a living. She currently hopes to improve her pig pen by putting in a fence and cement floor because raising hogs requires special care and good hygiene for good production.

She is requesting this loan for the costs associated with building a pig pen, purchasing supplies like chicken wire, cement, bricks and paying for labor.

loans.use: Purchase chicken wire, bricks, cement, and other construction materials

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
Fidel es un hombre de 49 años de edad, que se ha dedicado a apoyar a su familia. Trabaja como cadete de taxi, el cual lleva varios años dando su servicio. Siendo su vehículo propio, comprándolo con ahorros y liquidación de su trabajo anterior como lector de medidores.
Con este financiamiento comprara materiales de construcción como: laminas de zinc, perlines, golosos entre otros para mejorar el techo de su vivienda que le urge cambiar por el mal estado que esta.
Contento porque hará posible la mejora. Como planes es seguir haciendo las reparaciones de su casa ya que por este medio le es de beneficio por sus plazos.
texts.en:
Fidel is 49 years old.  He is committed to supporting his family.  He works as a taxi driver and has been providing his service for several years.  He owns his own vehicle, having bought it with his savings and severance pay from his previous job as a meter reader.

Fidel will use this loan to buy building materials such as sheets of corrugated metal, roofing beams, bolts etc. to improve the roof of his house which must be changed because it is in a bad state.

Fidel is happy that he will be able to make this improvement.  His plan is to continue making repairs on his home.  This way of doing it is helpful for him because he can pay in instalments.

loans.use: To buy corrugated metal sheets, beams, bolts and other materials to improve the roof of his house

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose A. is currently in the business of selling wax and clothes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more wax and clothes to sell.  Rose is 30 years old and married to a police officer. She has two children. One of the children goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

loans.use: To stock more wax and clothes to sell

loans.name: Sizanani Group

texts.en:
Sithembile is 44 years old, married with five children, ages 11 to 23 years. Her husband works in a factory. She sells chickens in Eshowe in South Africa. Sithembile, the leader of her borrowing group, is raising her hand in the photo above.

She's been in this business for a year and sells from her home. She also earns income from the government's children grant. She says that the main challenge to her business is clients who do not pay after buying on credit.

She requested this loan through Women’s Development Businesses and Kiva to buy chickens. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her send her children  to university and buy enough food for her family. In the future, she would like to sell new products and have more clients.

She will thank WDB and Kiva if they will make her dreams come true.

loans.use: To purchase chickens for resale

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
La señora Máxima es soltera y tiene un hijo, vive en casa de sus hermanos ya hace mucho tiempo, la casa esta ubicada en la zona alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz.
La cliente cuenta con una tienda en la cual vende ropa para mayores y niños, en una zona comercial de La Paz.
El crédito lo utilizara para la compra de mercadería y así tener productos surtidos en la tienda y poder mejorar sus ventas. Es así como obtiene sus ingresos para su hogar.
Es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Maxima is single and she has a son. She has lived in a house belonging to her siblings for a long time. The house is located in the community of Alto San Pedro in the city of La Paz. 

She has a store from where she sells clothing for adults and children, located in a commercial region in La Paz. 

The loan will be used to purchase merchandise in order to have a variety of products for her store and to perceive better sales. This is how she earns an income for her household. 

This is her first loan and her socio-economic analysis is positive and she is eligible to access a loan.

loans.use: To purchase articles of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair his house to live comfortably.

loans.name: Munnawar

texts.en:
Munnawar lives in Kasur, which is known for its tanneries. She has been living there in a two-room brick house in the area of Sheikh bhago for the past 20 years with her family. 

She has given birth to seven children: four sons and three daughters. None of them is able to get an education due to the poor financial conditions of their parents. Her two elder sons have a business of selling scrap while the others stay at home. 

Her husband’s name is M. S. and he deals in scrap as well as being involved in an animal-sales business. He buys animals in their early age and sells to butchers after raising them up. 

Munnawar herself is a housewife, preferring to stay at home and do her household works, but in her spare time, she also supports her husband by taking care of his animals. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s animal-sales business. With the loan, he will buy animals (goats) and increase his sales. He has 15 years of experience in his business and Munnawar is hopeful that an investment will bring even more profits to him. 

She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and she is confident that it will bring good financial changes to her husband’s business.

loans.use: To buy animals (goats) for an animal-sales business

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.es:
Bernardita C. F., está casado tiene 63 años de edad y vive con su esposo. Ella pretende comprar unos insumos para la mejora de su finca de café. Ella cuenta con el terreno ya sembrado de café y lo que quiere es mejorar su próxima cosecha y dar un mayor rendimiento en la producción, con estos productos lo que ella ara es mejorar la acidez del suelo de su finca para que la tierra vuelva a dar su mejor rendimiento en esta próxima producción. Ella pretende crecer como caficultora de la zona y generar más ingresos para su bienestar y la de su esposo y a su vez tener su futuro un poco más seguro.
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Bernardita C. F. is married and 63 years old. She lives with her husband. She intends on buying some materials to improve her coffee farm. She has land that has already been planted with coffee and she wants to improve her next crop and have a larger harvest. With these products she improves the soil acidity in her farm so that the soil will yield more in the next harvest. She intends on growing as a coffee grower in the area and make more income for her own wellbeing and her husband's, and also to have a future that's a little more secure. 

This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR. She hadn't had any loans from state banks beofre, but FUDECOSUR has offered her the loan on better terms and much lower interest.

loans.use: To buy calcium carbonate for coffee crop

loans.name: Pean

texts.en:
Pean T. is married and resides with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. T. sells souvenirs at the temples, earning an income of USD 10 per day. Her husband uses his horse for the tourists to ride, earning an income of USD 7 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 37 on food and USD 100 on the other necessary expenses. 

T. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a camera to take photos of the tourists and to build public sanitation for the tourists. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a camera and to build public sanitation.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena tiene 54 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Fidel de 58, quien es agricultor, y de sus 3 hijos menores que le ayudan en el trabajo diario. Bajo el cielo azul de las serranías peruanas, esta trabajadora mujer empieza cada día con su faena agrícola, se despierta con los primeros rayos de sol, y se dirige a sus campos para cuidarlos y brindarles mantenimiento. Ella siembra papa, arvejas y habas junto a su esposo, Luego de meses de esfuerzo, ven recompensada su labor cuando venden toda su producción cosechada a los diversos mayoristas de la zona, quienes llevan estos productos a la ciudad. Dice que el trabajo en el campo no es tan complicado ya que todos los miembros de su familia trabajan en conjunto para salir adelante. Como es una dama muy emprendedora en adelante tiene pensado aumentar su siembra de arvejas, ya que el precio de esta legumbre se mantiene estable en el mercado. Es el quinto crédito con MFP y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando sin dificultad, además manifiesta su satisfacción de trabajar con todos los integrantes de su banco comunal pues son muy puntuales en el pago de sus cuotas, además de solidarios en las reuniones. Elena tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de semillas de arvejas y papa de buena calidad, además de guano y fertilizantes, de esta manera asegura la próxima siembra que sea de provecho.
texts.en:
Elena is 54 years old and lives in a home of her own along with her husband, 58 year old Fidel, and three children.  Fidel is a farmer and her children help with the daily chores.  Under the blue skies of the serene landscape, this hard working woman begins each day with her farming chores.  She gets up with the sunrise and goes out to care for and maintain her fields.  She and her husband raise potatoes, peas, and beans.  They are rewarded after months of work, when they harvest their crops and sell their entire harvest to different wholesalers in the zone.  The wholesalers take the products to the city.  She says that the work in the fields is not very complex because the entire family works together to get ahead.

Since she is an enterprising woman, she is considering increasing her crop of peas in the future, because its price is stable in the market.  This will be her fifth loan through MFP and she is very grateful to all those who helped make this loan possible.  It will allow her to continue working without difficulty.

She also says that she is very happy to work with the other members of her communal bank because they make their payments on time and they have a good relationship between one another.

She will use the money from this loan to buy good quality pea and potato seed, as well as guano and other fertilizers.  This will ensure that the next crop will be successful.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Plamerdi Plus Group

texts.en:
Jean Claude, aged 49, is the president of the community bank “Plamerdi Plus” which is composed of 14 members united in solidarity to receive loans from HOPE DRC, a Kiva field partner, with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Jean Claude is married and the father of two children who attend school. He runs a cellphone booth and is a money changer. He has been in business since 2000. He manages his cellphone booth in his area located east of the DRC's capital Kinshasa.  Each week, he says his business brings in a profit of $70.

Jean Claude is a loyal client of IMF HOPE RDC who has already received nine different loans and has repaid them properly.  He intends to use the proceeds of this loan to buy more prepaid phone cards to resell with the aim of increasing his profits.  His ambition is to have his own significant capital.

loans.use: to purchase more prepaid phone cards to resell

loans.name: Samphoirs

texts.en:
Mrs. Samphoirs O. (pictured with her loom) is a widow with one daughter. She lives with her aunt on an island of Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Her daughter is in grade eleven. 

Samphoirs is a silk weaver. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. She is asking for a loan of $300 to purchase silk materials for her silk weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her silk weaving business.

loans.name: Ruby Pearl

texts.en:
Ruby Pearl is 47 years old and married with two young children. The oldest child is 8 years old.

Ruby Pearl is into the hog-raising business. She is currently renting a space for her piggery. She hopes to have her own piggery so that she can save rent expenses.

Ruby Pearl's loan will be used to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies. She hopes to improve her business and income. She also hopes to have enough money for the coming enrollment.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies

loans.name: Silvia Marcela

texts.es:
La señora Silvia Marcela de la ciudad de Managua es una persona trabajadora, para darle un mejor nivel de vida a su familia y así salir adelante para el futuro de sus hijos y que sean profesionales y ser unos excelentes trabajadores.
En esta oficina de Ceprodel se presentó la señora anteriormente mencionadaa solicitar crédito para mejorar su vivienda que se encuentra en mal estado, este crédito lo invertirá en compra de materialesde construccióncomo arena, cemento, bloques, hierro, piedrín y pagar mano de obra una parte y la otra en cancelar deudas pendiente, para levantar pared.
texts.en:
Silvia Marcela is from the city of Managua.  She works hard so that she can give her family a better standard of living.  She also works hard so that in the future her children will get ahead, become professionals, and be excellent workers.

She came to the Ceprodel office to request a loan in order to improve her home, which is in bad condition.  She will use part of this loan to buy construction materials like sand, cement, blocks, iron, gravel, and to pay for the labor to put up a wall.  She will use the other part to pay outstanding debts.

loans.use: to pay off consolidated loans and to improve her house.

loans.name: Sheku A.'s Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the Charity Commercial Primary School Gorahun, in Kenema city. This school was founded in 2004, by a charitable Islamic Organization, to improve education in the community. Teachers of the Charity Commercial Primary School Gorahun have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, to seek a loan. 

This is the first loan that teachers of the Charity Commercial Primary School Gorahun have requested from SMT/Kiva lenders. They have requested for a loan of SLL 5,200,000.00 for the entire group. With the help of this loan, these teachers are in a better position to buy or invest in something that their mere salary can not let them accomplish.

Sheku is the leader of the group. Sheku is age fifty. He was born in a place call Padembu. Sheku is married and has three children. He has been in the teaching profession for thirty-one years now. He has requested for this loan in order to buy house building materials like iron corrugated zincs and bags of cement.

(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of Massah, a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo).

loans.use: to buy house building materials like iron, corrugated zincs and bags of cement.

loans.name: Karen Lisbeth

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La Paz en la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida desde tiempos coloniales como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos, cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal 5 De Septiembre.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Karen, tiene 22 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, uno de de 1 año y un bebe de 8 meses. El marido es comerciante. Ella estudia en segundo semestre de secretariado ejecutivo en la Universidad Técnica De Manabí.

Ella es una joven madre que para ayudar a su marido en los gastos del hogar dedica a la venta de ropa  por catálogo de algunas marcas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y trabaja todos los días en los momentos que está desocupada, ella aprovecha las noches ya que allí les vende a sus compañeras en la universidad, trabaja a base de pedidos, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, nos cuenta que le encanta vender. Su mercadería la recibe en distribuidoras en el centro de la ciudad. Lleva tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace  9 ciclos y nos cuenta que los créditos le han sacado de muchos apuros por eso le agrada la institución. 

Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y tener su propia empresa.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the '5 de Septiembre' community bank meet in La Paz neighborhood, in the city of Portoviejo.  This city has been known since colonial times as 'The City of the Royal Tamarind Trees'.

Here we meet 22 year-old Karen who lives with her common-law husband and has two children aged 1 year and 8 months.  Her husband is a salesman.  Karen is studying her second semester of an executive secretarial course at the Universidad Técnica de Manabí.

Karen is a young mother who sells brand clothing through catalogs in order to help her husband with their household expenses.  She makes her sales door to door and works every day whenever she has free time.  She makes the most of the evenings when she sells to her fellow university students.  Karen works to order, leaves her products on credit and collects payment every week.  She tells us that she loves selling.  She receives her merchandise from distributors in the city center.

Karen has been in this business for three years and she has done very well.  She will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothes.  She has been a member of her community bank for nine loan cycles and tells us that her loans have got her out of many tight spots.  For this reason, she is grateful to the institution.  Her dreams are to finish her studies and own her own business.

loans.use: to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses and children's clothes

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en: Khorn is making doormats to sell. Her husband is working in a hotel as a cleaner. Their income is $5 per day. There is only one child staying in her family. He is working in the hotel with his father. Every month, she has to spend $20 on food, $15 on transportation, and $40 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy more fabrics to make doormats. This loan may help her family to continue her career and make more income if she can make the doormats faster every day.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics to make doormats

loans.name: Mahougnon Group

texts.fr: MAHOUGNON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin et sont des parentés. La représentante du groupe, Mahoumè Elisabeth (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 35 ans et vit au Bénin. Mahoumè Elisabeth ne vit plus avec son mari. Mahoumè Elisabeth a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont à sa charge. Grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité, Mahoumè Elisabeth assure sans grande difficulté les différents besoins de ses enfants. Mahoumè Elisabeth a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Mahoumè Elisabeth vend en effet de l'huile à moteur importé et des produits divers à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Mahoumè Elisabeth vend des "pâtés" (faits à base de la farine de blé). Mahoumè Elisabeth s'approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin et exerce cette activité depuis une dizaine d'année. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Mahoumè Elisabeth sollicite un deuxième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOUGNON. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: Mahougnon is a group of three individuals who live in the same neighborhood in Benin and are related to each other. The group’s representative, Mahoumè Elisabeth (raising her hand in the photo) is 35 years and lives in Benin. Mahoumè Elisabeth is separated from her husband. She has three children, all in school, two of whom are in her care. Thanks to the income from her business activity, Mahoumè Elisabeth manages to provide for her children. She did not finish high school. She sells imported motor oil and miscellaneous items out of her home. As a secondary activity, she sells “pâtes”  from wheat flour [wheat-meal mush, a staple food]. Mahoumè Elisabeth stocks up in one of the Benin towns. She has been in this business for about a dozen years. With the goal of meeting customer demand, Mahoumè Elisabeth is seeking a second loan, together with other members of the Mahougnon group. This loan will allow the group members to better meet customer demand and to increase their revenues.

loans.use: to buy jugs of motor oil and miscellaneous items for resale

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora is 28 years old. She has five children. Three of her children are in school. She is a married woman. Flora sells groundnuts. She has been in this business for one year. She took a loan from BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business. She says that she will use the profits from her business to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more groundnuts to sell

loans.name: Las Gaviotas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS GAVIOTAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Santiago II, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Teresa. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de chocolate, comercio de ropa, venta de comida, tienda de barrio, venta de papas, venta de gelatina, salon de belleza

La señora Teresa, indica que este es el primer ciclo que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de amigas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de chocolate, que viene trabajando hace dos años atrás, aprendiendo este oficio de su esposo.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de herramientas para la elaboración de chocolates (moldes y chocolate) que comprara de la distribuidora de la Ceja y lo comercializará en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The "Las Gaviotas" communal bank is starting its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II Center. It is made up of nine members and is governed by a board of directors headed by Mrs. Teresa. The communal bank's members' businesses are varied and include: chocolate sales, clothing sales, food sales, a corner store, potato sales, Jell-O sales, and a beauty salon.

Mrs. Teresa says that this is the first cycle that she has worked with Pro Mujer, and she joined at the invitation of friends. She currently has a business selling chocolate, which she has done for two years. She learned this work from her husband.

The loan that she is now taking out is for the purchase of tools for making chocolates (molds and chocolate) from the distributor in Ceja. She will sell her products in the markets. This work allows her to generate an income to support her family where possible. She lives with her common-law husband.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the health services.

loans.use: to purchase molds and chocolates.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es:
Salvador, es agricultor, su actividad del día a día es realizar y cuidar los cultivos de maíz y frijol, él es viudo, vive con sus nietos de 9, 10 y 14 años, Salvador tiene muchos años de dedicarse al cultivo de maíz, pues inicio desde muy joven, sus labores inician de 7:00am hasta las 3:00pm.
Actualmente necesita comprar abono y herbicidas, para tratar el cultivo, esta compra le ayudara para mejorar su agricultura, protegiendo el maíz de cualquier plaga, garantizándose una buena producción.
El objetivo de Salvador, en la actualidad es que su siembra sea provechosa y que sus nietos puedan sentirse apoyados y que en el futuro puedan terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Salvador is a farmer.  His daily work consists of growing and caring for his corn and bean crops.  He is a widower and lives with his grandchildren who are 9, 10 and 14 years old.  Salvador has been growing corn for many years as he started out when he was very young.  He works from 7.00am to 3.00pm.

Salvador currently needs to buy manure and herbicides for his crops.  This purchase will help him to improve his farming, protecting his corn from pests and guaranteeing a good production.

Salvador's current goals are for his crops to be profitable, for his grandchildren to feel supported and for them to be able to finish their education in the future.

loans.use: to buy manure and herbicides

loans.name: Las Hongueras Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Las Hongueras, está conformado por la señora Rosario va a comprar con su crédito fertilizantes y abono para cultivar hongos, la señora Janet va a comprar blusas, pantalones, camisas, faldas, la señora Sandra Luz va a comprar palas, clavos, tornillos, carretillas, la señora Erika va a comprar pollo por mayoreo para vender por kilo o entero. La señora Rosario tiene 59 años de edad, ella es casada tiene 5 hijos ya casados, ella produce hongos setas, ella solicito su préstamo para su proyecto de hongos setas para aumentar su producción, ella va a comprar semilla y abono para su producción de hongos y aumentar su negocio. Ella inicio su negocio hace 18 años, su hijo que es ingeniero la asesora como producir el hongos setas, su negocio es importante porque tiene su propio trabajo donde su familia participa en la produccion de los hongos setas sus hijos y su esposo los producen y a ella como le gustan las ventas participa en la mercadotecnea buscando mercado donde colocar su producción de hongos en los puestos de verduras de plazas, mercados, tianguis, en los puestos de dobladas. Las ganancias las utiliza para la comida, usos personal y para seguir invirtiendo, sus sueños y esperanzas son que su producción sea grande y poner una procesadora de hongos enlatados, que no les falte el trabajo y poder sustentar los gastos que se requieran para el negocio. Las integrantes del grupo les agradecen a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad sus préstamos que son muy buenos y les ayudan a crecer sus negocios.
texts.en:
The name of this communal bank is Las Hongueras.  The group is comprised of:

Rosario will use the loan to buy natural and chemical fertilizers to cultivate mushrooms.

Janet will buy blouses, shirts, and skirts.

Sandra Luz will buy shovels, nails, screws, and wheelbarrows.

Erika will buy chicken wholesale in order to sell whole or by the kilo.

Rosario, age 59, is married and has five children who are already married.  She produces mushrooms.  She is requesting her loan for her mushroom business in order to increase her production.  She will buy seeds and fertilizer for her mushroom production and increase her business.

She started her business 18 years ago.  Her son, an engineer, advises her about how to produce mushrooms.  Her business is important because she has her own work where her family participates in the mushroom production.  Her children and her husband cultivate them.

She likes the sales and marketing.  She looks for the market where she can place her mushrooms in the vegetable stands in plazas, markets, street markets, and take out stands.  She uses the income for food, personal use, and to continue investing.  Her hopes and dreams are that her production expands, that she sets up a canned mushroom processor, that she does not lack work, and that she is able to cover the expenses that are needed for her business.

The members of the group are grateful to Kiva and the Fundación Realidad.  Their loans are very good, and they help their businesses grow.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for mushroom production.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a 32-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are in the school. She has a business selling alcohol (beer) in the town of Hai Mahad, Yei county, South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years. 
Betty requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase more beer for sale. She says that the extra income will help her to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more beer for sale.

loans.name: Irania Maria

texts.es: Irania Maria tiene dos créditos con Fundación, ella tiene 39 años es casada y junto a su pareja tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario lo inicio en su vivienda, Irania cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos que siempre la han apoyado y su esposo que también obtiene otros ingresos  trabajando fuertemente. Ella solicito el crédito para la compra de carnes, refrescos, granos básicos, detergentes, sopas, enlatados entre otros. Ella está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Irania Maria has had two loans with Fundación. She is 39 years old and married, and along with her partner she has three underage children in her care. She sells goods for daily consumption, a business she started from home. She gets help from her children, who have always supported her, and from her husband who also earns an income from another source by working very hard. She requested the loan to purchase meat, beverages, basic grains, detergent, soup, canned goods, etc. She is happy to get the loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to purchase meat, beverages, basic grains, detergent, soup, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Isroil

texts.ru: Исроил проживает в районе Дангара. Ему 54 года. Он вдовец. У него 10 детей. Его сыновья работают, дочки живут отдельно, а двое младших его детей учатся в средней школе. Сам он занимается изготовлением деревянных окон и дверей. В этой области он 25 лет. Кредит берет для покупки сырья, чтобы производит новые виды окон и дверей для продажи.
texts.en: Isroil lives in the region of Dangara. He is 54 years old. He is a widower and has ten children. His sons work, his daughters live separately and two younger children go to school. He makes wooden doors and windows. He has been in this business for 25 years. Isroil is taking out the loan to buy raw materials to make new kinds of windows and doors for sale.

loans.use: to buy slates and CPD.

loans.name: Ebenezer Group

texts.en:
Redemta, who is in her early 30s, is married with one child who goes to school.  She has been running a fruit business for one and a half years.  She works from 9 a.m to 8 p.m daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy more fruit and to take of her child. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to buy more fruit and to start selling chips. Her dream is to one day be able to own a grocery.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Ebenezer" which has a total of 18 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and to start selling chips.

loans.name: Khemisa

texts.en:
Khemisa is a 28-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has four children between the ages of 11 and 4.  One of them goes to school. 

Khemisa runs a food store business and has been in the business for six years. She has no employees. Khemisa heard about Finance Sudan through fellow clients. She is taking a loan of 500 SDG to purchase more food items like food spices, onions, and tomatoes. Besides this business, Khemisa has no other source of income. 

In five years time, Khemisa would like to expand her business size and to have a good store to sell her food. 

Her major challenges include home expenses and competitors in the market, which leads to a low income rate.   

Khemisa says that she is happy for Finance Sudan’s support in South Sudan for helping women who have low capital for business.

loans.use: to purchase food spices, onions, and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
50-year-old Khursheed lives with her 2 sons. Both of them work to financially contribute to the family. Her elder son is a driver by profession and drives a rickshaw. He facilitates his passengers' travel with his driving services. Her youngest son provides his loading services as a loader. He drives a donkey cart and delivers goods such as construction supplies (cement, bricks, etc.) to designated places.

She herself is a housewife and manages her household responsibilities by staying at home. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her youngest son who wants to buy a new donkey cart for his business because his current cart has rotted in different areas and doesn’t allow him to load heavy items on it.  By purchasing a new cart, he will be able to provide better quality loading services to his customers and increase his profits.

Khursheed is confident that after the loan investment, his business will become more profitable.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called an Asasah Passbook) is Khursheed.

loans.use: to buy a new donkey cart for loading business

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en: Narantsetseg is 40 years old and lives with her husband and two sons, who are 18 and 20 years old, in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital. Her family lives in a ger (or traditional nomadic tent) in the city's outer districts. Her husband works as a guard in a local shop. She supports her family by running a shop that sells books and magazines in the town's largest indoor market. When she first began her business in 2003, she had 2,000,000 tugriks (MNT) in working capital. Now she has 5,500,000 MNT and sells pre-paid phone cards as well as books, magazines and newspapers. Narantsetseg is applying for a loan for 2,000,000 MNT to buy more items to sell to her customers. Her goal for next year is to improve her business by expanding her stall and increasing her working capital. This will help her attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in a book store.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is married with 12 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Margarita is 59 years old and has 3 children in school.

Margarita has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  Margarita requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF, to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Margarita has been in this business for 40 years.  In the future, Margarita would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Asenath

texts.en:
Asenath is a 50-year-old married woman with five children. She has operated a shoe-selling business in Bondo town, in western Kenya, for 23 years, earning a monthly income of KES 18,000. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd of KES 10,000, which she will use to buy more stocks of shoes and school bags to sell. 

She will use the anticipated profits to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of shoes and school bags.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is now 26 years old. He used his previous loan well and the business has grown with a good income of about 15,000 KES in a month.

This will be Edwin’s second loan with KADET Ltd. He plans to use the entire loan to purchase more stock for sale. With the profit that he will get he wants to expand his curio shop. 

In the future, he wants to be able to invest more in other business ventures.

loans.use: To buy handicrafts for sale.

loans.name: Kathya Lisset

texts.es:
Kathya es una mujer de 22 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus padres y su pequeño hijo de 1 año, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, lamentablemente por diversas razones se separó de su pareja, desde entonces ella dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su pequeño, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, lamentablemente no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería que tanto deseaba, pero sueña con poder hacerlo algún día, en sus ratos libres le gusta hacer deporte y en algunas ocasiones cocina un delicioso Ají de Gallina para compartir con su familia.

Con mucho empeño, entusiasmo y gracias al apoyo de su madre, Kathya puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes y productos de belleza, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por la variedad de productos y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.

Kathya se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra mercadería para su negocio, tales como: arroz, azúcar, leche, gaseosas, golosinas, entre otro y productos de belleza, como: maquillaje, perfumes, lociones, etc.; de esta manera Kathya tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido, con ello espera poder aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos , los cuales le servirán de mucho para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda ampliar su negocio y tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Kathya is a 22-year-old woman. She lives in the city of Pisco with her parents and her small ((???)) year-old son, whom she loves and who is her principal cause in life. 

Regrettably, for various reasons, she separated from her partner, and since then she has dedicated all her effort to moving her son forward. She is a very nice, hard-working and enthusiastic person. Regrettably, she has not been able to study the nursing career that she so longed to pursue, but she dreams of being able to do so one day. 

In her free time she likes to do sports and on some occasions she cooks a delicious Ají de Gallina (Peruvian chicken stew) to share with her family.

With determination, enthusiasm, and thanks to the support of her mother, Kathya started her small business selling groceries and beauty products. Every day she begins working in the early morning hours. She can work approximately 12 hours per day and she believes it is going well for her due to her variety of products and the friendly treatment she offers her clients.

Kathya is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they offer she will be able to purchase merchandise for her business such as rice, sugar, milk, sodas, candy, and more as well as beauty products such as makeup, perfumes, lotions, etc. Thus Kathya's business will be better-stocked, and with this she hopes to be able to increase her sales and increase her income, which will help her greatly so that in the near future she can grow her business and have her own house.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and beauty products

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 42 years old and married with one children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a selling cultured pearl in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of pearl to sell.

Perlita has borrowed and paid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the selling cultured pearl for 6 years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Perlita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of pearl to sell

loans.name: Khoirul

texts.en:
Khoirul is daughter of client Komida, she lives with her family in Kalitidu East Java of Indonesia. She is a student at Vocational High School 1 Bojonegoro. She is described to be diligent and smart. 

Her parent works hard to cover their daily needs and pay for her education costs. She has the financial problem that her parent did not pay her semester fees. She can not focus on her studies. 

That is why she requested a loan to pay semester fees. She say thanks to micro credit; thus she can continues her study and reach her goal to be a success and increase their quality of life.

loans.use: to pay semester fees

loans.name: Nia Njema Group

texts.en:
Rehema, who is in her mid 30's is married with four schooling children. She has been selling charcoal for 5 years now. She works from 6 am to 6 pm daily and she's able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 1stloan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to restock the out of stock sacks of charcoal at her store. She dreams of transforming her business into retail and whole selling store.

Rehema will share this loan with her loan group NIA NJEMA, which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock sacks of charcoal at her store

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia has been selling various types of products for 18 years; she has been selling cosmetics for 5 years. Her husband has always supported her so that she would be able to work and earn income. She goes out to sell and collect payments from Thursday through Sunday. She carries a register of her sales; each client must pay at least 50% of the purchase up front. This income has been helpful for the household. Sonia needs the loan to be able to buy her products, since she has to pay for them in cash.

Sonia was born in Cañar. She came to Guayaquil with parents and siblings when she was 10 years old. She and her siblings had to work from a very young age. Her first job was to take of children. She now has 3 children of her own. Her husband works in a furniture factory. They are a very close family and work hard to combine their efforts for the wellbeing of the whole family. Sonia owns her own home; little by little she is reinforcing it with cement. Her dream is to have a store in her house someday.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Sonia tiene 18 años vendiendo todo tipo de artículos, con la venta de cosméticos 5 años, su esposo siempre la ha apoyado para que trabaje y tenga sus ingresos. Ella sale a vender y a cobrar a partir del jueves hasta el domingo. Lleva un registro en sus ventas, todo cliente debe de dar una entrada del 50% del producto. Estos ingresos han sido de ayuda para el hogar. Ella necesita el préstamo para poder comprar sus productos ya que debe sacarlos al contado y no admiten crédito. Sonia nació en Cañar. Vino a Guayaquil con sus padres y hermanos a la edad de 10 años, desde muy pequeña junto a sus hermanos tuvo que trabajar. Su primer trabajo fue para cuidar niños. Tiene 3 hijos. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica de elaboración de muebles. Ellos son una familia muy unida tratan en lo posible de unir los esfuerzos para bienestar de toda la familia. Ellos tienen casa propia y poco a poco la están levantando de cemento. Su sueño es poner un local en su casa más adelante.

loans.use: Buy cosmetics and perfume

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Mr. Angel M. has been running his business for 1 year. “My business is that of second-hand clothing sales. I would like to buy more clothing for the Spring-Summer season, but I have not been able to for lack of funds.” I am asking for $1,000.00 to purchase clothing.
Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Angel M. tiene su negocio desde hace 1 año. “Mi negocio es de venta de Segunda (ropa usada), he querido comprar más ropa para la temporada de Primavera – Verano pero no he logrado por falta de recursos económicos”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para la compra de ropa.

loans.use:
To purchase clothing for my inventory.
Comprar ropa para mi negocio.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a mother of three children. In order to contribute to her family income she sells men’s clothing in her neighborhood. She started in this line of work about 5 years ago with the help of her mother, who provided the start up capital. Rosa feels that her work is very important because her husband does not have much job security. He is often hired as a skilled worker in factories but his jobs are never stable and he is always at risk of being unemployed.

Rosa did very well with her first loan which she received over the Christmas season. With the extra profit she made from that season she was able to pay back her loan while also making considerable reinvestments into her business. She continues to sell clothing on foot. She has made some small improvements to her home in order to progress towards her goal of making a shop, but she admits she has a ways to go. She hopes she can continue to save and make changes slowly so she can achieve her goal. She is seeking a second loan so she can continue to increase her product line while buying in bulk.

loans.use: Increase her inventory

loans.name: Khasay

texts.en: Khasay S. is a 42-year-old farmer who lives in the southern part of Azerbaijan, in Bilasuvar region.  Khasay was internally displaced person from the Jabrail region during the Azerbaijan-Armenian conflict. Khasay started his business in 1998, when he was first loaned monies from Aqroinvest and purchased one calf which brought him good income.  He has repaid previous loans in time and in full. His cow is old and does not give enough milk now. With the loan he plans to purchase a new cow and two calves. The estimated cost for the cow is 700-800 USD and for the calves is 200-400 USD and he is therefore requesting a loan of 1,200 USD.

loans.use: To purchase one cow for 700 USD and two calves each for 250 USD

loans.name: Judite Joao

texts.pt:
Judite is the single mother of 8 children. She joined the credit program this year, and she is now in the second cycle. With this loan she plans on buying more charcoal in order to keep up with the demand which is growing. Her business is doing well, and she doesn't have as many problems as she had before providing for her children. In the future she plans on building an improved house.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Judite tem oito filhos e mae solteira.Ela vive sozinha com os seus filhos. Esta no segundo ciclo. Ela entrou para o programa ainda neste ano.Com o dinheiro do emprestimo ela quer aumentar o numero de sacos de carvao para poder satisfazer a todos os seus clientes, pois que a procura esta aumentando.O seu negocio esta a prosperar. Ja nao sente tantos apertos como sentia anteriormente para poder sustentar os seus filhos. Se tudo continuar a correr bem ela pretende no futuro construir uma casa melhorada.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is very creative woman.   At the age of 45 years old, she is a widow with 2 children and 3 adopted children and is engaged in subsistence faming.  With her last loan, Hawa started a very creative business of purchasing vegetables from the small farmers and supplying them to expatriates engaged in the construction of the electricity dam in Tonkolili district and other towns of Sierra Leone.  She also purchases peanuts, rice, corn, and millet and sells them as seeds.  Hawa would like to expand her agro-business stock so she would be the main seed supplier.  She has orders for the various seeds from development organizations and is therefore requesting $1200 for the purpose of buying seed stock.

loans.use: Purchase additional seeds to sell and become the main seed supplier in her area.

loans.name: Saleem

texts.en: I am married and have seven children: five boys and two girls. I live with my family in Multan, Pakistan. I have my own small brick house here. I want to borrow $425 for my husband.  He is an electrician and runs a shop where he sells electrical appliances and supplies. With your loan he will purchase a few gas motors, water pumps, pipes, etc. This loan will help us to bring economic security to our family.

loans.use: Buy supplies for electric goods store

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en: Beauty A. is 51 years old, married, has eight children and hails from the town of Ajamgbadi in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is a cosmetologist who also sells supplies from her beauty parlor, and needs a loan of $450 to buy more equipment and products for her business.  She has been in business since 1988, and has been a LAPO client for the past three years.

loans.use: To buy supplies and equipment for a beauty parlor.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Since he was a boy, Manuel has loved animals. He has learned to raise them well so that he can market them. He's a native of the "municipio" of Villanueva in the city of Chinandega in the beautiful country of Nicaragua.

Manuel is married and has children to provide for, along with a grandson who is also in his care. To support his family, he has to invest in his livestock business and, consequently, he's approached Ceprodel to apply for a loan that will allow him to buy breeding stock and, in turn, increase his income from the milk, meat, horn, etc. that cattle provide. To date, Manuel has obtained 2 loans from Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Desde niño Manuel M. ha sido una persona amante de los animales, ha aprendido a criarlos muy bien para luego comercializarlos. Es originario del municipio Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega en el bello país de Nicaragua.

Es un varón casado y con hijos que mantener y además un nieto bajo su responsabilidad. Para poder mantener su familia, el único ingreso que percibe es el adquirido por medio de la ganader9ia a que se dedica es por esta razón que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con créditos que le permitan la compra de toros para reproducir sus crías y así obtener mejores ingresos propios por medio de la leche, carne, cuero y hasta la vaquilla por su misma. Su record es de 2 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: Buy stock for animal farming business.

loans.name: Ibrahim's Juhudi Group

texts.en:
Ibrahim, age 64, is married with 14 children. He runs a small general store and also has a garden where he grows vegetables which he sells at his shop. He started this business 10 years ago and currently makes about $40 a month from his sales. He works from 7am to 4pm daily.

In the past, he took four loans to expand his business and was able to pay these back successfully. With the loans, he purchased a plot of land and bought his garden. He also used the loan toward house expenses and school fees for his children. Ibrahim now hopes for a new loan to buy more stock for his shop and to use some of the money for building a new house.

Ibrahim will share this loan with his subgroup, whose members have businesses in clothing and general store sales.

In the picture, Ibrahim is in the red shirt.

loans.use: To buy inventory for his general store

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen is a stay at home mother and also dedicates herself to making weavings which she makes in her home every afternoon after preparing food for her family. This work is not easy and requires a lot of patience and creativity as well as a lot skill in dying and mixing colors. Her work has given the opportunity to offer her children a better education and she wishes to continue with this labor since her clients are pleased and have referred her throughout the city.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

CARMEN, madre de familia dedicada al cuidado de su casa y de sus hijos, pero de igual manera a la producción de telares que produce en el taller de su casa y en el que todas las tardes después de preparar los alimentos de su familia, se entrega completamente, este trabajo no es sencillo y requiere de mucha paciencia y creatividad, además de mucha habilidad para matizar y combinar los colores para el acabado final. Su desempeño le ha dado la posibilidad de ofrecer a sus hijos educación superior y desea continuar con esta labor ya que se ha incrementado la satisfacción de sus clientes y recomendaciones por toda su ciudad.

loans.use: Capital to increase production

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H., 37 years old, joined TYM Fund in 2002. Her first loan was 125USD, used to brew wine. After the first year, her profit was 60USD. Brewing wine brings her a steady income, yet not quite high. After two years spending the loan on brewing wine, Mrs. H. switched to sell pork. Her pork comes from two sources: from other household, and from her own farm. Her average monthly income is 150USD. Besides, her husband, Mr. Dinh Van Dieu, alo helps her with the repayments whenever she has difficulty, so she is able to continue to be a member of TYM Fund. After 5 years, Mrs. H. is able to buy a moped. THis time she would like to borrow 625USD to buy pork and sell it.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Hồng, 37 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2002. Vòng đầu tiên chị vay 125USD để nấu rượu. Sau năm đầu tiên chị lãi được 60USD. Việc nấu rượu mang lại thu nhập thường xuyên nhưng cũng không cao. Sau hai năm vay vốn đầu tư nấu rượu, chị Hồng chuyển sang đầu tư vào buôn bán thịt lợn. Ngoài mua việc mua thịt lợn từ các lò mổ, chị Hồng cũng chăn nuôi lợn để tăng thêm lượng hàng cung cấp. Thu nhập hàng tháng của chị Hồng khoảng 150USD. Bên cạnh đó chồng chị, anh Đinh Văn Điều, cũng tích cực hỗ trợ vợ trong việc hoàn trả mỗi khi chị gặp khó khăn nên việc tham gia Quỹ của chị Hồng hết sức thuận lợi. Sau 5 năm tham gia Quỹ, chị Hồng đã mua được xe máy giúp cho việc đi lại được thuận tiện hơn. Vòng vốn này chị tiếp tục đề nghị được vay 625USD để mua thịt lợn bán.

loans.use: Buy pork

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Mrs. Phal K., 53, and her husband, Mr. At Vorng, 49, who live on an Island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh were married in 1979 and have seven children,  one son and six daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home.  Four of her children are in local school and one weaves silk at home. 

Mrs. Phal has been a silk weaver for twenty five years, a skill she learned from her sister. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a farmer since 1979.
 
Phal has three looms in the family so she is requesting a loan of US$600 to purchase silk so that she can continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk for weaving.

loans.name: Anselma

texts.es:
For 4 years, Anselma has earned a living renting washing machines. A friend encouraged her to set up the business. She's been slowly adding washers and she now has 4 of them. She rents them to her neighbors by the hour. Her children help her move the washers to the houses of her customers. For 3 years, Anselma has also sold gas in cylinders from her house. Her neighbors know her now and she has a large set of customers. Her children help her to deliver the cylinders.

The loans that she's requested have been used to maintain her washing machines and to buy the fourth machine. Anselma would like to have a space in her house to store the gas cylinders that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Anselma se dedica al alquiler de lavadoras desde hace 4 años. Fue una amiga quien le animó a poner este negocio. Es así que fue comprando poco a poco estas máquinas y en la actualidad cuenta con 4 lavadoras. Ellas las alquila a sus vecinos por horas. Sus hijos la ayudan a trasladar las lavadoras a las casas de sus clientes. Asimismo, desde hace 3 años Anselma se dedica a la venta de balones de gas en su casa. Sus vecinos ya la conocen, por lo que tiene una vasta clientela. Sus hijos la ayudan repartiendo los balones a domicilio.

Los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido para el mantenimiento de las máquinas y para comprar la cuarta lavadora. Anselma quisiera tener un espacio amplio en su casa y guardar allí los balones de gas que ofrece.

loans.use: Buy and maintain washing machines for washer-rental business.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz baji*, a wife of M., has been living in Chichawatni, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children, one son and three daughters. Her eldest daughter and son are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Shahnaz baji is a housewife and prefers to do domestic chores. Her husband runs a grocery shop. 

Shahnaz baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy groceries (lentils,rice,sugar) for her grocery shop. Shahnaz baji wishes to diversify her grocery shop into a general store.

She is joined in her loan group by a four more members. Shazia baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart. Ghulam Fatima baji wants a loan to repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle). Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo to produce milk to sell. Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy more cloth to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

*"Baji," which literally means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy stock for grocery shop

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en:
Rashida baji is the wife of F. A. and lives in Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur is famous for its sweetmeat and decorative embroidery. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last ten years. She is the mother of five children: three sons and two daughters. Her youngest daughter is enrolled in a local neighborhood school. Rashida baji's husband is a milk seller by profession with ten years of experience in the business. Rashida baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work.

Rashida baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a second loan to buy another buffalo to expand their family milk business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo to expand their family milk business.

loans.name: Jamilett Del Carmen

texts.es: Es una madre soltera de dos hijos, la necesidad de salir adelante y tener una fuente de ingresos la llevó a aprender el oficio de costura en un taller de una vecina, cuando logró adquirir todos los conocimientos necesarios, con la ayuda de su mamá se compró una maquina sencilla para empezar su propio negocio, debido al carácter jovial y amable muy rápido se hizo de una buena clientela, la que le demandan sus productos. Adim le financió su segunda maquina, en la actualidad tiene 3 trabajadoras, además tiene más de 10 años de experiencia, y esto le permite ofrecer una gran variedad de productos tales como: Maxi, cotonas, trajes típicos etc. Tiene casa propia,  y necesita un crédito para reparar el techo de su vivienda y mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
She is a single mother of two children. The need to move forward and have a source of income pushed her to learn the craft of sewing in a workshop of a neighbor, where she managed to acquire all the necessary skills. With the help of her mom, she bought a simple machine to start her own business. Because of her jovial and friendly character, she rapidly developed a strong customer base that demands her products. Adim financed her second machine. She currently has 3 employees and more than 10 years of experience, and this allows her to offer a wide variety of products such as: maxi,cotton, typical dresses, and so on. She has her own home and needs a loan to repair the roof of her house to improve her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio tiene 40 años, no se casó, pero vive con su pareja, con ella tuvo 5 hijos que son la bendición para su hogar. Hace 10 años atrás llegó a vivir a la comunidad de Capachari, tuvo que empezar desde cero sembrando plátanos, que vende el kilo a 30 céntimos de sol, que le alcanzaba apenas para sus alimentos de primera necesidad. Entonces poco a poco está incrementando sus sembrío con frutos cítricos y ahora ultimo ha sembrado cacao. Antonio se va muy temprano a sus campos y trabaja ahí hasta que cierra la noche porque le es muy rentable cuando los vende por cantidad en la chacra. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo. Con este dinero va a comprar pesticidas, para controlar la gusanera del plátano.
texts.en:
Antonio is 40 years old. He is unmarried but lives with his domestic partner, with whom he has 5 children—his household blessings. Ten years ago, he came to live in the Capachari community. He had to start from scratch growing bananas, which he sells at 30 cents a kilogram. This was barely enough for the family’s basic food needs. He later started to increase his crops little by little, by growing citrus. He now grows cacao as well. Antonio heads for his crop fields very early in the morning, and works there until nightfall because it is very lucrative to sell his produce by bulk at the farm. This is the first time he requests a loan. With this money, he will purchase pesticides in order to have the banana pest insects under control.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pesticides for banana trees

loans.name: María Emilia

texts.es:
L. señora María Emilia tiene 80 años D. edad y vive en L. calle José D. L. Riva Agüero 267, distrito D. El Porvenir, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. L. Libertad, Perú.
Estudió el primer año D. educación primaria, pero no continuó estudiando por el bajo nivel económico. Se casó a los 20 años y tuvo tres hijos, pero uno falleció.
María trabaja comprando y vendiendo verdura, elL. compra toda clase D. verdura en Trujillo y L. venD. en L. sierra, aprovechando un carro que tiene una hija.
El primer crédito fue D. S/. 300 cancelado en 4 cuotas lo que invirtió en verduras.
Con este crédito D. S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, lo invertirá en verduras.
María Emilia sueña con tener una vida tranquiL. y una jubilación.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Emilia is 80 years old and lives in José D. L. Riva Agüero No. 267, district of El Porvenir, province of Trujillo, department of L. Libertad, Peru. She studied first graD., elementary, but did not continue her studies due to her low financial level. She married when she was 20 years old and had three children, but one passed away.

María works buying and selling vegetables, she buys all kinds of vegetables in Trujillo and sells them in the mountains, using her daughter's vehicle. The first loan of S/.300, repaid in 4 payments, was invested in vegetables. With this loan of S/.500, to be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy vegetables. María Emilia dreams of living a quiet life and a retirement plan.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of vegetables

loans.name: Erika Lissette

texts.es:
La Joven Erika Lissete Manzanares R. tiene la edad de 27 años, su estado civil es acompañada ella tiene 2 hijos de las edades de 7 años su hijo mayor y cursa el 2 grado de primaria y su hija de 3 años que recientemente no estudia, su compañero de vida labora como taxista, sus propósitos son de prosperar en su negocio para que este en un futuro pueda ampliarse mas en sus deseos esta predominar en su negocio a pesar de la competencia que existe y acumular a un sin numero de clientes y sus sueños son de proporcionarle a sus hijos una casa propia donde puedan vivir con las condiciones adecuadas y no sufran necesidades para el día de mañana.




Su actividad económica es el destace de cerdo, la ubicación de su negocio es en el reparto Rigoberto López Pérez capilla santa Ana ½ al sur, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 4 años, ella inicia este negocio por que en su familia ya existía este oficio ya que su tío fue el que se encargo para que aprendiera este oficio y a la edad de de 25 años decide independizarse y establecer su propio negocio y al principio no le resulto muy fácil por lo que tenia que realizarlo ella sola pero mas tarde consigue adaptarse a este negocio, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que realizaría las compras de mas cerdos ya que tiene que buscar donde le oferten de forma mas favorable para escoger a los cedos.
texts.en:
Erika Lissete Manzanares R. is 27 years old and in a relationship. She has 2 children: a son age 7 who is in grade 2 and a 3-year old daughter who does not attend school yet. Her partner is a taxi driver. Her goal is to have a successful business in order to expand it in the future. She wants to dominate in business despite stiff competition and have a large customer base. Her dream is to provide her children with their own home where they can have good living conditions and not lack for basic necessities in the future. She has been in business selling pork for 4 years in "Rigoberto López Pérez capilla santa Ana ½ al sur". She started the business as her family worked in this business which her uncle taught her. She decided to open her own business at the age of 25, which was not easy in the beginning as she had to do everything on her own but got used to it in time. The loan is for working capital so that she can buy more pork as she is looking for a less expensive supplier.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rosita

texts.es:
ROSITA U. DAVILA, pertenece al banco Comunal “Mujeres Solidarias” ubicado en el Jr. Cesar Calvo de Araujo Nº 946, en el Distrito de Calleria, tiene 51 años de edad, 02 hijos, su esposo es obrero.

El primer prestamo que recibio fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compro productos de belleza, como perfumes, colonias, cremas, talcos, lapiz labial, esmaltes, todo en poca cantidad, vendia de casa en casa, se levantaba muy temprano,a tendia a su esposo e hijos y se iba a trabajar, su rutina diaira, adquirio muchos clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, compró mas productos de belleza, pues ahora ella tiene catálogos, los clientes escogen lo que desean, hacen sus pedidos, algunos llaman para confirmar lo escogido, crecia ella y sus ventas.

Agradece mucho a Manuela Ramos, por confiar y hacer de ella una mujer con decisiones y empresaria.
texts.en:
Rosita U. Davila belongs to the community bank “Mujers Solidarias” (Women in Solidarity) located at Jr. Cesar Calvo de Araujo No. 946, in the District of Calleria. She is 51 years old, with two children. Her husband works as a manual laborer. The first loan that she received, for 300.00 Nuevos Soles, was used to buy beauty products like perfume, cologne, lotions, powders, lipstick, and nail polish. She bought small amounts of everything and went house-to-house selling her items. Her daily routine was to get up very early to take care of her husband and children and then go to work. She has a lot of clients With this loan of 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles she will buy more beauty products. Now she has catalogs and her clients choose what they would like, make their orders and sometimes they call to confirm what they have selected. She has grown along with her sales. She is very greateful to Manuela Ramos for trusting her and making her a businesswoman who makes decisions.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics and beauty products

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela A. R. recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya.

As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will visit members of her community who are sick with a variety of illness. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care. 

Pamela is 20 years old, unmarried, and has no children. She lives in the Nyalenda district of Kisumu. 

Pamela started a tailoring business in the Nyalenda district in 2007. Prior to that, she attended dressmaking training school from 2004 to 2006. She chose to start this business to enable herself to be independent and to earn an income. Pamela makes African attire and local church attire. She gets her materials from Busia, a town on the border of Uganda (about a 5 hour bus ride from Kisumu). 

Pamela has applied for her first loan of $275 USD from K-MET.  She will use the loan money to purchase tailoring materials in bulk from Busia. By buying in bulk instead of small amounts, this will reduce her travel time and save her money.

loans.use: To purchase dressmaking materials in bulk

loans.name: Teopista Namusisi Group

texts.en:
Teopista N. is 47 years of age. She is married with six children. She has a two-room house where she stays with her children. She does not have access to water or electricity. She has two meals a day and her greatest expense is tuition fees for her children.

Teopista N. has a vegetable kiosk and buys her products from a nearby market. She works seven days a week and receives about 20 customers a day. She has done this business for 10 years now and she has not tried any other business. The main challenge she gets while doing her business is that there are many people selling the same products as her, thus creating competition.

She has worked with Kiva's partner MCDT for four years now and has received 10 loans from MCDT so far. She chose to work with MCDT to access loans to increase her stock. She has worked with her group for four years and she will use this loan to increase her stock and also pay tuition for her children.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
La señora Eugenia V. M. tiene 59 años, vive en la Urb. El Cortijo del distrito de Trujillo,  provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella no estudió debido a que su padre no la quiso apoyar, tiene 06 hijos de los cuales ninguno depende económicamente  de ella. 
Eugenia se dedica a la venta de carne hace 25 años, inicio su negocio con una bodega durante 10 años, el mismo que abandono debido a que no le era muy rentable y opto por abrir un puesto de carne el cual le ha dado muchas ganancias las que utiliza para comprar las medicinas que necesita para su enfermedad. Así mismo se dedica a la venta de ropa en la sierra liberteña dos veces al año, su negocio se desarrolla en el mercado El Cortijo. 
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Nuevo Perú”, lo invirtió en aumentar su capital de venta de carne.
Con el crédito de 1800 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de carne y ropa para vender en la sierra.
Eugenia tiene el gran sueño de comprar su casa y seguir viajando con su negocio por la sierra liberteña.
texts.en:
Eugenia V. M. is 59 years old and lives in El Cortijo, in the district of Trujillo, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru. She did not study because her father did not want to pay to send her to school. She has six children, none of whom depend depend on her financially. Eugenia has had a butcher shop for 25 years. She started in business with a small store for 10 years but abandoned this line of work as not being very profitable and decided to open a butcher stall which has given her a good income which she uses to pay for the medecines she needs for her illness. Twice a year she travels to the Sierra Liberteña to sell clothing. Her business is located in the El Cortijo market. She received her first loan for 300 soles from her community bank “Nuevo Perú” and used it as capital for her butcher shop. She will use this loan for 1,800 soles to be repaid in six months, to buy meat and clothing to sell in the mountains. Eugenia's greatest dream is to buy a home of her own and continue travelling for business to the Sierra Liberteña.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy  meat wholesale.  To buy clothing.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is a native of Tolon, Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte. Her husband is a carpenter earning Php 200 a day, but sometimes carpentry work is not available. That's why, aside from being a carpenter, he also does odd jobs just to get additional income for living. The couple is blessed with two children. Both are still in elementary school.

Felicidad is already on her second loan cycle amounting to Php 5,000.00. The proceeds of this loan are for the purchase of additional ingredients for her snack-vending business, such as "Banana Que," "Maroya," Toron and many others.

She is expecting a 20% mark-up on cost for her small business. She is hoping that in the near future she can open a "Sari-Sari" store (mini grocery) and wishes that her children can finish their college studies and have an income of their own.

loans.use: For the purchase of ingredients for her snack-vending business

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: La señora  ELVIRA C. y su esposo Félix Churqui, tienen cuatro pequeños hijos a quienes educan con su trabajo, mucha dedicación y cariño. Ellos viven en su domicilio de la calle: Chocalla # 2674  en la zona Huayna Potosí, en la populosa ciudad de El Alto de La Paz. La señora Elvira se dedica a la venta de ropa en la feria 16 de julio no tiene  puesto fijo, es ambulante ella se acomoda al lugar que puede. La pareja actualmente viven en la casa de la madre del esposo, su mayor deseo es tener su casa propia en un futuro. La señora es nueva en la institución este es su primer crédito, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de una maquina de coser para confeccionar sus propias prendas de vestir para la venta, su esposo es chofer asalariado y esta en el sindicato litoral trabaja todos los días para colaborar a su familia, ellos comparten los gastos de la familia. El mayor deseo de ellos es poder darles a su hijo una buena educación para que en un futuro sean personas de bien y responsables.
texts.en:
Elvira C. and her husband Félix Churqui have four small children whom they raise with dedication and care. They live in the Huayna Potosí zone in the populous city of El Alto de La Paz.

Elvira sells clothing at the 16 de julio market. She doesn't have a permanent stand and hawks her products wherever she finds space. The couple currently lives in her husband's mother's house. She hopes to own her own home in her future.

Elvira is new to the organization and this is her first loan. The loan will be used to purchase a sewing machine so she can both make and sell garments.

Her husband is a salaried driver and a union member. He works everyday to earn money for his family. Elvira and her husband share the household expenses. Their biggest desire is to give their children a good education so that they can become good and responsible people.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Mr. Rogelio T., 45 years old, is married and lives at Calube, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. He is blessed with only one child. His primary source of income comes from a "sari-sari" (general) store. He has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative since June 1999. He has taken out 23 loans already. Pepe has proved his worth, being a Member in Good Standing of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative.

Rogelio said, he is thankful for the cooperative because of the financial assistance given to his family. Today, he is applying for PHP 40,000 to buy additional goods for his sari-sari store business. He hopes for a bountiful life ahead. He also dreams of expanding his “sari-sari” store into a General Merchandise store someday.

loans.use: to buy additional goods for "sari-sari" (general) store

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es: Josefina tiene 55 años,  vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Junto a su esposo, se dedica a la fabricación artesanal de chupetes (a base de hielo) y helados (de crema), actividad que realiza desde hace 6 años. La idea surgió del consumo de sus propios hijos, y al contar con una refrigeradora dejó de hacerlo sólo para su familia y empezó a elaborar en mayor cantidad para emprender este negocio. Todas las tardes elabora los chupetes que deja congelando hasta el día siguiente, con el tiempo se ha implementado de diversos moldes y otra nevera, así como gran cantidad de barquillos para los helados, los cuales prepara hasta las 11 de la mañana, y luego sale a repartir sus productos a las escuelas cercanas a su casa. También cuenta con algunas personas que le ayudan a vender, a quienes les paga por ello. La época más rentable es durantes los meses de verano, sin embargo, como en su región hay un fuerte sol durante el día, sus ganancias se mantienen estables, lo que ha convertido a este negocio en un sostén económico muy importante para la familia. Sus planes para el futuro son de mejorar los utensilios y el equipo que utiliza para tener una mayor producción y de mejor calidad. Es la tercera vez que Josefina tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una de las socias más activas de su banco comunal y ahora renueva su compromiso de seguir trabajando en equipo y de manera responsable con sus pagos.
