El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de otra congeladora y nuevos moldes de helados.
texts.en:
Josefina is 55 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children in their own home. Along with her husband they have been making home made popsicles and ice cream for the last 6 years. They had the idea to start this business when they saw how much their kids enjoyed their popsicles, so since they had a freezer they just began to make them in larger quantities to undertake this business. She makes the popsicles every afternoon and lets them freeze until next day. Over the time she has acquired various popsicle molds, another freezer, and a large number of waffle cones for the ice cream.

She makes ice cream until 11am and then goes to distribute their products to schools near her home. She hires some people to help to sell the products, and pays them for their job. The most profitable time is during the summer, however, because in her region they get a strong sun during the day most of the year, her earnings are stable. It has transformed this business into a very important financial support for the family.

Her future plans are to improve her business tools and equipment to increase the production and improve the quality of the products. This is her third loan with MFP. She is one of the most active members of her community bank, and renews her commitment to continue working as a team and be responsible with her payments. The money she requested will be invested in the purchase of a freezer and popsicle molds.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a freezer and popsicle molds

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria, de 45 años, es una mujer muy sincera y honesta, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Raúl de 47 años y su querida hija Natalia de 12 años. Se dedica a la venta de productos alimenticios como la papa, quinua, oca, etc, en el mercado Manco Capac (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), es muy alegre y conversadora, por lo cual sus clientes prefieren comprarle a ella, además trabaja junto a su hija, quien le ayuda en todas las ventas que realiza. Maria disfruta mucho de conversar son sus vecinas de venta, mientras vende sus productos, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y lo que menos le gusta es que después de cada día de ventas termina muy sucia por la tierra de la papa. Para un futuro cercano, Maria desea tener una tienda donde pueda vender sus productos andinos y así de esa manera mejorar su calidad de vida para darle a su hija unos buenos estudios superiores. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos andinos para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Maria is 45 and is a very sincere and honest woman. She lives in her own home with her husband, Raúl, who is 47, and her beloved daughter, Natalia, who is12. She sells nutritious products like potatoes, quinoa, geese, etc., in the Manco Capac market (a very important market in the city of Juliaca). She is very happy and chatty, which is why her customers prefer to buy from her. She also works with her daughter, who helps her with all of the sales that she makes. Maria enjoys chatting with the people who have stands near her while she sells her products. She has done this work for 15 years. What she likes the least is that she gets dirty after every day of selling because of the dirt on the potatoes. In the near future, Maria hopes to have a stand where she can sell her Andean products and in this way improve her quality of life to give her daughter a higher education. This is her fourth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she is willing to make all of her payments on time because she doesn't want to cause any problems with her communal bank, where she is very loved by the other members. With the 1,000 PEN she is requesting, she will buy more Andean products to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: A And J Group

texts.en:
Here are Jariatu J., M’mah B., Mariatu K., and Isatu S. of the A and J group. These women are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni City, in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of Le 1,200,000 for each to enable them to expand their businesses.

Jariatu J. (right) is the leader of this group. Jariatu is thirty-two years of age. She was born in Sanda village, northeast of Makeni. She is married to a government health officer and they have four children. Two of their children are in secondary school, one in primary school and the last is still young. This will be the third loan Jariatu and members of her group are accessing from SMT. With previous loans, she has seen a vast improvement in her business. She sells provisions – milk, sugar, butter, margarine, mayonnaise, etc. She also sells rice. Mariatu has been in this business for six years now.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth started her own food business selling bites one year ago. She is a 44-year-old woman, married and the mother of five children. Her children are 26, 21, 20, 15, and 8 years old. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 90,000 Tanzanian shillings. Elizabeth is a member of the Uamsho borrower group. 

This is Elizabeth's first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She requested 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more commodities like wheat and cooking oil for her business. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Elizabeth hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for a food business

loans.name: Nachaat

texts.en: Nachaat is a 34-year-old single man. He has owned a car repair shop since 1994 to earn income to help satisfy his needs. With this long experience, Nachaat is requesting to borrow $1,000 to renovate his tools in order to attract more clients and increase his income.

loans.use: Renovate his tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase four cattle

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Francisco M. es padre de familia, tiene tres hijos adolescentes que actualmente estudian.
Con dos créditos anteriores de  FVP ha construido dos cuartos, pero le falta colocarle el techo. Tiene el proyecto de construir una losa de concreto para que la casa sea más segura y duradera.
El está solicitando un préstamo para esa construcción y planea pagarlo con sus ingresos de mecánico automotriz de una compaña.
Su deseo es que sus hijos tengan su propio cuarto y una casa mejor don de vivan.
texts.en:
Sr. Francisco M. is a family man who has three teenage children who are currently studying. With his two previous loans from FVP, he built two rooms but is still missing a roof. His current project involves constructing a concrete slab to make his house more secure and durable.

He is requesting a loan for this construction and plans to repay this loan from his earnings as an auto mechanic. Sr. Francisco hopes to give his children their own room and a better home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a concrete slab

loans.name: Siempre Amigas Group

texts.es: Grupo conformado por doce señoras muy alegres y esperanzadas por el capital que se les brinda. Su edades entre la mayoría oscila entre 30 a 50 años y socias jóvenes entre 19 a  30 años. Su presidenta del banco comunal, Irene tiene dos hijos  que estudian en colegios fiscales, uno de ellos  cursa el 9mo de primaria y el otro hijo 1do de secundaria. La tesorera Jenny que cuenta con dos hijos, las señoras están muy contentas con el trabajo que realizan. La presidenta tiene el negocio su  kiosco propio donde vende comida rápida, salchipapas, hamburguesas,  las demás socias se dedican a la venta de comida, tejido de mantas, y venta de víveres, entre otros  la tesorera de profesión profesora de nivel primario. No tiene mucha competencia en la venta de comida por motivo del lugar donde se encuentra, la tesorera  no tiene competencia en el área. El destino del crédito en la mayoría de las socias es para la compra de mercadería y tener su propio local de venta. Este grupo está emprendiendo su sexto ciclo. La mayoría de ellas se conocen entre sí y no tuvieron  ninguna dificultad en la cancelación de cuotas.

loans.use: INCREMENTO DE CAPITAL DE TRABAJO

loans.name: Women Tie Your Wist Group

texts.en:
Larwuo M. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called "Women Tie Your Wist."  She is 40 years old and a widow with three children ages 3-13, in kindergarten to fifth grade. She is illiterate due to poverty.  Larwuo and her children lives in Ziggida, a small town close Zorzor, a district in Lofa county, northern Liberia.

Larwuo sells rice. She buys rice wholesale from farmers and sells retail by the cup to residents.  She has been in business for three year and hopes to improve her sales.  Larwuo treats her customers well so they continue buying from her.

During the Liberian civil crisis, Larwuo lost her husband and her hopes and dream were shattered with the burden and poverty.  She kept her focus and was motivated by the need to take care of her children.  Larwuo needs this loan in order to purchase more rice to improve her sales.  She dreams of educating her children and building them a house.

loans.use: Purchase more rice wholesale to resell.

loans.name: Nassulu

texts.en:
Mr. M. Nassulu is a promissory man who is twenty-eight years old. He owns a grocery shop located in the Kabwohe trading centre, and he has been in the business for over eight years. He will use this loan to purchase grocery items (sweets, drinks, soap, smearing jelly, glucose, etc.) to sell. He wants to invest in purchasing more stock so that he can get more profit from his business.

He is married to one wife who normally helps him in case he is not around. They are blessed with one child too. His business dream is to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items (sweets, drinks, soap, smearing jelly, glucose, etc.) to sell

loans.name: Elysée

texts.fr: A. Elysée est née le 28 Octobre 1979 et est mariée à DOSSOU-GOIN Bienvenu, un menuisier. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et vivant avec eux. La famille vit à Dogoudo à Allada, dans le département de l’Atlantique au Bénin, depuis 12 ans.  Elysée supporte avec son mari les charges de la famille. Elysée n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a 3 ans que Elysée vend de l’agouti à Allada. C’est aussi à Allada que  Elysée s’approvisionne. Elysée a bénéficié une fois de crédit à ALIDé et l’a bien remboursé. Elysée souhaite agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire plus sa clientèle. C’est pourquoi Elysée sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Elysée was born on October 28, 1979 and is married to DOSSOU-GOIN Bienvenu, a furniture maker. The couple has three children who are all in school and living with them. The family has been living in Dogoudo in Allada, in Atlantique county, Benin, for twelve years. Along with her husband, Elysée provides for her family. Elysée has not gone to school. For three years, she has been selling agoutis in Allada. She once benefited from an ALIDé loan and has repaid it. She wishes to expand her commerce in order to satisfy her customers further. This is why she’s requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy agoutis

loans.name: Baltazara

texts.es:
La señora BALTAZARA R. R. D. Z. tiene 39 años, cuenta con estudios secundarios completos, es casada, tiene 3 hijos quienes dependen econòmicamente D. ella y vive en el distrito D. EL PORVENIR, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad – Perú. 
Pertenece al Banco Comunal LIDERESAS EN ACCIÒN.   
Baltazara se dedica a  la  compra y venta D. ropa y con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles comprò ropa  para caballeros, damas y niños.
Con su próximo crédito D. 800.00 nuevos soles viajarà a Lima y comprarà pantalones, jeans, polos, blusas, camisas, shorts, etc. para cubrir los pedidos que tiene por fiestas D. fin D. año.
Ella sueña con alquilar un stand en un mercado o centro comercial para así vender su mercadería con mayor facilidad y rapidez.
texts.en:
Mrs. Baltazara R. R. D. Z. is 39 years old, completed high school, and is married with three dependent children. She lives in El Porvenir District, Trujillo Province, La Libertad Department, Peru. She ia a member of the "Lideresas En Accion" ("Female Leaders in Action") Village Bank. Baltazara buys and sells clothing for a living. With her first loan of 300 Peruvian Soles, she bought men's, women's and children's clothing. With this loan of 800 Soles, she will travel to Lima to buy pants, jeans, t-shirts, blouses, button-up shirts and shorts to fill all of the orders she has received for end-of-the-year parties. Her dream is to rent a stand at a market or commercial center in order to sell her merchandise more quickly and easily.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pants, jeans, t-shirts, blouses, button-up shirts and shorts

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is twenty-eight years old and divorced. He has three children who are all currently in school. He lives with his children in a rented apartment in a tourist attraction community in the central region of Ghana. The community is one of the coastal towns in Ghana where the major occupation of the people is fishing.

Michael trades in hardware such as electrical goods. He sells in a store by the roadside in his community. He procures his goods from Accra. Michael has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase his stock.

loans.use: To buy electrical goods in bulk

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 34 years old and married with four children. She is a Bini by tribe and she lives in Benin City. Her husband is an architect.

Victoria sells drinks and groceries at retail prices to her customers. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future.

Victoria needs a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more drinks and groceries to sell. She says a big thank you to Kiva lenders.

Victoria is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 30 years old and married, with a four-year-old child, who is already attending school. She is a dairy farmer in the Murang'a area of the Central Province of Kenya and has been farming for three years. She says that the main challenges to her business are the cost of veterinary services now and then and having only a small amount of acreage on which to plant fodder (animal feed). 

She successfully completed a previous loan through Juhudi Kilimo for Kes 30,000 and has requested this loan to purchase dairy goats. Her family will use the goat milk for consumption so that all the cow's milk can be sold for a better overall income. In the future, she would like to have at least two cows and three dairy goats. She says that Juhudi has helped her acquire her first asset, which calved to a heifer, and that she is very grateful.

About Juhudi Kilimo

Juhudi Kilimo is a for-profit social enterprise focused on the economic development of Kenya. It has a unique approach to financing agribusiness value chains, from production of raw products to processing and delivery of goods: by providing asset financing and technical assistance funding to smallholder farmers and rural enterprises. This approach to poverty alleviation supports sustainable wealth creation in rural communities, establishes local engines of income generation, and generates employment, economic growth and dynamism as well as demand for inputs.

loans.use: To buy dairy goats.

loans.name: Ioe

texts.en:
Ioe S. is 50 and married with 8 children (ages 12 - 28).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Ioe has 4 years of experience in this business.  Ioe needs a loan of WST $1800 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 tala or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.  This is her 4th loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Ioe's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Ioe S. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.3 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.4 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.4 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15"

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando es un padre de familia de 35 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus cinco menores hijos en el sector Colector, una zona rural del distrito de San José, ubicado a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Lleva mas de 14 años viviendo en la zona y desde ese entonces se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas. Posee un terreno de cultivo donde usualmente siembra alfalfa para venderla a los acopiadores que llegan a la zona, pero en esta ocasión ha decidido sembrar tomate. El cultivo ya está instalado y el se encuentra trabajando arduamente para asegurarse una buena producción.

Orlando desea brindarle mantenimiento a su cultivo, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que  piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes.

El es un padre muy entregado a su familia, es trabajador y honrado. Su mayor anhelo es brindarle a sus hijos una educación de calidad. Ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Orlando is a 35 year old father who lives with his wife and five young children in the Colector sector which is a rural area in the San José district located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He has lived in this area for the past 14 years working as an agricultural laborer. He has a plot of land where he usually plants alfalfa to sell to local venders, but this time he has decided to plant tomatoes. The seeds have been planted and he is working hard to ensure a good production. Orlando would like to maintain his land, and for this reason he is soliciting a loan of 1500 Nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy fertilizers. He is a father who is very committed to his family. He is a hard and honorable worker. His greatest wish is to give his children a quality education. He has worked previously with our institution and has proved to be a client who is punctual and responsible in his repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers in order to maintain a tomato crop

loans.name: Edmi

texts.es:
Edmi trabaja como comerciante y su esposo tiene un vehiculo que trabaja como minibús.
La señora le ayuda a su esposo con su trabajo en los recorridos de minibús.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de la Paz, donde tienen su casa propia.
El crédito será destinado para capital de inversión (mantenimiento completo de su minibús).
Es cliente antiguo de Impro. Su historial la califica como cliente bueno en  el pago se sus cuotas, demostrando responsabilidad ya que  con este crédito podrá mejorar sus ingresos y condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Edmi works as a trader and her husband works as a minibus driver with a vehicle that he owns. She helps her husband with his work on the shuttle routes. She lives the Tembladerani neighborhood in the city of La Paz, where she owns her own home. This loan will be used for capital investment (to do a complete maintenance on the minibus.) She is an old client of IMPRO. Her record as a client qualifies her for this loan, based on the responsibility she has demonstrated with her payments. This loan will improve her income and quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to cover the cost of doing maintenance on her minibus

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is 28 years old, married with two children as well as two dependents that are between 2 and 18 years old.  Jeanne is in the business of selling new clothes, mainly men's shirts.  The hours of her business are from 8 am to 8 pm every day. 

Jeanne is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business by adding a variety of products such as jeans and women's clothes.  With this business expansion, Jeanne will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn, will allow her to build a secure future for her children and keep her business sustainable.

loans.use: Adding new varieties of clothing to store inventory

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Chap

texts.en: Mrs. C., 52, plants a variety of crops on farmland she owns. She harvests and sells the crops when they come to maturity and typically earns around $4 USD per day. She lives in a commune in Battambang Province, with her husband who works with her in the field. The couple are good parents to their four children, two of whom are now married and two of whom are single. With the farming season coming, Mrs. C. doesn’t have enough supplies for her field, so she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, insecticide and crop seed for a better harvest.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide and crop seed

loans.name: Salma's Group

texts.en:
Salma, a resident of the mid-sized city of Riwind, Pakistan, owns a two-room house and has been living in it with her family for over 17 years. Her husband's name is H.. He is drives a rickshaw (local three-wheeled motor vehicle) and generates income for the family. 

A very caring lady, Salma stays at home, manages the household chores and cooks food for her family.  She is a mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. Her elder son works in a cotton factory on a monthly wage. The younger reads in the 5th standard and her daughter reads in the 2nd standard. Salma and her husband wish to give the kids a good education so they can make their future bright and can recognize the good and bad in their lives.
 
She is applying for a loan for the first time from Asasah to pay the remaining installments of her husband’s rickshaw so he can get clearance from the owner and becomes the owner of his own rickshaw.

loans.use: To pay the remaining installments for the rickshaw

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 20-year old man from Lebanon. He is living with his mother and younger sibling. In 2008, he opened his own call center where people from the neighboring areas come to make local or international calls. He is requesting a $2,000 loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new phones and improve his store.

loans.use: to purchase new phones and improve his store

loans.name: Anani Ablavé

texts.en: Anami A. is 48 years old and has a small restaurant in Lomé, called “L’Ange Bleu,” or “Blue Angel.” She takes care of her two children on her own. She’s only had her restaurant for a year and is requesting her first microloan from WAGES of 300,000 CFA to purchase supplies and food for her restaurant.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her restaurant

loans.name: Salote Silafau

texts.en: Salote Salafau is 36 and married with seven children. She owns a business venture planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has many years of experience in this business. Salote needs a loan of WST 1,250 to invest in expanding her business. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or approximately USD 194 per week) to improve and expand her business. In 2008, Salote joined SPBD and this is her 2nd loan. SPBD's loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD: In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and, since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates about SPBD.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John G. Ndung’u  is thirty-six years old and married, but he does not have any children yet. His business is located by the roadside near  a primary school in Nairobi and is well known by the name Beba beba Hardware. He has been selling cement, iron sheets, paint, wire mesh, and other items. He sells to the local people and also to walk-ins from far from where his business is located. 

John has been doing this business for six months  now and has two employees. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 50,000 to buy more cement and rafters to sell to builders and meet the large demand. He hopes to be a wholesaler in the future. He is very hardworking, patient and determined.

loans.use: Cement and rafters

loans.name: Shoirjon

texts.en: I. Shoirjon is a young man who has dedicated himself to the livestock industry from his childhood. He has been characterized as a very spirited and strong person whose successes are directly applied to his young family, composed of his wife and three children. The work Shoirjon does is through the raising of livestock for eventual sale. It is necessary to point out that this is the only income that supports his family and that they really need it. Today, Shoirjon looks for support from IMON International to obtain the necessary loan to purchase more cows to raise. With this loan, his beloved family will benefit as much as he will. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase more calves to raise and sell

loans.name: C7168 Twisungane Group

texts.en:
Odette is 33 years old and the leader of a group called Twisungane.  Odette and her team sell a variety of goods in the shop and they have been in this business for a long time. Their business hours are from early in the morning until late in the evening.

Odette and her team need to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. This loan will hopefully allow them to expand their business by purchasing a large quantity of foodstuffs.  With this additional business, they really hope that their profits will increase, which in turn will allow them to create some other sources of income for better financial stability in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of goods to sell.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Mainique”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Mainique, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Irene; ella tiene 34 años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  trabajo de venta de artesanías y venta de verduras, ella realiza los dos negocios, la venta de artesanía lo realiza en las ferias que hay en la provincia de Urubamba y la venta de verduras la realiza en el mercado de Urubamba desde las 5:00a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m, por medio de estos pequeños negocios saca adelante a su hijo, ella quiere tener un puesto para vender las verduras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  artesanía y para comprar verduras como tomate, zapallo, zanahorias y lechuga al por mayor.
 
 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Irene, 34, is a single mother of one child. She alternates her daily activities with crafts and vegetable sales. She carries out both businesses. She sells the crafts at Urubamba’s provincial markets and she sells the vegetables in Urubamba’s market from 5am until 4pm. These small businesses allow her to support her son. She wants to have a stall in which to sell the vegetables. She is asking for funds to buy crafts and to buy vegetables like tomatoes, pumpkin, carrots and lettuce at wholesale. She is a member of the “Mainique” communal bank located in Mainique district, Urubamba province, Cusco department. She avails herself of this forum to thank all those who share in her dream and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She needs funds to buy crafts and to buy vegetables like tomatoes, pumpkin, carrots and lettuce at wholesale.

loans.name: Francisca Elizabeth

texts.es:
Francisca resiD. en Concepción Batres, departamento D. Usulután, tiene 35 años y vive junto a su familia, es madre soltera D. 4 hijos D. las edades 14, 13, 8 y 1 año, las dos hijas mayores le ayudan a desarrollar el trabajo que ella realiza que es la producción y venta D. lácteos, el negocio lo inicio hace 12 años con el apoyo D. una vecina para quien Francisca trabajaba, así logro colocar su propio negocio y lo atienD. todos los días sin horario fijo.
Francisca tiene la necesidad D. adquirir utensilios necesarios para el proceso D. producción y comprar la leche por cantidades mayores pero no cuenta con el dinero para dicha inversión, por lo que solicita un préstamo para poder solucionar su situación, con este préstamo ella compara los útiles como depósitos donD. moldear sus productos y podrá aumentar su producción ya que estos utensilios le harán mas rápido y fácil el trabajo.
El sueño D. Francisca es crecer con el negocio darse a conocer con más personas, contar con la preferencia D. los clientes y mejorar el nivel D. vida D. su familia.
texts.en:
Francisca resides in Concepción Batres in the Department of Usulután. She is 35 years old, a single mother, and lives with her four children (ages 14, 13, 8, and 1). Her two oldest daughters help with her business producing and selling dairy products. Francisca started her business twelve years ago with the help of a neighbor for whom she worked. She was able to establish her own business and manages it every day without being on a fixed schedule.

Francisca needs to acquire the necessary utensils for processing the milk that she buys in large quantities. However, she does not have the money needed to make this investment. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to resolve this situation. She plans to buy equipment, such as molds for shaping her products, so that she can increase her output. These tools will make it faster and easier for her to work.

Francisca dreams of growing her business until she becomes recognized among more people. This will allow her to be a preferred vendor among her customers and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase equipment needed to increase her output

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba A. is married and takes care of six dependents. Her husband is a cleaner. Aba buys maize in bags and sells it in small quantities at Abura. She is going to use the loan to buy extra bags of maize to supply her increasing customer base. Aba helps her husband with the income she makes from her sales. She plans on using the new profit to expand her business.

loans.use: buy extra bags of maize to supply her increasing customer base

loans.name: Kungeibai

texts.en:
Kungeibai T. is 41-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and school-aged daughter in their own ger, a traditional housing tent, in Bayan-Ulgiy province, western Mongolia.  His daughter is 8 years old and attends a local elementary school while his wife is currently employed as a servant for a private company with a monthly salary of 60,000MNT. 

Since 2005, he has been operating a welding service in his home and has gained a lot of experience. In his local town, there is not any welding service center; only individuals who do welding privately according to customers' orders. Over many years of operation, he has built his business to a consistent and stable level. His earnings have enabled him to start construction on his house and yard. 

In the future, he hopes to open his own auto repair center. Kungeibai is a hardworking man. He says, "After finishing my house construction, I will save my business earnings and open a bank savings account for my daughter in the future." He is requesting a 300,000 MNT loan to purchase necessary materials for his welding business.

loans.use: To purchase necessary materials for welding

loans.name: But's Group

texts.en:
The Preaek Ruessei village group in Kandal province consists of four members who make up a group loan. Mrs. But S. is the group leader.  She is 30 years old and has been selected by the other members, who use their portion of the loan for different ways to support their businesses. 

She and her husband, Mr. Sokhom Lorn, are farmers who own a four-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. He is also a  fisherman.  

Now is the time to grow rice in their field, but they did not have enough money to support their rice field. So, to improve production, Mrs. But S. is seeking a loan to hire farm laborers and oxen to plow her field. 

She is a mother of two children, one of whom is a student, while the other is 1 year old.

loans.use: To hire laborers and oxen to plow the field

loans.name: Jhon Angel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PROGRESO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Jhon Angel; el tiene 32 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de abogado, el tiene un estudio de abogado, el trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere mejorar en el trabajo. El  socio solicita el préstamo para el estudio de su hijo.


El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Progreso" (Progress).  The bank is located in Cusco District, which belongs to Cusco Province and Cusco Department.

The member is Sr. Jhon Angel.  He is 32 years old, married and has 3 children.  The member rotates his daily activities with work as a lawyer.  He has an office where he works from 8:00 a.m until 5:00 p.m.  Through his business, he has been able to enable his children to get ahead.  He wants to improve in his work.  He is requesting the loan for his son's education.

The member thanks all those who are helping to make this dream come true, and he promises to comply with the established re-payment timetable.

loans.use: The member is soliciting the loan for his son's education.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José, tiene 39 años de edad, reside en San Simón, departamento de Morazán, vive con su familia conformada por su esposa y tres hijos, francisco de 18 años, José de 13 y Lucia de 2 años de edad; don José se dedica a la construcción de viviendas desde hace 15 años, con el horario de 6:00am a 3:00pm, el comenzó como ayudante de albañil, pero fue muy aplicado lo que le permitió aprender y volverse un albañil.
Hoy día esta con la idea de mejorar su casa, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar los materiales, también quiere comprar un taladro y una pulidora ya que son herramientas necesarias para la construcción y con los que él no cuenta pero que a través del préstamo lograra contar con ellos.
Su objetivo es cancelar puntualmente el préstamo, realizar una buena inversión  y velar por todo lo necesario para su hogar.
texts.en:
José is 39 years old.  He lives in San Simón, in Morazán department with his family; his wife and three children: 18 year-old Francisco, 13 year-old José and 2 year-old Lucia.  José has worked as a builder for 15 years.  He works from 6.00am to 3.00pm.  He started out as an assistant builder but worked very hard which allowed him to learn and become a builder.

Right now he would like to improve his house which is why he is requesting a loan.  He would like to buy building materials and also a drill and a polisher which are the tools he needs for the work but doesn't currently have.  He will acquire them with this loan.

José's goal is to repay his loan on time, make a good investment and look after his family's needs.

loans.use: To buy building materials to improve his house.  To buy tools.

loans.name: Chynara Ibragimova's Group

texts.en:
Chynara I. is the leader of this group. She is 32, married, and has three daughters and a son. Seven years ago, with an initial investment of 30,000 KGS, Chynara and her husband started to breed livestock. Reselling livestock after fattening they earn 6,000 KGS per month. Chynara hopes to obtain this loan because she needs money to purchase a washing-machine in order to improve her living conditions. In the future, she wants to increase her number of livestock to be able to support her children financially.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase a washing machine

loans.name: Sara Del Rosario

texts.es: Sara Del Rosario tiene 21 años, su actividad es la venta de repuestos de bicicletas y motocicletas. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio, lo inicio por la necesidad que demandaba el pueblo porque no existía este tipo de servicio que ella ofrece, tiene un hijo menor de 5 años que está a su cargo. Su esposo le ayuda con la atención a sus clientes que llegan diariamente. El crédito es para la compra de llantas, rines, asientos, pedales, cadenas entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Sara Del Rosario is 21 years old.  Her business activity is selling spare parts for bicycles and motorbikes.  She has had this business for more than 5 years.  She started her business because people needed it and were asking for it.  The type of service she offers did not exist before.

Sara has a 5 year-old son in her care.  Her husband helps her to serve the customers who come to her store every day.  She will use her loan to buy tires, wheels, seats, pedals, chains, and other parts.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran is a caring lady who operates a sewing business at her home to supplement the income of her family. She sews clothes for neighboring customers and earns income. She is an expert in her work and can sew designer and non-designer dresses easily. Her quality work helps her to attract many customers, and she receives regular orders every month. 

She lives in Pakpattan, which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan, and known for its agriculture industry. She owns a two-room brick house, where she has been living with her family for the past 15 years.  

She is married to M. A., who is a painter by profession and paints houses and buildings on contract.

Sughran has two sons and two daughters. Her eldest son is a welder, while the others stay at home and don’t do anything.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy paint boxes of different shades, along with paintbrushes, which will help him to produce quality work and to maximize his profits.
  
Sughran is hopeful that an investment will be a good step towards the positive growth of her husband’s business. She is a regular loan user of Asasah, and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has proven herself a responsible client who always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady with the book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sughran.

loans.use: To buy paint boxes and paintbrushes for a painting business

loans.name: El Manguito Group

texts.es:
Señora María Dora Gonzales Pérez, vive en la localidad de Benito Juárez, Municipio de Copainala Estado de Chiapas México. Es cada con el señor   Sergio Zea González con quien procreo dos hijos y son: Blanca Imelda de veinti un años de edad, el otro es Felipe Javier de diesi nueve años.

       Ella es la primera vez que solicita  un préstamo y es para invertirlo en la cosecha de café ya que tiene que pagar personal paraqué se lo trasladen a su casa cuando es la cosecha, comenta  que esta actividad es muy buena ya que le deja buenos ingresos dentro de su familia.

      Lo que lo inspiro a realizar este trabajo es que desde que muy   joven sus padres le enseñaron atrabajar con la cosecha  de café y cuando se caso le dieron un pequeño cafetal de la cual pueda disponer y gracias adiós lleva  veinticinco años con su rancho que la apoya en todo.

     De la ganancia que obtiene de cada venta lo invierte en la misma actividad para mandar a limpiar su cafetal, para que cuando venga la cosecha este limpio y  así su personal pueda trabajar a gusto.

     Lo que ella desea es que logre seguir trabajando hasta que Dios le preste vida y así darle lo mejor a sus hijos para que terminen una profesión.

    María Dora se integro al grupo una invitación que le hizo la señora máxima a que se uniera a su grupo para solicitar un préstamo,  en donde ella también pueda trabajar. Su grupo se llama el manguito la razón del nombre es por que donde de hace la reunión ay un árbol de mango.

      Las personas que integran el grupo son las siguientes:

    Máxima Pérez Sánchez: compra de ganado para pie de cría, como también la engorda de marrano para después venderlo.

    María del Rosario C. A.: invierte el préstamo en la compra de marranos  para engordarlo y liego venderlo por quilo, como también la venta de pollos de rancho.

    María Dora González Pérez: invertirá el préstamo en la compra y venta de productos garigolas, como es el café.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Dora Gonzales Pérez lives in Benito Juárez, in the Municipal of Copainala and state of Chiapas, Mexico. 

She is married to Mr. Sergio Zea González with whom she has two children: Blanca Imelda, 21 years old, Felipe Javier, 19 years old.

This is her first loan and she is using it to invest in the coffee harvest. She has to pay staff so that they can transfer the crop to her house when it is harvested. She says that this activity is very good as it brings in a good income for their family.

What inspires her to do this work is from a very young age her parents taught her to harvest coffee and when she married they gave her a small coffee plantation of her own. She thanks God for this ranch because it has fully supported her for 25 years.

The profit she makes from each sale is invested in this work, to clean her plantation, so that when the harvest comes in it is clean and the staff can work comfortably.

She wants to continue working as long as God gives her life, so that she can provide the best for her children and they finish a career. 

María Dora was invited to join this group by Mrs. Máxima, who brings this group together to request loans, so she can also work. Her group is called "el manguito" (mango) because they all meet by a mango tree. 

The following people make up this group:

    Máxima Pérez Sánchez: using the loan to purchase cattle for breeding, as well as fattening pigs and then selling them.

    María del Rosario C. A.: using the loan to buy pigs to fatten and then sell by the kilo, as well as sell chicken.

    María Dora González Pérez: using the loan to purchase and sell agricultural products, such as coffee.

loans.use: Staff working at the ranch harvesting coffee to then sell.

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married and has two children. One of his parents lives with his family and he is the only provider. In 2007, Haidar opened his own food market to improve his family's standard of living. He is well known in his community and has a good reputation.

Haidar is requesting a $2500 loan to renovate his shop. He wants to pave the shop and paint it. He is working on developing his business.

loans.use: To renovate the shop

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza, tiene 38 años de edad, tiene dos hijos, ella nació en la ciudad de Maranura de la provincia de la Convención y actualmente vive en la ciudad de Urubamba. Maritza es docente y trabaja en el colegio de Marjco y también tiene un pequeño negocio que consiste en brindar servicio de llamadas a celulares. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Maritza en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para uso personal y tambien para comprar celulares. 

Maritza pertenece al banco comunal “Mainique” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Maritza is 38 years old and has two children.  She was born in the city of Maranura in Convención Province, but she now lives in the city of Urubamba.  Maritza is a teacher and works at the Marjco School.  She also has a small business providing call services through land lines and mobile phones.  Maritza has managed this business for several years and has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her work.  She is taking this opportunity to request a loan for personal use.

Maritza is a member of the Communal Bank “Mainique” which is part of Asociación Arariwa.  She is grateful for the opportunity being given to her and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase cell phones

loans.name: God's Grace Group

texts.en:
This is the second loan that Munda and his group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of their previous Kiva loan, they were be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. Having completed repaying their previous loan successfully, they are again requesting a new loan of SLL 3,100,000 in order to further expand their businesses. 

Munda T. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Born thirty-nine years ago in the town of Matru Johng, Munda is married and has five children.  For four years now, Munda has been selling house-building materials – cement, iron-rods, paint, etc. Munda will use his share of the loan (SLL 800,000) to expand his business; he will buy house-building materials in large quantity to add to his business inventory.

loans.use: Buy house-building materials in large quantity to add to his business inventory.

loans.name: Senayda Maria

texts.es: Este cliente es originario de  la mina del limón y se dedica a impartir clase de primaria tiene 22 años de trabajar es este lugar y ella es casada con tres hijos los cuales están bajo su cargo y está en la etapa de estudiar y ella con el fin de crearle mejores condiciones de vida  a sus hijos y a su vivienda le va ha cambiar techo y así  no tener problema en el invierno .y ella con el apoyo de su marido ha venido preparando académicamente a sus hijos, los que actualmente están estudiando en el colegio de la comunidad, esta maestra su recorrido lo efectua por la mañana para estar puntual en su trabajo, esta cliente anteriomente fue fiadora aquí en la empresa, actualmente esta solicitando financiamiento atravez  del convenio con el colegio jose de la cruz mena de la mina el limón.
texts.en:
The client is originally from La Mina del Limon and teaches primary school. She has taught here for 22 years. She is married with 3 school-aged children in her care.  With the goal of improving their living conditions, she wants to change the roof so that they don't have problems in the rainy season. 

With her husband's help, she has helped her kids to prepare academically, and they are currently studying in the local high school.  She teaches during the morning shift so that she can be on time to work.  Previously she guaranteed a loan with this business.  Currently she is asking for financing via the agreement with the high school Jose de la Cruz Mena.

loans.use: To improve the kitchen and roof, and buy cement, sand, tin roofing, rafter beams and labor

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: La señora Irma es originaria de la población llama Zitacuaro, ella esta casada con el señor Ulises el cual es chofer de transporte publico, doña Irma se dedica a vender zapatos por catalogo de niños, damas y caballeros de diferentes marcas. Y esta pidiendo un préstamo para la compra de zapatos de diferentes tamaños, modelos para tener en existencia, ella tiene con este tipo de negocio hace 6 años y comenta que empezó con este negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de sus hijos que en ese entonces todavía vivían con ellos. Dice que ella surte sus zapatos en diferentes tiendas en México, Toluca y dice que se los vende a sus vecinas y conocidas. La meta que tiene con el negocio de venta de zapato por catalogo es rentar un local y ser un distribuidor autorizado para así vender un  poco mas de ingresos.
texts.en:
Señora Irma is a native of the population center called Zitacuaro. She is married to Señor Ulises who is a public transportation driver. Doña Irma sells various brands of children's, ladies' and men's shoes by catalog. 

She is asking for a loan to purchase shoes in various sizes and models with which to stock her business. She has had this business for six years and mentions that she started it in order to help her husband with expenses for the children who still lived with them at that time. She says she supplies shoes to various shops in Toluca, Mexico as well as selling them to her neighbors and acquaintances. Her goal is to rent a commercial site and be an authorized distributor in order to sell a little more and bring in more earnings.

loans.use: sell footwear by catalog.

loans.name: Ket

texts.en:
Ket S., 35 years old, owns a wooden kiosk in the community, Reussey Keo commune, where she sells food for people who need to have a snack for evening time. She typically makes around $3.50 of profit each day to meet her family needs. She was married, but divorced her husband when her two kids were very young. Although she is now a single woman, she is a fantastic mother who has tried to send all her kids to school. 

Ket S. will be using this Kiva loan to add to her savings to purchase a second motorbike to replace her old one which often needs to be repaired.

loans.use: to purchase a second motorbike to replace the old one.

loans.name: Emalia

texts.en: Emalia currently sells beer.  She is 30 years old and married, with 2 children, one of whom attends school. Emalia took out a loan to stock more beer to sell. She hopes to open a big shop in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: To stock more beer to sell.

loans.name: Maria Filomena

texts.es:
María llegó a la ciudad hace 20 años viuda y en condiciones de desplazamiento con su hija, de 9 años de edad y se radicó en el barrio los Ángeles del Municipio de Soledad, a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla; siendo pionera en el sector, consiguió un quiosco en una avenida principal, donde inició su negocio de venta de cervezas, refrescos y fritos;  hace un año, decidió seguir con su actividad es su casa vendiendo los mismos productos por cajas a vecinos del sector y a esa actividad agregó la venta queso que le envían desde Sincelejo un municipio ganadero  ubicado al noroeste del país, en la Costa Caribe colombiana. Maria en su negocio   vende al mes 64 cajas de cerveza que compra directamente del camión  que distribuye en todos los sectores ; en  su  mayoría sus ventas son de contado y en el momento solo  le adeudan 3 canastas del líquido y cada dia aumentas sus clientes;  para su negocio  de queso  a ella le envían desde Sincelejo  150 libras  cada quince días, producto que  vende a crédito pues tiene clientes que le pagan semanalmente.
En la actualidad Maria está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará cajas de cerveza y queso que tiene encargado por clientes fijos a los cuales debe responder oportunamente, para que no lo compren a otros vendedores. Su mayor desafío es la lluvia incesante que disminuye las ventas especialmente las de refrescos y bebidas,  como gaseosas y cervezas, pero como está finalizando el fenómeno de la Niña, sus perspectivas aumentan y se siente muy contenta. Su meta principal es hacer crecer su negocio para poder ofrecerle a su hija el mayor bienestar posible y sobre toda una educación de calidad, pues en el futuro la va a necesitarla para ser exitosa.
texts.en:
María came to the city 20 years ago as a widow.  She moved with her nine year old daughter to the Ángeles neighborhood in the Soledad municipality.  It is 15 minutes from the city of Barranquilla.  Being a pioneer in the area, she obtained a kiosk on a main avenue.  This is where, one year ago, she started her business of selling beer, soft drinks, and fried food. 

She decided to continue her business activity at her house.  She sells the same products by the case to her neighbors in the zone.  She added selling cheese to her business.  The cheese is sent to her from Sincelejo, a ranching municipality in the northeastern part of the country.  It is on the Caribbean coast of Colombia.

In her business Maria sells 64 cases of beer a month.  She buys directly from the truck that distributes to all of the sectors.  Most of her sales are for cash, and now her customers owe her for only three cases of beverages. Each day she gets more customers.

For her cheese business she is sent 150 pounds of cheese every two weeks from Sincelejo.  She sells this product on credit, and her customers pay her weekly.

Maria is currently applying for her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to buy cases of beer and cheese.  She has orders from her fixed customers, and she needs to respond in a timely fashion so that they do not buy from other sellers.

Her biggest challenge is the incessant rain that makes sales go down, especially the drinks like soft drinks and beer.  However, as the phenomena of La Niña is ending, her outlook for the future is improving, and she is very content.

Her main goal is to have her business grow in order to offer her daughter as much prosperity as possible.  Above all, she wants to give her daughter a quality education.  She will need that in the future in order to be successful.

loans.use: to fill orders she has for beer and cheese.

loans.name: Lida

texts.es: Lida, de 42 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Fernando de 42 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El negocio de Lida es la venta de ropa, todos los días camina hasta la casa de sus compradores, a quienes entrega las prendas que le han solicitado con anterioridad, ella es una vendedora muy alegre y siempre atiende a sus compradores con una sonrisa en los labios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene para elegir su horario de trabajo, ya que también tiene que dedicarles tiempo a sus queridos hijos, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar la ropa que vende, ya que la trae desde la ciudad de Lima. Para el futuro, espera poner una tienda donde pueda vender su mercadería con más tranquilidad. Este será su séptimo crédito con MFP, por tanto espera su colaboración de todos ustedes para poder cumplir sus objetivos. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y activa. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ropa para así poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de  prendas para escoger.
texts.en:
Lida is 42 years old.  She is a very kind and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 42 year-old Fernando, and her four beloved children who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.

Lida's business is selling clothes.  Every day she walks to her customers' houses to deliver the clothes that they have previously requested from her.  She is a very cheerful saleswoman who always serves her customers with a smile on her face.  What Lida most enjoys about her work is the freedom that she has to choose her own working hours since she also has to make time for her beloved children.  Lida has been in this business for five years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting the clothes that she sells since she brings them from the city of Lima.  In the future, she hopes to set up a store where she can sell her merchandise more peacefully.

This will be Lida's seventh loan from MFP.  She hopes that you will all will work with her to help her achieve her goals.  Lida is a very cheerful and active member of her community bank.  She will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy more clothes so that she can offer her customers larger variety of clothes to choose from.

loans.use: to buy more clothes so that she can offer more variety to her customers

loans.name: G.s. G.m.s Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario G.M.S  está conformado por dos integrantes José Antonio y Maria Ignacia, José Antonio se dedica  a la venta de pelibuey, hace mas de 4 años que tiene este negocio, el inicio este medio de vida cuando quedo desempleado y no tenía ingresos para su hogar,  no proporciona los suficientes ingresos para mantener a su familia es por esto que solicita este crédito para la compra de 3 pelibuey. Sueña con obtener su propio medio de transporte.
texts.en: The unified group G.M.S. is made up of two members, José Antonio and Maria Ignacia.  José Antonio has been selling pelibüey sheep for more than 4 years.  He started making a living this way when he was unemployed and didn't have a household income.  It doesn't however, provide enough income to maintain his family, so it is for this reason that he is requesting a loan to buy 3 pelibüey sheep.  His dream is to obtain his own means of transportation.

loans.use: purchase 3 pelibüey sheep.

loans.name: Lankeu

texts.en: Lankeu has been earning a living as a livestock farmer rearing sheep for the past seven years. A favourable climate and the availability of grazing land have afforded him a livelihood, and he has grown his business through a number of loans since he joined Faulu Kenya. Now requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more sheep, Lankeu hopes to become a large-scale farmer in five years so as to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Candelaria De Jesus

texts.es:
Candelaria, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta D. ropa, el negocio lo tiene en el mercado municipal donD. posee un puesto estable, ahí atienD. a toda su clientela.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. mercadería, ya que desea abastecer el negocio con ropa interior D. adultos y D. niños, ropa infantil y blusas, camisas para adultos, al comprar esta mercadería estará fortaleciendo el negocio, brindando un mejor servicio a los clientes.
Su objetivo es mejorar el negocio, contar con financiamientos que puedan ayudarla para alcanzar el crecimiento deseado, dándole a su familia una mayor seguridad por sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Candelaria lives with her husband and two children.  She sells clothes.  Her business is in the municipal market where she has a fixed stand where she tends to her clientele.

She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise.  She wants to stock the business with adult and children’s underwear, children’s clothes and shirts for adults.  Buying this merchandise will strengthen the business providing better customer service.

Her goal is to improve the business, to have financing that will help her reach the desired level of growth thus providing her family with more security thanks to the income.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
This is Manuel's first loan from both Fundación Alternativa and from Kiva. He will use the loan to buy building materials for the construction of his home. Manuel is a true beneficiary of micro-credit. He says that "because of their social condition, in the past his family wasn't able to apply for credit from traditional banks" and was therefore unable to improve their standard of living. He's extremely glad to be taking out his first loan from Fundación Alternativa and Kiva, and plans to repay his loan so that he can establish a good credit history and have access to larger amounts in the future.

Manuel lives and works in San Francisco de Quito, the capital city of Ecuador. Most commonly called Quito, the city is also known as “The Light of America” because it was the site of the first uprising against the Spanish and as the “Middle of the World,” because it straddles the equator. Quito is famous for the nearby active volcano Pichincha, its soaring altitude of 9,200 feet, and its beautiful downtown historical district, declared the first UNESCO Heritage Site in 1978.

Manuel is a hard-working 40-year-old entrepreneur. He lives with his two daughters and wife Maria (his younger daughter is in the above photo). For two years, Manuel has sold scrap-metal for a living. The entire family helps out with Manuel's scrap-metal business. He and Maria both are engaged in the work and occasionally his daughters help him with pick-ups. He's extremely busy in Quito, working 8 hours a day, Monday through Friday, and gathering the many disposable items that people leave on the street. He learned the business of selling scrap metal from former co-workers when he was a docksman (longshoreman).

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build his home.

loans.name: Diany

texts.es:
Diany es socia del  Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Progreso de Juli”, ubicado en el distrito de Juli, provincia Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 34 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene un hijo.  Cuenta con educación secundaria.
Hace siete años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos. Su préstamo inicial fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de artículos artesanales.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de  S/ 1000.00 nuevo soles, comprará bayetas, lanas para realizar sus bordados.  La señora lo vende en Juli, Puno y  trabaja sola, su esposo es personal de servicio.
Su sueño es tener su casa y su carro para poder trasladar su mercadería.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son  los dividendos de los ahorros, la facilidad del préstamo y de la cuenta interna.
texts.en:
Diany is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres al Progreso de Juli” which is located in the District of Juli, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 34 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has one child. Diany has a high school education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for seven years. Her first loan was in the amount of 300 PEN and the money was invested in her business of selling handcrafted items.

With this new loan of 1000 PEN, Diany will buy cloth and wool for making her embroideries. She sells her products in Juli and Puno. Diany works alone while her husband works as a service employee. Her dreams are to own a home and to buy a car for transporting her merchandise.

What she likes most about the Communal Bank are the interest from the savings, the convenience of the loan, and having access to the internal account.

loans.use: to buy cloth and wool for making embroideries.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 33 years old and married with two school-aged children. She lives in Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Rosemarie is a farmer who grows palay (unmilled rice) to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years on cloudy or even rainy days when necessary. Rosemarie earns 10,000 PHP a month which includes all permanent and impermanent sources. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2009 and has taken out five previous loans from the cooperative.

Rosemarie is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan from GDMPC to purchase fertilizer to facilitate crop growth. In the future, she hopes to have a good harvest and plans to apply appropriate pest-and-insect-fighters to avoid plant devastation. She furthermore aims to expand her business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia nació en el Valle Sagrado de los Incas en la ciudad de Calca, tiene 37 años de edad y tiene dos hijos. Virginia vive en la ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus diferentes actividades económicas, ella tiene un pequeño puesto de venta de ropa en el mercado de la ciudad de Calca. Ya es un año que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. 

En esta oportunidad Virginia requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como polos, pantalones, blusas, camisas y otras cosas más. Su sueño de Virginia es abrir una tienda pero que este bien implementada de ropa.   

El Banco Comunal “Milenium III” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad de Calca del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Virginia was born in the Sacred Valley of the Incas in the city of Calca.  She is 37 years old, and she has two children.  Virginia lives in the city where she was born, where she engages in different business activities.

She has a small stand where she sells clothes at the market in the city of Calca.  She has had the business for one year, and it is going very well for her.

At this time Virginia needs a loan to buy more merchandise like polo style shirts, pants, blouses, t-shirts, and other items.  Virginia’s dream is to open a store, one that is well stocked with clothes.

The Milenium III Communal Bank meets once a month in the city of Calca in the Cusco (Peru) department.  Cusco  is known for being a tourist and business area. It is also known for the traditional festival of Inti Raymi and for being the home of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise like polo style shirts, pants, blouses, t-shirts, and other items.

loans.name: Feryal

texts.en:
Feryal, a 45-year-old lady, has decided to participate in people's happy moments like weddings, baby showers, and even public holidays and religious events, where everyone celebrates with their families.
Using her talent in decorating, Feryal started making baskets and trays that are used in these events. She decorates them per her customers’ requests using the materials and fabrics they want (some chose feathers, other silk and so on).
Feryal has applied for this loan to buy new types of fabric and accessories to have more options when decorating these baskets. She is hoping that one day she would be able to open her store to sell in the market.

loans.use: To buy new types of fabric and accessories to have more options when decorating baskets

loans.name: Uilou

texts.en:
Uilou is 26 years of age and married, with two children. Uilou owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables.  She has 2 years of experience in this business. Uilou needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 100 talas or US $40 per week) to supplement her family's income.

In 2010, Uilou joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Uilou's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a widowed woman with three children who have completed school. She has a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are water and electricity bills. 

She has operated a meat goat selling business for the past four years; her potential clients are the people at the market. She faces a major challenge of transporting her goats to the market place. She dreams of being able to hire employees to help her with the running of her business.
	
With this loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase more goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu because it lends loans at a low interest rate.

loans.use: To purchase more goats for resale.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy is a single mother of five children aged 22-17 living in Hioma, Uganda. She owns a restaurant which she has been running for ten years. She faces a challenge of high rate of default and her dream is a big hotel in town. Daisy needs another loan to buy sodas and water for resale.

loans.use: to buy sodas and water for resale.

loans.name: Calexto

texts.en:
Calexto only finished his elementary level of education and did not have the chance to enter high school. Now, he is 37 years old and married, with four children. Calexto has managed his business raising hogs for 10 years.

Calexto is experiencing financial difficulties because he has four children who need to finance their daily allowances in school. He does not have enough capital to maintain his hogs. Calexto would like a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy feed for his hogs in order to continue his business. It would be a great help for him to maintain his business and bestow his children's needs in school.

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar is  33 years old, married, and a father of two children. He owns and runs a retail shop in Vikwatani, Mombasa and the business has been in operation for four years.

This marks Oscar’s third loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. With the money, he plans to purchase bales of maize and wheat flour, sugar, and margarine for his shop. 

With the anticipated profits he hopes to be able to repay back his KADET loan and to expand his business further. In the future, Oscar hopes to become a successful businessman in Mombasa and to have a big shop.

loans.use: to purchase bales of maize and wheat flour, sugar, and margarine for his shop

loans.name: Imani Group

texts.en:
Asbon is the facilitator of the Imani group. Asbon and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Asbon takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Asbon had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 10 ½ bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Asbon was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Asbon and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Asbon will educate his children and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Imani group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Asbon is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Uulkelsin

texts.ru:
Уулкелсин  32 года, замужем, воспитывает  четверых детей – 8,6,3 года , и младшей дочери – 7 месяцев. Уулкелсин, преподаватель по специальности, проработала в детском саду четыре года. Сейчас, находясь в декретном отпуске, Уулкелсин занимается животноводством и полеводством, что позволяет покрыть часть расходов ее семьи.  
Благодаря упорному труду Уулкелсин, ее хозяйство на сегодняшний день насчитывает две дойные коровы, двадцать баранов. Также, Уулкелсин  возделывает 1,44 га земли, где выращивает фасоль, картофель и многолетние травы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Уулкелсин обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетели. Доходы Уулкелсин планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, в будущем мечтает купить машину для семьи.
texts.en: Uulkelsin is 32 years old, married and is raising four children, who are eight, six and three years old, and the youngest daughter is seven months old.  Uulkelsin is a teacher and spent four years working at a kindergarten.  Currently, being on a maternity leave, she is involved in animal husbandry and farming, which allows her to cover some of her family's expenses.  Thanks to Uulkelsin's persistent work, today her business contains two dairy cows and twenty sheep.  Uulkelsin also works on 1.44 hectares of land, where she grows beans, potatoes and multi-year herbs.  In order to further develop her business, she requested a loan in the sum of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase a heifer.  Uulkelsin plans to invest the profits into increasing her livestock headcount further and dreams of buying a car for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 37 years old, married and has three school-age children. He is raising his family in a village, planting and harvesting corn and vegetables to sell. Despite the hardships in farming, they plan to educate their children and give them a bright future. Due to the high cost of school fees, they need to earn more income to support their schooling. 

They aim to improve their corn farming business to increase their yields and income. But due to inadequate capital, Michael is asking for an additional PHP 15,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and insecticides and to pay the labor costs required for corn production. They mentioned that this loan will be a great help for them to work out their plan and they hope that they will have a plentiful harvest.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and to pay labor costs

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.es: La señora Prudencia es artesana y realiza tejidos de mantas. El crédito lo requiere para  capital de trabajo, compra de lana de vicuña para elaborar las mantas y así también ponerlas a la venta. Prudencia  es soltera y tiene un hijo. Vive en casa alquilada ubicada en la zona de Alto Irpavi de la Ciudad de La Paz. Es la tercera vez que trabaja junto a kiva y es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2010.
texts.en: Prudencia is an artisan; she weaves blankets.  She needs the loan as working capital to buy vicuña wool to make the blankets to sell.  Prudencia is single and has a son.  She lives in a rented house located in the city of La Paz’s Alto Irpavi zone.  It’s the third time she’s worked with Kiva and she’s been an IMPRO client since 2010.

loans.use: to buy vicuña wool.

loans.name: Clotilde Isabel

texts.es:
Clotilde es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella vive en ica, una ciudad caracterizada por su clima cálido en cualquier época del año y conocida también por la laguna de Huacachina, considerada el Oasis de América; Clotilde aprendió lo que es ganarse el pan con le sudor de la frente desde muy joven ya que tuvo que trabajar desde niña para ayudar a sus padres porque tenían pocos recursos económicos.

Clotilde se dedica actualmente a la venta de gaseosas, golosinas, abarrotes, ella trabaja muy duro  le dedica a su labor alrededor de 8 horas diarias, ella considera que le va bien en su negocio debido a que atiende a sus clientes con mucho respeto y amabilidad, por ello siempre regresan a su negocio.

Clotilde está muy feliz con la ayuda brindada  por los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio (abarrotes, golosinas y con ello mejorara mucho ya que tendrá mas ingresos, mejorando su calidad de vida y permitiéndole seguir ahorrando para poder cumplir su sueño más grande: “Terminar de construir su vivienda”
